She buys animals like cows at these regional markets to resell in the San Juan Bautista Sunday Market in the city of Ayacucho.  Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, sugar, pasta, and soda. Maria dreams of opening a large store in her home, so that she won’t have to travel any more. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Maria es casada, tiene 55 años y 7 hijos, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región D. Ayacucho, 2 veces por semana en donD. venD. frutas, verduras, abarrotes y D. las ferias compra animales como ganado vacuno, que luego venD. en la feria D. San Juan Bautista. 
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, gaseosas. 
Maria sueña con tener una tienda granD. en su casa y no tener que viajar mas.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta. and soda

loans.name: Odiyi

texts.en: Odiyi N. is a hard-working young lady. She has a boutique where she sells male and female clothes, bags, and shoes. She has been in this business since 2005. She is a dedicated client of  LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She needs the loan amount of N140000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She hopes to increase her profit margin. She is 32 years old and single. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny E. D. G., tiene 50 años, vive en   La Urb. Libertad, Distrito Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Curso hasta 5to D. primaria, dejo los estudios debido a que se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 03 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. menú, inicio su negocio vendiendo verduras en un mercado donD. estuvo durante 25 años hasta que la botaron por ser ambulante, también con la venta D. animales menores, el mismo que abandono cuando sufrió el robo D. todos sus animales., con las ganancias que obtuvo opto por dedicarse a la venta D. menú, negocio que si le deja ganancias y desarrolla en su propio domicilio
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra animales menores para la venta.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra alimentos D. primera necesidad para su negocio D. menú.
Marleny sueña con tener un restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Marleny E. D. G. is 50 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of La Libertad, Perú. She studied up to the 5th year of primary school, but did not continue as she was more inclined to work. She has five children, three of whom still depend on her financially. She dedicates herself to selling prepared foods, having started her business selling vegetables at a market until she was asked to leave after 25 years there. She also sold small livestock, an activity she stopped after all her animals were stolen. With her earnings, she opted to dedicate herself instead to food sales. This business, which she runs out of her home, does proviD. her with an income. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Cielo II”, she invested in the purchase of young animals to sell. With this loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for her business. Marleny dreams of one day opening a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food preparation business.  Marleny dreams of one day opening a restaurant in her house.

loans.name: Zeca Francisco

texts.pt:
Zeca Francisco C. é natural da província de Sofala no centro do pais, tem 46 anos de idade, é casado maritalmente e pai de 5nfilhos com idades entre 29; 24; 15; 9 e 3 anos respectivamente, apenas sustenta 4 filhos dado que o primeiro já tem sua casa e trabalha assalariado.

Zeca estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando perdeu o seu pai, aos 22 anos de idade mudou se da zona quando se incorporou nos serviços militar obrigatório tendo lhe levado até a província do Maputo, em 1992 foi desmobilizado assim recebe mensalmente uma pensão militar.

Zeca trabalha como guarda com um horário das 7h as 18h, tem um salário mensal de 6000,00mt, vive numa casa própria, este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. assim pretende pagar antes doo tempo para solicitar outro afim de mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Zeca Francisco C. was born in the central province of Sofala. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of 5 children aged 29, 24, 15, 9, and 3 respectively. He supports 4 of his children, since the oldest already has his own house and a job with a salary. Zeca went to school until the 4th grade and then stopped when he lost his father. When he was 22 years old he left home because he was drafted into military service, which took him to Maputo. In 1992 he left the military service and now receives a monthly military pension. Zeca works as a guard from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and receives a monthly salary of 6000.00 MT. He lives in his own house, and this is his second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He intends to pay off this loan ahead of time so that he can request another loan to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Норова Дильбар проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 49 лет, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Ей одной приходится обеспечивать семью , так как муж почти не присылает деньги. Сама клиентка работает в магазине , где торгует косметикой и одеждой. Кредит ей необходим для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar N. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 49 years old, married and has six children. Her husband left to earn a living in the Russian Federation. However, because he barely sends any money home, Dilbar now has to support her family. She works at store where she sells cosmetics and clothing. Dilbar needs this loan in order to increase her goods turnover. She can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru: Бадалов Насриддин житель района Шахринау. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет пятерых детей.Работает таксистом по маршруту Шахринау-Душанбе-Шахринау.Кроме того занимается торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Для этого вида бизнеса планирует получить кредит . Планирует купить породистогобычка , который в дальнейшем сможет давать породистое потомство.
texts.en:
Nasriddin B. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 44 years old, married and has five children. He works as a taxi driver on the Shahrinav-Dushanbe route. Besides this, he is involved in sales of cattle. It is for this business that Nasriddin plans to obtain the loan. He plans to purchase a purebred bull in order to subsequently provide for a purebred breed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a purebred bull

loans.name: Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en: A. Razaq is the group leader of the A. Razaq group.  They have three members. They want to take a loan of 44100 Afghani for 10 months.  A. Razaq wants to take a loan for his computer making shop.  Palwasha wants a loan for tailoring.  Ma J. wants a loan for the business of leather work.  They admire this process so much.

loans.use: Buy business supplies.

loans.name: Mirzobahodur

texts.ru: Рофиев Мирзобаходур парень- студент пятого курса ВУЗа города Худжанда, заочного отделения. Мирзобаходур имеет свой доход с купли продажи мобильных телефонов. Он покупает рабочие исправные телефоны и отремонтировав их перепродаёт с наценкой. У него место деятельности находится на рынке Худжанда, он арендует маленький ларёк где ведёт свою работу.
texts.en:
Mirzobahodur R. is a young man who is a fifth-year student in the distance learning program at an institution of higher learning in the city of Khujand. Mirzobahodur has his own income from buying and selling mobile phones. He purchases working phones in good repair and, once they have been refurbished, resells them at a markup. His sales outlet is located at the Khujand market, where he rents a small stall to conduct his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Telephone sales

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
For the past 8 years, Luisa has operated her family-run pet supply business out of the weekend flea market in San Jose with help from her husband Garrett and, occasionally, their teenage daughter. Luisa currently specializes in bird cages and accessories, toys and supplies for dogs, and cages, food and supplies for hamsters, guinea pigs and rabbits. 

Recently, when the aquatic supply business next door to Luisa’s shut down, Luisa decided to jump at the chance to expand her business and begin selling fish and aquatic life merchandise. But buying all the inventory for the new product line is expensive and she also needs a new store awning and sign to better advertise her store. A $3,500 loan will help Luisa purchase the new inventory and the new signage and awning and greatly increase her store’s sales and foot traffic.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Luisa from  United States

loans.use: Purchase of awning for storefront and inventory

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru: Солиха – женщина 46 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Занимается продажей парфюмерии и декоративной косметики, а также женской обуви на рынке «Фаровон» города Гафурова. У Солихи очень большой ассортимент товара и соответственно у нее много клиентов. Солиха закупает товар у фирм-поставщиков и индивидуальных дистрибьюторов а также ездит на оптовый рынок города Истаравшан. Сейчас современная молодёжь предпочитает дорогую косметику известных компаний. Поэтому Солиха просит займ для закупки партию декоративной косметики от Российской компании Эйвон и партию женской летней обуви.
texts.en:
Soliha is 46 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells perfumes and decorative cosmetics, and also women’s shoes at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Soliha has a wide assortment of merchandise and, thus, has many customers. She buys her merchandise from supplier firms and individual distributors. She also travels to a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Nowadays, modern young people prefer expensive cosmetics from well-known companies. This is why Soliha is requesting this loan to purchase a stock of decorative cosmetics from a Russian company, Avon, and a stock of women’s summer shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and women's summer shoes

loans.name: Lucila Petronila

texts.es:
La Señora Lucila Petronila G. P. D. D. tiene 46 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, Departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 2º D. secundaria, ya que por escasos recursos económicos tuvo que dejar D. estudiar y empezar a trabajar en el campo. Tiene 5 hijos pero solo 2 dependen económicamente D. ella, porque se encuentran estudiando en la universidad.
Lucila se dedica a la crianza D. cerdo, carnero, reses y ala venta D. sus carnes en el mercado D. Moche.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles, compro cuyes, los que crió y posteriormente vendió.
Este crédito D. 1500 soles servirá para comprar cerdos, patos, pollos y cuyes. Lucila sueña con aumentar la crianza D. sus animales para que pueda vender con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Lucila Petronila G. P. D. D. is 46 years old and lives in the district of Moche, Trujillo province, Department of La Libertad, in Peru. She studied until her second year of high school, when she had to leave school and begin working in the fields because of the lack of economic resources. She has 5 children, but only two depend upon her, because they are university students.

Lucila raises pigs, rams, and other animals, and sells meat in the Moche market. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought guinea pigs, which she raised and then sold. She will use this loan of 1500 PEN to buy pigs, ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. Lucila dreams of increasing the number of animals she raises so that she can sell more often.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ducks, guinea pigs, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Saidat Muyanja ‘S Group

texts.en:
Saidat is the leader of four members of a group.  She is a 40-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 21 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-room house where she is staying with five people. Saidat takes care of additional family members.  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Saidat stays in Nalukolongo selling bananas in Nalukolongo Market, in one of Kampala suburbs.  She doesn’t incur any extra transport cost as she buys from her place of work.  Saidat sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and daily market dues.  She has been in this business for the last ten years. Saidat has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her 14th loan, working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy to more bananas. Saidat aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise. 

.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is divorced and has three kids, all of whom are in school in the community where they live. She is 49 years old and runs a clothing shop where, for the past four years, she has sold jeans-clothes, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dress-bags. She mostly sells through hawking (going door-to-door) in the nearby communities during their market days.

As a single mother, Elizabeth is constrained by funds to run her business and to meet her family needs in the way she expects. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into her business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase a large quantity of good quality items to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more jeans-clothes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est un homme de 30 ans marié et père de deux enfants. Il  habite à Kpadape un village situé à 10 kilomètres de kpalimé. Avec ce prêt, koffi voulait acheter du  sucre, du citron, bissape, ananas etc… pour en faire des boissons non alcoolisées. Avec les bénéfices qu’il obtiendra, Koffi rêve de tenir une grande boutique à Lomé pour vendre du poisson.
texts.en:
Koffi A. is 30 years old, married and father of two children. He lives in Kpadape, a village situated 10 kilometres from Kpalimé. With this loan, Koffi would like to buy sugar, lemons, hibiscus, pineapples etc. with which to make non-alcoholic drinks. With the income he will earn, Koffi dreams of having a large shop in Lomé from where he can sell fish.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, lemons, hibiscus, pineapples etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des fertilisants

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., 25 and her husband, Mr. Phally Heng, 27, have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and 1 daughter. One of them attends school and other one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap has been a weaver for more than ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. She is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor Korol' is married with two daughters. He is a businessman from Kahovka. He runs a business offering shoe repair services at two locations in his home town. Viktor was forced to start this enterprise after the collapse of Soviet Union when his family had many financial needs. He has been in this trade for 15 years. His working capital amounts to 18,000 UAH. Monthly net profit is about 5,500 UAH.  

Viktor is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional raw materials and supplies for his shoe repair business. Viktor likes his work and is hoping to see his venture grow further and expand even more. Viktor is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. We believe his commitment to his venture and personal characteristics will help him repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for his business.

loans.name: Ceril

texts.en: Ceril L. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan. She is 33 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Ceril owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ceril joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Ceril is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
As the father of four children, Ravshan decided to start looking to start the kind of business that could yield enough money to support his wife and family for the long term, particularly so that his children can finish their studies. For this reason, he took what little savings he had and started his own bread “lepeshka,” a bakery business at home. With only a few utensils and clients but with faith and enthusiasm, he has made his business successful by growing a loyal clientele little by little. However, Ravshan wishes to offer his clients better services so that they do not seek other competing businesses. He also wants to be able to attract more clients. He is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 USD. With this money, Ravshan will be able to buy more products for making lepeshka and will be able to make improvements to his offerings. With these improvements, Ravshan expects to attract more clients and will be capable of supporting his family and continuing to fund his children’s studies. His goal is to be able to offer a better future to his family.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for the baking of lepeshka.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells used clothes and natural medicine to her customers at retail prices. She lives Warri, Delta State. She is 35 years old and married, and she has 2 children.. She is a hard-working woman. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She is hoping for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more natural medicines to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et qui  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. Les prêts antérieurs ont été tous bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente de chaussures, de pomme de terre, de condiments alimentaires, de l’essence etc  et de la restauration. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 douzaines de chaussures, 5 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre, 6 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 250 litres d’essence et  2 sacs de 100kg de riz + 4 paquets 5 paquets de condiments pour faire la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de Médine et de Hamdallaye, de façon ambulante  dans les quartiers et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.250FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent demander plus de capitaux pour aménager leur point de vente et mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Sabougnouma are essentially married women who average 43 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  These women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers and are now on their fifth solidarity loan.  The previous loans have all been repaid.  The group members sells shoes, potatoes, condiments, gasoline, etc., and they work in food service. With their new loan, they intend to buy 20 dozen shoes, five 100-kg sacks of potatoes, six packets of condiments, 250 liters of gasoline, and two 100-kg sacks of rice, plus four or five packets of condiments for food catering.  Supplies are gotten at the Sikasso City market and in the neighboring villages.  Sales are made at the Médine market, at the Hamdallaye market, from door to door in the districts, and at home.  Cash or credit is accepted from customers composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 25,250 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put toward savings and the needs of the family.  The other part will be invested into the businesses.  Their ambition is to ask for more capital to fix up their sales outlet and to satisfy their customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Julia es casada, tiene 59 años y 7 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, aceite.
El sueño de Julia es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia, 59, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is married and has 7 children. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits daily; her daughter helps her out. Julia needs 1500 soles to buy stock items like sugar and cooking oil. Julia's dream is that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man with one young child. He has been involved in the construction sector for the past ten years.

In 2006, Ali decided to work on his own and take on home projects. He started with small projects and he's very thankful for the results. He has been able to meet his family’s needs and to raise his baby.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy steel stands specialized for the construction business because he’s planning to take on bigger projects and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy steel stands for his business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
In her house, Felicia, 38, sells sarongs and drinks at retail prices to her customers. With over 12 years of experience, she is now ready to expand her business. The mother of five children, three boys and two girls, Felicia is married to a government worker who also supports the home. 

Very happy and grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support in alleviating their financial stress, she hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 25 years old and is married with one child who is one year and seven months of age. Francoise lives in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Francoise owns a small business selling various products such as handbags, clothes and shoes. She works hard, as does her husband who is driver, in order to provide all the needs of their family. Francoise has been an entrepreneur since 2007. The hours of her business are from seven in the morning to six in the evening, every day except Saturday.

Francoise is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive handbags, clothes and shoe styles for sale. With this loan she will be able to obtain more profits in the process. This, in turn will allow her to save money for her future.

loans.use: To buy additional handbags, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada 15 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante ha hecho que se dedique a la venta ambulante de comida en un carrito especialmente diseñado para esta actividad. Todas las noches ella se instala en la puerta de su casa para ofrecer a sus clientes hamburguesas y salchipollos, que son productos que tienen mucha acogida, debido a la buena sazón con la que Rosa los prepara.

Rosa prepara los alimentos con la mayor salubridad posible, ya que es consciente de la responsabilidad que conlleva preparar estos alimentos. Ella desea ampliar su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de insumos para seguir ofreciendo los alimentos que prepara.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora, responsable y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus pequeños hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior con la que se aseguren un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old; she is separated from her husband and supports her two children. She lives next door to her family in Lambayeque, a city 15 minutes north of Chiclayo. In order to provide for her children, she sells prepared food from a cart specially designed for that purpose. She places her cart outside her front door every evening and sells hamburgers and salchipollos (fried potatoes with shredded chicken and frankfurters), which sell very well thanks to Rosa’s seasoning skills. Rosa is aware of the responsibility she bears to protect her clients from food-borne diseases. To that end, she applies high standards of cleanliness when preparing the food she sells. She would like to expand her business in order to better satisfy costumer demand. This is the first time she has applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa; she has asked for 1000 new soles. She will use the money to buy food supplies for her food business. Rosa is a hard-worker and very responsible and dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide her young children with the opportunity for a better future through a university profession.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food supplies to make hamburgers and salchipollos.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Epifania is married and has 3 school-aged children. Epifania owns & operates a specialized retail store wehre she sells seafood products such as dried fish and shrimp. Epifania has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Epifania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Epifania is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Epifania from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Don  Joel de edad de 47 años, vive junto con su esposa y dos hijos que procrearon, aun estudiantes, su esposa trabaja como conserje en un hospital privado, la meta de ambos era poder tener una casa mas segura y digna para sus hijos ya que era toda de madera y ya en mal estado, con los financiamientos que ha obtenido en Afodenic ha logrado construir su casa de concreto el cual esta gozoso por tal objetivo alcanzado. Su trabajo es en seguridad, y lleva varios años laborando, es un trabajo arriesgado, pero tiene estabilidad lo cual le permite seguir anhelando a superar como persona. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, tablas para repellar la casa, a un falta embaldosar parte de la casa, hacer puertas y ventanas seguras, pintar, pero ira poco a poco ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Don Joel is 47 years old, he lives with his wife and their two children, who are still attending school. His wife works as a caretaker at a private hospital. It is their goal to own a house, safer and more decent for their children as it is built of wood and is in bad shape. With previous loans from Afodenic he has built a concrete house which makes him very proud. He has been working for several years in security, it is a risky job, but offers stability which allows him to continue hoping to improve as a person. With this loan he will buy building material such as sand, cement, wood. Parts of the house still need tiling, doors and safe windows, and paint. But he will do it little by little as it is very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand and wood.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old and married with one child.  He does construction work to earn a living. He has been in this business for seven years. He invested his money from construction work to open up a beauty shop.  Edward also practices mixed farming to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Progressive, he has been motivated to work hard on his business.  

He has been able to take out a loan because his group members guaranteed him.  He got a construction contract and he is required to buy construction materials and pay his laborers.  For this reason, he has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to have a fully established construction company so as to create employment for the jobless in his community.

loans.use: To buy building materials and pay his workers

loans.name: Francias Alicia

texts.es: La profesora Francis Alicia habitantante de la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea,  es madre de 2 hijos varones y una mujer todos trabajan y son profesionales su mayor necesidad que se le presenta es construir una cocina ya que le urge  por que ya viene el tiempo del invierno y se encuentra en mal estado de modo que le permita vivir en mejores condiciones en su casa de habitacion, no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para realizar esta actividad por esta razon solicita refinanciamiento a la intitucion de AFODENIC, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora la cual se ha esforzado para que sus hijos sean unos excelentes profesionales, los cuales coloboran en las actividades del hogar y con los gastos familiares ya que son una familia cristiana y bien unida.
texts.en:
Francis Alicia is a teacher and she lives in Zone #1 of Nueva Ginea. She is the mother of 2 sons and one daughter. All work and are professionals. Her greatest necessity is to build a kitchen because the rainy season is about to start and her current kitchen is in bad shape. She needs one that will allow her to have better living conditions in her house. She doesn’t have the necessary funds to build, and this is why she is requesting a loan from AFODENIC. She is a very hardworking woman who has worked hard so that her children could become excellent professionals. They help her out at home and with the family expenses because they are a Christian family and are very close.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Pablo Armando

texts.es: Pablo tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente vive en casa alquilada, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, el se dedica al transporte, adquirio su vehiculo hace 7 meses aproximadamente, con ahorros de trabajos anteriores y con ayuda de su conyuge quien tiene una bodega en su domicilio aproximadamente 3 años , solicita el credito para compra del soat y mantenimiento de su vehiculo su sueño es poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo is 30 years old; he lives in a rented house with his partner, and he has a 3-year-old son. He works in transport; he acquired his vehicle about 7 months ago with savings from previous work and with help from his partner who has had a general store in her home for approximately 3 years. He is asking for credit to purchase SOAT Compulsory Automobile Accident Insurance and to maintain his vehicle. His dream is to be able to give his family a better quality of life and to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of SOAT automobile accident insurance and tools for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Farida K., age 36, is married with 4 children, aged  20, 16, 11, and 10 years who all go to school.   She has had a retail shop and a grocery for 6 years now.   She works from 7am to 3pm daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 136.

This will be  Farida’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants to get a loan to buy more beers, sodas, water, spirits and increase her inventory for the retail shop. Farida's dream is to buy a pick-up so that she can transport her goods, both for retail and grocery items. She really wants to send her children to good standard schools. 

Farida will share this loan with her loan group Loyola, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Farida  is in the centre in a black blouse with a yellow collar.

loans.use: To increase grocery and retail shop stock

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 26 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Nidia de 27 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de cultivo, han sido en la vida de Edwin, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra nada le faltaría, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, de papa y alverja, que una vez cosechados son comercializados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 5 años que empezó con esta actividad, y disfruta mucho de la siembra, ya que depende de este trabajo para dar tranquilidad económica a su familia, sin embargo los cambios climáticos afecta la producción, por tanto procura cuidar su siembra para perderlo. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Edwin, 26, is a very hardworking and modest young man. He rents a house with his wife Nidia, 27, and their 2 young children, to whom he wishes to provide a better quality of life. Farming has been a crucial part of Edwin's life. Since he was very young, Edwin's parents taught him that farming would provide him with everything he needed, which is why he decided to continue the work. He now has his own farm of potatoes and peas, which he sells in Tarma's wholesale market after harvest. Edwin started his farm 5 years ago and really enjoys the planting season. His family depends on his work for economic security. Climate changes affect his yield, so he tries to take good care of his crops. Edwin hopes to keep working and improving his crops. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he knows how important it is to the development of his work. In his community group Edwin is very responsible, which has earned him a lot of respect. With the 3,000 PEN loan he is requesting, Edwin will buy fertilizer to improve his harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. sells bags of water and soft drinks at Elmina. Efua has received a senior high education.  She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a plumber. Efua has been selling drinks and water for quite some time now. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more stock of goods (soft drinks) for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to open another shop in a different location.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods (soft drinks) to sell

loans.name: Azizah

texts.en:
N. Azizah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children.  Azizah has a business of a beauty salon, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Azizah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more oil for hair and braids in her salon. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Azizah hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food and clothing for herself.  In the future, Azizah hopes to own a house.        


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and to improve their prospects for the future, and targets a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy oil and braids for the hair.

loans.name: Martha Lizeth

texts.es:
la sra. Martha Lizeth A. D. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos, dicha actividad tiene mas de 2 años de realizarla, tiene muy buena clientela por sus precios y calidad en el producto,  su negocio es conocido como BOUTIQUE MARTHA y esta ubicado en el Barrio Las Flores, este lugar es estratégico para este tipo de negocio, ya que esta ubicado en el centro de la cuidad de El Paraíso y es de fácil acceso para muchas pesonas.
Durante todo este tiempo nos comento que le a ido muy bien, gracias a los ingresos económicos que percibe le a permitido seguir preparándose académicamente,  a su vez trabaja como maestra de educación primaria en la Escuela Sagrado Corazón de la ciudad de El Paraíso en la jornada diurna, su negocio lo atiende por las tardes, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería como ser pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, sandalias y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Martha Lizeth A. D. has a small store where she sell clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She has had it for 2 yeas and has developed a good customer base due to good quality and price. Her business in called Boutique Martha and is in the Barrio las Flores neighborhood. This is a strategic location since it is in the center of the city of El Paraiso and is of easy access for many people. She tells us that things have gone well and the income has allowed her to continue her studies. She also works as a primary school teacher in the Sagrado Corazon school in El Paraiso in the mornings. In the afternoon she works at her business. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, sandals and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants, skirts, lotions, shoes

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny V. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 32 years old. Leny is married. To make a living, Leny owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies like steamed cake in the local community. Leny has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leny is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leny from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita O. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Violita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Violita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Violita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Violita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Violita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina B. is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a lecturer and they have two children, 4 and 9 years old. Selina owns a cement distribution shop, where she supplies builders around the Kitengela area, an upcoming residential area where many buildings are being constructed.  Besides this business, she also has a container which she rents out to other people to use as a shop. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she faces is competition from many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers. She says that there are other people in Kitengela who are well established and own big hardware stores and even provide transport facilities. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy more bags of cement to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to develop her business by opening a big hardware store and owning lorries to provide transport facilities to her customers. She describes herself as hardworking, flexible and business-minded.

loans.use: to buy cement

loans.name: Free Gospel Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Free Gospel” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business owners who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to receive a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Samuel B.. Samuel was born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, thirty-five years ago. He is married and has three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary school. Samuel sells cigarettes, toothpaste, and toothbrushes, among other things, and has been running this business for many years now. With his share of this loan, Samuel will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, toothpaste and toothbrushes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 43 años, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por mejorar su calidad de vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener un buen futuro. El cultivo de la arveja, papa y maíz es la actividad a la que se dedica Juan, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y aún mantiene el mismo ritmo de cuidado que tiene hacía sus tierras, evitando que la plaga de insectos ataquen sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo espera sembrar más así tener una mejor producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo a futuro, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de arveja, para ampliar sus actuales sembríos.
texts.en:
Juan, 43, is a man who has always fought to improve his quality of life.  He lives in his own house and his greatest desire is to have a good future.

Juan is a pea, potato and corn farmer.  He goes out daily very early in the morning to work his fields.   His sole goal in mind is to work hard so that his crops are of good quality.  What he enjoys the most about his work is tilling the soil.  He has been a farmer for 20 years and still maintains the same rhythm of care for his fields, avoiding insect infestations that attack the plants.  In time, he hopes to plant more in order to have better production.

This is his 8th loan with MFP.  He knows that he has to repay on time if he wants to have access to future loans.  He is a prompt and active member of his communal bank.

He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy pea seed to enlarge his current plantings.

loans.use: To buy pea seed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P.  is currently in the business of selling onions, cooking oil, simsim (sesame) and groundnuts. She is requesting a loan to stock more onions and groundnuts to sell. Mary is 39 years old and married to a carpenter. She has 2 children, who both attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: Stock more onions and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica de 26 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Vive con sus hijos en el Guasmo zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus comerciantes son comerciantes. 

La tienda la empezó  con la ayuda de su esposo para poder tener estabilidad económica y darles una mejor vida a sus dos hijos. Con la ayuda de su esposa pudo surtir mas la tienda y seguir con el negocio ya que el esposo es taxista le ayuda en las mañana dejándole la mercadería que le hace falta. En su tienda vende arroz, aceites, enlatados, snack, bebidas, panes etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, enlatados, bebidas para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere tener que sus hijos tengan una buena vida económica para que puedan tener un buen estudio.
texts.en:
Angélica is 26 years old.  She has a grocery store where she sells essential items.  She lives with her children in Guasmo, a district which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.

Angélica set up her store with her husband so that they could have financial stability and provide their two children with a better life.  With the help of her husband, she has been able to stock her store and continue with her business.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  He helps her in the mornings, leaving her  the merchandise which she needs.  In her store she sells rice, oil, canned goods, snacks, drinks, bread, etc.

Angélica will use her loan to buy food such as rice, canned goods and drinks so that she has more variety in the products she offers.  In the future, she would like her children to have a good life financially and for them to have a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Bénète Plus Group

texts.en:
Ngoyi K. is the leader of the Community Bank group named "Bénète Plus." It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Ngoyi is 43 years old and the mother of five children whose ages vary between 10 and 20 years old. All of them go to school. She has been active in her business since 2006 when she began running a drugstore. She joined one of Hope’s groups (a Democratic Republic of the Congo Microfinance Program) in 2009, and has received six loans since. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Ngoyi has diversified her business by adding the sale of corn flour and semolina. Her business has prospered and it generates a profit of $73 per week. With this loan, Ngoyi intends to increase the inventory of her business by buying some sacks of corn flour and semolina to meet her customers' needs and increase her income. Her ambition is to become a corn flour and semolina provider in her community. She works hard in order to achieve her dream.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her goods by buying more corn flour and semolina and reselling them at profit

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Senora Alicia P., tiene 42 anos de edada, originaria de la Comarca Santa Tereza, empalme El Chaguite, en Esteli.
Ella cuenta que sus inicios fueron muy dificiles, pues comenzo con la venta de helados, luego su hermana adquirio un prestamo y le ayudo a poner poco a poco una pequena pulperia, donde comenzo vendiendo granos basicos.
Luego poco a poco fue surtiendola, con ayuda de su esposo tambien, quien se dedica a la siembra de frijoles en sociedad con otro amigo.
Ella hizo este prestamo para avastecer un poco mejor su negocio, sobretodo en estas epocas de navidad que existe una mayor demanda.
Espera tener mejores ingresos, para mejorar su nivel de vida tambien. Espera pagar este prestamo lo antes posible y hacer otro para ir creciendo.
texts.en: Mrs Alicia P., age 42, was born in the Comarca Santa Tereza , in the El Chaguite region, in Esteli. She says that the beginning was very difficult. She started selling ice cream, and later her sister received a loan and helped her to open a small local store, where she started selling basic grains. She stocked it bit by bit with her husband's help. Her husband sows beans with a friend. Alicia has requested this loan to stock her store a bit better. In this holiday season, there is higher demand. She hopes to obtain better income in order to improve her living conditions as well. She hopes to repay this loan as soon as possible and take out another to keep growing.

loans.use: she will purchase inventory for her corner store

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 56 años, es un hombre trabajador que ha tenido la oportunidad de ser microempresario por la buena administración que le ha dado a su negocio. 

Viviendo en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil ha trabajado en su local dando el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de impresoras. En la actualidad tiene dos empleados que le ayudan desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm arreglando y reparando impresoras. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar prestando el servicio a los clientes pero para seguir tiene que comprar con el préstamo herramientas para la debida reparación de las impresoras. 

En el futuro quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener mejores ingresos para mejorar el estilo de trabajo.
texts.en: Jorge is 56 years old. He is a hard-working man who has had the opportunity to be a small businessman thanks to his good business administration. Living in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, he has worked at his shop providing maintenance and repair services for printers. Currently, he has two employees who help him fix and repair printers from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. He has many aspirations for his business, and it's for this reason he wants to continue providing his services to customers. However, in order to continue he must purchase tools with the loan so he can make proper repairs. In the future, he wants to keep on growing his business and have more income to make improvements.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eusebia; ella tiene 54 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de condimentos para cualquier tipo de carne como de res, chancho y pollo, la socia elabora estos condimentos con pimienta,ajo,aji colorado,sal ,  para cualquier tipo de actividad como parrilladas, polladas y comidas comunes esto es más que todo para facilitar el condimentar las carnes, la socia vende en el mercado El Molino II,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00 am hasta las 05:00pm el horario puede variar dependiendo de la cantidad que venda,la socia es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio de venta de condimentos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Eusebia belongs to the Communal Bank “Pachapaccari”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 54 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Eusebia divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling condiments used on all types of meats such as beef, pork, and chicken. She makes her condiments with pepper, garlic, Colorado chili, and salt. These spices can be used on barbecue, chicken, and other common foods in order to provide seasoning. Eusebia sells at the El Molino II Market and works from 8am to 5pm. Her schedule varies based on the quantity that she sells. She is an optimistic person who has great desire to succeed.

Eusebia is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her condiments business. She is very happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making condiments

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida C. is from the village of Divisoria Norte, Maddela, Quirino. She is 48 years old. Leonida is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Leonida C.".

Leonida is married and has six children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa F. is married and a mother of seven children, four of them below the age of 15. Faced with the challenges of working hand in hand with her husband to take care of their kids, she finds it difficult to sponsor their education.  Due to her own lack of education, she could not secure a good job, so she embarked on farming.  
  
Unfortunately, she was not familiar with farming methods that could improve her output.  As a member of GHAPE, she was fortunate to acquire some techniques that have helped her improve on her farming and marketing strategies.

Ngwa F. has been successful at managing and paying back her previous loans.  With a new loan, she plans to invest it in farming and the selling of vegetable, garri (also known as tapioca), yams and potatoes.

Her activities will help her community, as she will be able to supply the market with basic foodstuff. She will plow her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children;s school fees, and will save some for rainy days. Ngwa F. prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the instalmental method paying back the loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To invest in seeds, yams, potatoes and garri

loans.name: Susy Geovanna

texts.es:
Susy Geovanna J. C. tiene 36 años, vive en union libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería y otros son comerciantes de carne.

Susy se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo y comprar una casa

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Susy Geovanna J. C. is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She has three children.

The members of the community bank ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA [Tomorrow's Success] are located in the Ventanas canton and meet in the 24 de Mayto neighborhood.  This group works at retail activities like selling perfumes, clothing, jewelery and meat.

Susy works selling Yambal products by catalog.  She orders the products by phone and sells them through the catalog door to door.  

She is asking for this loan so that she can order the products from the catalog and have them in a store. The support of this loan will help her meet her needs financially.  She encounters challenges like competition and high prices.  Her dream is to purchase a vehicle and a house.  

She likes to watch television.

loans.use: to purchase Yambal products.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia A. tiene ya más de  diez años con su salón de belleza, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder acondicionar un local  ya que actualmente tiene el negocio en la sala de su casa y desea tener ya su propio lugar de trabajo y darles una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia A. has had her beauty salon for more than ten years, and this business is her family’s source of income.

She is requesting a loan so that she can set her business up in a new location.  Her business is currently located in a room in her house, and she would like to have her own workplace so that she can give more attention to her customers.

Lucia will pay back the loan with the profits she earns from her business.

loans.use: Setting her business up in a new location

loans.name: Taporu Ole

texts.en:
Taporu Ole K. is 44 years old and married to Elizabeth K.. They have five children. For the past ten years, Taporu has been a farmer. Farming is a good profession in his area due to favorable local conditions. Taporu’s monthly income is 5,000 KES.

Taporu learned about KADET LTD through KADET staff outreach. He is applying for his first loan with KADET for 50,000 KES to buy farm supplies. Taporu has never borrowed money from a microfinance institution before. He is an honest man who will achieve much if he receives financial support.  Taporu plans to use the proceeds from his loan to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Pecositas Group

texts.es: este grupo se llama "Pecositas" La señora Maria Trinidad G. es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 29 años de edad es originaria del estado de Morelos en Mexico. La señora Maria vive en union libre con el señor Felipe Castaño, la señora se dedica a la venta de huaraches desde hace 8 años, los cuales fabrica con su Papá y asi tambien le ayuda a mejora la calidad de vida de su familia, ella se encuentra muy feliz y contenta con los la oportunidad de recibir un prestamo para hacer crecer su negocio y por el apoyo de las personas que confian en ella, con el prestamo ella invertirá en materia prima para la fabricación de los huaraches. Maria quiere más adelante poner un local en su colonia para poder vender sus huaraches, pues en la actualidad vende en tiangus, tiene 2 hijos varones los cuales son su felicidad Elias y Kaleb. Ella desea darles una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called "Pecositas".  Maria Trinidad G. is a member of the group.  She is 29 years old and from the State of Morelos in Mexico.  She lives with her partner, Felipe Castaño.

Maria has been selling sandals for 8 years.  She makes the sandals with her dad and, in this way, helps to improve her family's quality of life.  Maria is very happy that she has this opportunity to receive a loan as it will allow her to grow her business.  She is happy to have the support of people who trust in her.

Maria will invest her loan in buying raw materials for making her sandals.  In the future, she would like to set up a sales location in her district so that she can sell her sandals as, at the moment, she sells them in street markets.  Maria has two sons, Elias and Kaleb, who are her pride and joy.  She would like to provide them with a better quality of life and a better future.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for making sandals

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es:
Piedad es una mujer casada  que tiene un hijo de 13 años, ella vende mercancía  variada mediante guías especializadas de productos, que financia a sus clientela conformada por vecinos, familiares, y referidos. Su negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su hogar, así como también el aporte que su esposo hace, producto de su trabajo persistente en la construcción en Santa Marta, ciudad ubicada a menos de 2 horas de Barranquilla. 
Piedad siempre está pensando en llevarles a sus clientes lo mejor, porque está en la búsqueda de las ofertas permanentes que hacen las revistas, para vendérselas y ellos satisfechos con el precio de sus mercancías, no la cambian aunque tengan muchas oportunidades de compra.  Su sueño más adelante es abrir un local al público, para ofrecer un servicio visual que impacte por el buen surtido y dirigido a todos los gustos y todas las edades. Mientras construye su sueño ella continúa esforzándose con acciones de venta que impacten sus ingresos y generando un margen de utilidad no menor del 35% y rotando  sus inventarios cada 10 días. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él planea comprar accesorios femeninos en descuento, así como cosméticos, artículos de aseo personal, que ya tiene encargados por sus clientes y esto augura una inversión de éxito, porque su experiencia le ha enseñado a ser muy selectivo con ellos, para no tener inconvenientes en la recuperación de su pequeño capital, que quiere incrementar con su esfuerzo de trabajo.
texts.en: Piedad is a married woman and she has a 13-year old son. She sells a variety of merchandise on credit through specialized product guides to her clientele, composed of her neighbors, family, and referred customers. Her business is an important source of income for her household, as is the income her husband earns through his continued work in construction in Santa Marta, located at least 2 hours from the city of Barranquilla. Piedad always tries to provide her clients with the best. She is always in search of permanent offers made by the catalogues to sell and to keep her clients satisfied with the price of their merchandise. She doesn't change them even if there are many opportunities to buy. Her dream for the future is to open a store to the general public, to have a business with a visual impact by displaying a variety of products, directed to all types of tastes and ages. While she builds on her dream she will continue to place an effort in finding sales that will impact her income and to generate a profit margin no less than 35% and to keep her an inventory rotation schedule of 10 days. Her Kiva loan is the first she has with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she plans on purchasing ladies' accessories that are on sale, as well as cosmetics, and personal hygiene products. Her clients have placed orders and this augurs a successful investment. Her experience has taught her to be very selective with them to avoid inconveniences in recovering her small capital and needing to increase her effort in the business.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' accessories, cosmetics and personal hygiene products for resale.

loans.name: Gherzon Rodney

texts.es: El señor Gherzon  es un cliente joven recomendado por una cliente antigua y responsable, el se dedica a brindar servicio técnico en sistemas y a arreglar computadoras, a pesar de su juventud demuestra responsabilidad en su trabajo, el comenzó a trabajar desde sus 10 años en este rubro logrando con la práctica gran experiencia y conocimiento, vive en la zona de villa nueva potosí junto a su mama, siendo totalmente independiente, también percibe un sueldo fijo porque trabaja por las mañanas y por las tardes en una tienda. Solicita el credito para la compra de material para el arreglo de computadoras. En un futuro Gherzon piensa dedicarse independientemente a brindar servicio técnico en sistemas en un ambiente más grande atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en: Gherzon is a young borrower who has been recommended by an old and responsible customer. He engages in offering technical services in computer engineering and in repairing computers. Despite being young he is very responsible in his job. He started working when he was 10 in this field obtaining a significant experience both by practice and by knowledge. He lives in the Villa Nueva Potosì area with his mother, and he is completely economically independent. He also earns a fixed wage by working in a shop in the mornings and at nights. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials to repair computers. In the future, Gherzon plans on engaging completely in offering technical services in computer engineering, running a bigger shop where to tend to his customers.

loans.use: To buy meterials to repair computers.

loans.name: Saktiyan's Group

texts.en:
Saktiyan is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and two daughters. The younger son is a handicapped person; the older daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The second daughter works in a Social Fund and the older son is a security guard. 

Saktiyan herself works at a market selling foodstuffs. In parallel with this business she breeds livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Saktiyan wants to see all her children get married. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 35 years old.  She is married and has 3 children aged 6, 10 and 12 years. In 2006, this borrower established her local foodstuff business. She began her business as a means to sustain herself and to help her husband.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to buy 10 bags of assorted foodstuffs and palm oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 260,000.  In the future, she plans to supply retail traders and buy a vehicle to travel to the inner villages for more goods.  She is very determined and hardworking.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for containers of palm oil and rice

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 68 años de edad, Daniel Antonio se considera un luchador, que hace 20 decidió no dejarse derrotar por los problemas de orden publico que se le presentaron en su tierra natal Urabá, un municipio que hace parte del departamento de Antioquia, ya que de allí tuvo que salir como desplazado hacia Medellín donde emprendió un nuevo negocio en el cual se desempeñaba como lustrador de zapatos, posteriormente y gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante pudo tener un lugar que le presta el municipio para sostener su negocio y es allí donde hoy en día sigue prestando no sólo este servicio si no que además arregla zapatos y vende algunos dulces que le ayudan a mejorar las ganancias.

Daniel sueña con llegar a tener un establecimiento más grande, que sea reconocido y donde pueda vender gran variedad de productos. Pero para ello necesita un préstamo con el cual pueda comenzar a cumplir este sueño, con él comprara surtido de dulces e insumos para el arreglo de los zapatos, así su negocio comenzará a crecer y su calidad de vida mejorará proporcionalmente
texts.en:
Daniel Antonio, at 68 years old, is considered a fighter. Since he was 20 he decided to not be defeated by the problems caused by the state. These problems occurred in his birthplace called Urabá. Urabá is a town in the department of Antioquia. He had to leave this town because he was exiled to Medellín. In Medellín he learned a new business, shining shoes. After this, and thanks to desire to progress, he was able to secure a place in the town where he could locate his business. Today his business is in this location. Now he not only shines shoes, but also fixes them and also sells some sweets. This allows him to improve his earnings.
Daniel would like to have a larger location for his business that would have customer recognition.  In this place he could sell a greater variety of products. In order to reach his goals he needs a loan. With this loan he will buy a variety of sweets and products to be used to repair shoes. In this way his business will begin to grow and his quality of life will grow also.

loans.use: to buy goods thereby creating a greater variety of goods for his business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 53 years old, single and blessed with children. She owns a grocery store. She has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES 5,000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 5,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to expand her business by buying more potatoes, cabbage, carrots, and onions. She plans to use the anticipated profit to buy more goods to expand the business.

She hopes to have a successful business and help her children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, cabbage, carrots, and onions

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
