La señora María , tiene treinta y ocho  años de edad , se dedica a la venta de tamales  desde  hace tres años.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos:  una  mujer Andrea de quince años de edad y dos varones Luis  de  veinte años y Carlos de ocho años de edad.
Esta  muy contenta  por  que le va muy bien en su pequeño negocio , sus  hijos le ayudan a limpiar las hojas para  los tamales y su hija a  poner el nixtamal y a tortear.
La señora  María  cada semana  va realizar sus pagos  a la microfianciera , le gusta mucho  hacer comida  para la venta.
El las noches se dedica a  vender comida  ya que cuando  esta  elaborando  los tamales  prepara  todo para  en la comida  y al regresar de la  vender  los tamales   se dedica exclusivamente a guisar  ya que sus vecinos le comparan mucho.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar mas ingredientes para la elaboración de los tamales , le da las gracias a sus hijos  por que siempre están ayudándola  en la venta de  tamales  y en la venta de comida .
Uno  de sus sueños es que sus hijos  tengan una licenciatura  ya que ella solamente estudio hasta la primaria terminada.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora María is thirty-eight years old, and has been selling tamales for the last three years.  She has three children: Andrea, a fifteen year old daughter; and two sons; Luis, aged twenty and Carlos, aged eight.

She is very happy that she's doing very well with her small business.  Her children help her clean the leaves for tamales, and her daughter helps her with the corn and making the tortillas.

Señora María will make payments to the microfinance organization on a weekly basis.  She loves making food for sale.

Her evenings are dedicated to selling food, and when she is preparing the tamales, she prepares everything that goes into the food.  On her return from selling the tamales, she focuses exclusively on cooking so that her neighbors will buy a lot from her.

She requested the loan to buy more ingredients for the preparation of tamales.  She thanks her children who are always helping her with the sale of the tamales and with food sales.

One of her dreams is for her children to earn a degree, as she only completed primary level education.

She thanks the foundation for the support that it has given her in getting ahead in life and in realizing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the preparation and sales of tamales.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old. He is married to Jackline,they are blessed with two children, aged fourteen and three years. He operates a retail shop in Ndurio trading center and has been in the business for a period of ten years, earning a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

Charles has borrowed a loan from KADET LTD of KES. 50,000, this being his third loan after paying the previous loan successfully. He hopes to use the amount to purchase stock for his shop like bags of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat etc., and the anticipated profits from the business will be used to build his own business premise.

His dreams is to prosper in business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop like bags of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat etc.,

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune très brave et qui vient de loin.Il a démarré par un commerce de produits alimentaires qu'il prenait à crédit auprès de fournisseurs et payait après avoir vendu.Ne parvenant pas à gagner assez, il s'engage comme apprenti tailleur pour apprendre le métier.Dix ans plus tard, il s'installe à son propre compte en prenant à crédit une machine à coudre et une table à 35 000F.Il solde le prêt en deux mois seulement et épargnant petit à petit, il finit par acquérir cinq machines.Aujourd'hui, son activité lui permet d'entretenir ses deux parents, son frères et ses 4 enfants.Pour préparer les prochaines fêtes religieuses, il sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 100000F pour acheter 10 rouleaux de popeline, 5 paquets de fil,6 paquets de fermeture, 15 paquets de finition, 2 rouleaux d'élastique et 1 paquet de toile.Il a acheté un terrain dans sa localité et ambitionne d'y construire sa maison.
texts.en:
This borrower is good and honest young man who has come a long way. He started off with a grocery business that he acquired on credit from suppliers and repaid after selling it. Not having gained enough, he is dedicating himself as an apprentice tailor to learn the trade. Ten years later, he set up his own business by borrowing 35,000 francs for a sewing machine and a table. He repaid the loan in only two months saving money little by little. He finally acquired five machines. Today, his business enables him to take care of his two parents, his brothers, and his four children. 

To prepare for the coming religious holidays, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs from the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC to buy 10 rolls of poplin, 5 packets of thread, 6 packets of zippers, 15 packets of trim, 2 rolls of elastic, and a packet of fabric. 

He has purchased a plot of land in his town and has the ambition of building a house on it.

loans.use: To buy 10 rolls of poplin, 5 packets of thread, 6 packets of zippers, 15 packets of trim, 2 rolls of elastic, and a packet of sheer fabric

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman with one child who does not attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells shoes to augment her income. Serah faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene 3 hijos, es conviviente y tiene 41 años D. edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” grupo  conformado por 5  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio.  Cristina  trabaja desD. hace 10  años en la venta D. plástico gas y carbón , trabaja en el mercado D. su distrito este trabajo surge por que a su esposo no le alcanzaba el sueldo para mantener a sus tres hijos y es asi que cristina pone su negocio D. vender plasticos con el tiempo se hizo D. un capital y compro carbon y gas para vender cristina trabajo muy duro junto a su esposo,hoy en dia tienen clientes fidelizados y el negocio sigue creciendo, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, , poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar, sus hijos tienen educacion privada  y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad D. vida,  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar  (plasticos, carbon, gas) .Sabemos que Cristina  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Cristina is 41 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has three children.  She is currently a member of the 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) community bank which has five members who work in different commercial activities.

Cristina has been selling plastic products, gas and charcoal for ten years.  She works in her district market.  She started out in this line of work because her husband's salary wasn't enough to support their three children and so she set up a business selling plastic products.  Over time, she gathered together some capital and bought charcoal and gas to sell.  Cristina and her husband both worked very hard.  They now have loyal customers and their business continues to grow.  Thanks to her effort and commitment, Cristina has managed to improve their financial income.  She has gradually been buying things for their home, their children have a private education and, above all, her family enjoys a better quality of life.  With the aim of continuing to grow her business, she has requested a new loan to buy plastic products, charcoal and gas.  We know that Cristina will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort, and the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (plastic products, charcoal and gas)

loans.name: Rokhila

texts.ru: Рохила трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 7 детей. Рохила с 2002 года занимается выращиванием пшеницы, ячмень и лука. Она имеет 10 га посевная земля. Рохила имеет большую и дружную семью. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие и с этой целью она запрашивает займ для покупки стройматериалов для того чтобы отремонтировать свой дом. Она заранее благодарить всех вас за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Rokhila is a hard-working and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of seven children.  Since 2002, Rokhila has been involved in growing wheat, barley and onions.  She has 10 hectares of arable land.  Rokhila has a large and friendly family.  She wants to improve her living conditions and is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to repair her house.  She thanks all of you in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 50 years of age, married and has been blessed with three children. She has been a high school teacher for almost 20 years. Imelda's eldest child is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) while the two children left are still studying. She would like to support them until they finish college level,  so the couple work hard to sustain all their needs.

Imelda has been engaged in a hog raising business for two years. She is grateful because she is able to meet her work and obligation to her raised piglets. She has been raising two pigs for fattening and plans to buy three more piglets, but her fund is not enough.  So, she is requesting for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy piglets and feed. This amount would really help her improve her profit because if she provides her raised hogs with enough vitamins and feeds, she can also sell them at a greater price.  Imelda has been doing her best to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: buy three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: la señora Justina  es cliente antigua D. la institución la señora vive en la zona D. Bella Vista ella vive en su propia casa con su hijo  que ya es independiente, ella se dedica a la venta D. leche en polvo,  en la plaza D. la zona por las noches ya que la alcaldía no le permite salir por el día ella además tiene una segunda actividad la cual la realiza esporádicamente ya que ella se entra a la minaa trabajar, cuando no hay mucha venta D. su mercadería, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra D. leche por mayor ya que se aproximan las fiestas D. fin D. año y tendrá mucha venta, ella es una persona ya mayor pero sigue con ganas D. seguir trabajando, se siente agradecida por el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Señora Justina is a longstanding member of the institution. She lives in the Bella Vista area in her own house with her child, who is already independent. She sells powdered milk in the neighbourhood square at night as the town hall does not allow her to go out during the day. In addition she has another activity which she performs sporadically as she goes down the mines to work when there is little uptake of her merchandise. She is asking for the loan to buy powdered milk in bulk as the end-of-year celebrations are approaching and she will have a lot of sales. She is already an elderly person but she has the desire to keep on working. She is grateful for the support given her.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk in bulk.

loans.name: Nakitang'a Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nakitang'a Group in Western Kenya! Bethsheba is the facilitator of the Nakitang'a group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bethsheba takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have quality teaching on how to plant and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Bethsheba had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Bethsheba was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bethsheba and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Bethsheba will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

Bethsheba is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Abduhamid

texts.ru: Абдухамид житель района Кумсангир. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается шитьем. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. Он продает овощи и зелень. Кредит берет для закупа риса.
texts.en: Abduhamid is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  He is 31 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is involved in sewing.  Abduhamid is involved in sales at a market.  He sells vegetables and herbs.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of rice.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Assoumpta

texts.en:
Assoumpta is 26 years old and has a two-year-old child. For the past three years, she has sold bed sheets in a shop. 

Assoumpta is requesting a loan to buy more bed sheets to sell. She will use any profits from her loan to provide for her family. Assoumpta hopes to one day expand her store to sell clothes as well as bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Inda works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Inda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business.

Inda has been sustaining her business activities through her 17 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
Rosa Etelvina  tiene 63 años de edad, ella vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. En su tiempo libre disfruta de ver películas sobre todo si son de comedia;  Rosa estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar enfermería. Ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando en la universidad.

"Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, desde hace ya 20 años, le dedica a este trabajo 5 horas al día, una amiga la animo ya. En un día Rosa puede atender 15 clientes y esto le permite ganar hasta S/. 50 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.120 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para el hogar  y para  invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática. 

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda,  mejora podrá ayudarle a va tener una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo un mejor ambiente para atender a sus clientes, con esta mejora podrá tener más ingresos ella nos dice que su gran sueño y que va seguir luchando, porque ella nos dice que el ser viejo no existe solo es viejo que que se sienta asi, ella tiene el espiritu joven y seguira ahorrando para lograr su gran sueño:” Ver a su hijo un profesional."porque es lo mas valioso que le puede heredar.
texts.en:
Rosa Etelvina is 63 years old, she lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country, and is acclaimed by the Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), production of grapes, asparagus and olives, and perhaps above all, as the source of the national traditional drink of Peru, the “Pisco.” In this warm and dry climate you will find Rosa’s home and clientele.

In her spare time she enjoys watching movies--especially comedies. Rosa studied until the fifth year of secondary school, but would very much like to study nursing. She is a single mother with a son who is studying at university. 

Rosa has been selling beauty products for 20 years. She works five hours per day, and a friend to help her. In a day Rosa can serve fifteen customers, allowing her to earn as much as 50 PEN, and on a good day she can earn up to 120 PEN, helping her to pay additional household expenses and reinvest in her business.  She believes that she is doing so well with her business because she is charismatic. 

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva lenders and their help with which she can make home improvements, improve her quality of life, and above all create a better environment in which to serve her customers. With these improvements she may yield more income, she tells us this is her greatest dream and what she will go on fighting for, because she says that old age does not exist on its own—one is only old when one feels old. Rosa has a young spirit and will continue saving to achieve her dream: "To see your son as a professional,” for this is the most valuable thing that can be inherited.

loans.use: to make improvements in her life.

loans.name: Nyanbiop

texts.en: Nyanbiop, a 32-year-old married woman, has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan for the past three years. Now requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and wheat flour to sell, she will use the resulting extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai (pictured here), age 65, is a widow with four sons and two daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a construction worker and another one has full-time employment. She lives on an island on Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lai stays at home. The main source of income is from her son who is a construction worker and her daughter who has full-time employment. She is asking for a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Naajav

texts.en: Mrs.Naajav is 43 years old and lives with her husband and her childrens in ger district in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works for a private company and her two children a college's students and her younger son go to the secondary school. She started her own retail trade business in 2004 in her local trade center. Before she got loan 800,000 MNT and had been paying her debt on time. Currently, she has been well-experienced in retail grocery trade business in her local residents appreciates her as a openly and friendly woman. Today, Mrs.Naajav needs 3,600,000 MNT loan to purchase the goods for her retail grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase the goods for her retail grocery business

loans.name: Jobell

texts.en:
Jobell is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jobell is 28 years old and has three children are still in school.

Jobell has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jobell requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment like fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her fishing boat.

Jobell has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment like fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been a seamstress for more than 8 years. She makes all types of clothing and often takes custom jobs from her clients. She also has a small shop that she runs out of her home with the help of her 13 year old daughter. Although she prefers that her daughter study and not work in the business, she must recognize the need for money. She is a single mother who has had to face many difficulties after divorcing her husband. She counts on her businesses to help educate and feed her kids.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Upini

texts.en: Upini is 32 years old and is married with three children ages 17, 15 and 11. She sells household goods like coffee, instant noodles, snacks etc. Some of the loan will be used to acquire the driving license for her husband so he can become a taxi driver. She can generate an income of $12 per day and uses her income to help her husband. She needs a bigger loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Upini sells household goods, and needs a loan to help expand her business and help her husband become a taxi driver.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married with five children who have all finished schooling. She is a trained mid-wife and is employed at the local community dispensary. Apart from her job, Juliana is involved in business: she buys cereals during harvesting time, stores them, and sells them later at a higher price. She also operates a clothes store at the local trading centre.

With her business, Juliana has been able to educate all her children. She wishes to expand her clothes shop and open a store if given the loan of $75 by PEMCI. Juliana is a hard-working woman who needs to be supported.

loans.use: Expand Cereals Business

loans.name: Edilene

texts.en:
Edilene T. is the proud owner of a small grocery service in Trou Du Nord, Haiti where she sells food products like rice and sugar. Since her husband died several years ago, her business has been the only source of income for her and her son Angelitho T., age 22. With this first loan, she will expand the inventory of her store to better meet the needs of her customers.

Note: Edilene is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand her inventory of food products, such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel K. is a 44-year-old general practitioner who runs his own private facility in Kibirichia Meru, in the eastern part of Kenya. He is married and lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Meru.

He trained and qualified as a nurse at Meru Medical Training College in 1987, and then worked in a goverment hospital. In the year 2000, his used his small amount savings to establish a clinic at Kibirichia market in Meru.

The clinic serves between 15 to 25 patients a day. To cope up with the increased number of patients, he has employed 1 person to help him run the facility. He offers a number of services, including family planning, curative and preventive medicine, a laboratory and a pharmacy.

Daniel K. attributes his success to support from K-MET. He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers, and improve the quality of care he provides. To further expand his facility, he is applying for a loan of US $1200.

loans.use: Expand his facility to cope with increase of demand for services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Yianina Saori

texts.es:
Señora Yanina Saori lives int he district of El Porvenir, in the town of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad. She is 27 years old and she has 3 children whom she supports. She finished some college courses, but couldn't get a degree due to personal problems.

She joined the local community bank "Victor Raul" at the request of her aunt. She obtained her first loan through this bank in the amount of $300 Nuevo Soles. With this money, she travelled to Lima to buy more clothes so that she could meet her clients' demands because at that time Señora Yanina only sold clothes. Currently, she has added beauty products to the list of items she sells from door to door. For the most part she sells to people she knows but she also travels to the district of Salpo where she used to live.

With this loan of $475 USD, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase toys to sell them during the holiday season.

Señora Yanina dreams of owning a restaurant selling Creole food.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yanina Saori vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 27 años, con 3 hijos que aún depende de ella, tiene grado de instrucción superior incompleta (no pudo terminar de estudiar por problemas personales). Ingresó al Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” por invitación de una tía. En este banco comunal obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/.300.00. Con este dinero viajó a Lima para comprar ropa y así atender sus pedidos, pues la señora Yanina en ese entonces se dedicaba sólo a la venta de ropa. Actualmente también vende productos de belleza, los cuales los distribuye casa por casa a personas conocidas y también vende en la sierra de la región, específicamente en el distrito de Salpo, lugar donde ella vivió anteriormente. Con este préstamo de S/.1,400.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará juguetes para venderlos en esta campaña navideña. La señora Yanina sueña con tener un restaurante de comida criolla.

loans.use: To purchase toys

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is an elderly woman, but in her smile you can still see a sweet young woman with great dreams of prosperity and hopes of making tomorrow a better day. She is making this happy with an opportunity that was given her by a company producing natural products names Tiens. It's been more than a year that she has been working in these sale of these natural products for individuals suffering from general aches and pains, a product that she personally recommends given her experience with the products. This business brings great earnings but it requires a large investment in time, which is why she requires an important influx of capital to acquire greater quantities of orders and products to furnish them, an opportunity to improve her financial situation. She wishes to increase her investment so that she can bring her products to some aboriginal communities and near-by cities. Please help this hard working woman to earn a better life for herself, and improve the health of others as well.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María, es una dama de avanzada edad, que en su semblante aún tiene la sonrisa de una dulce jovencita que tiene muchos deseos de prosperar y hacer del mañana un momento más agradable y lo esta logrando gracias a la oportunidad que le brindaron en la empresa de productos naturales Tiens.Hace más de un año viene trabajando en la venta de productos naturales que ofrece a las personas con dolencias y malestares generales, que recomienda personalmente debido a que dichos productos le han ayudado a recuperarse de su estado de salud y los malestares propios de su edad.Sin embargo esta labor trae muchas ganancias pero toma tiempo, debido a que requiere de una importante suma de dinero como capital de inversión para acopiar mayor cantidad de pedidos y productos que hasta la fecha a Maria le han dado la oportunidad de mejorar su situación económica. Tiene el deseo de incrementar su inversión para llevar sus productos a algunas comunidades nativas y ciudades cercanas..Colabore con esta emprendedora mujer que se gana la vida mejorando la salud de los demás

loans.use: Influx of capital funds to increase her inventory and sales territory.

loans.name: 2030 Kigobe North Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret L.. She is currently in the poultry farming business and is requesting a loan to invest into her business. Margret is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a shop attendant. She has 5 children ranging from age 10 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a commercial house. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 to invest into her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Christine K., Sarah K., Racheal K., and Rose N.. Christine K. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to increase her stock. Sarah K. is currently operating a business selling old clothes and wants a loan to expand the business. Racheal K. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to add to the business. Rose N. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to uplift her business.

loans.use: To boost poultry business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma works hard for her family. Thanks to her business raising guinea pigs, she has been able to provide for her children's necessities. In her home, with the care and nutritious food she gives to the guinea pigs each day, they have grown large and are reproducing quickly. She would like to improve the space where she raises the small animals. With the loan, she hopes to become one of the large exporters of guinea pigs in her city.

Wilma es una noble dama que se preocupa por la integridad de sus seres queridos, gracias a su desempeño en la crianza de cuyes ha podido alcanzar el objetivo de cuidar a su familia y brindarles lo necesario para su pleno desarrollo. En su casa debido a los cuidados y a la nutritiva comida que les da día a día sus pequeños compañeros han alcanzado gran tamaño y se están reproduciendo muy rápido. Su deseo de incrementar y mejorar los espacio de crecimiento de sus cuyes la conducen a solicitar un préstamo con el sueño de convertirse pronto en la más grande exportadora de cuyes de su ciudad.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS RAISING GUINEA PIGS.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin A. is a 44 year old farmer who has sold dairy products to the local people for many years. He started his business in 1997 when he purchased his first calf and start raising it. He lives with his wife and three children in a small village in the Imishli region. He has applied for a loan to expand his business and purchase two dairy cows. He believes this loan and the new cows will help him to improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Nanik

texts.id: Klien sudah masuk pada pinjaman kedua. Setelah melunasi pinjaman pertama, kali ini klien mengajukan pinjaman lagi. Profesi yang dijalani masih seperti sebelumnya yaitu sebagai penjual bahan pokok rumah tangga seperti beras, minyak goreng dan lain-lain. Usahanya cukup mengalami peningkatan meskipun terkadang ada kendala karena harga bahan pokok sekarang terus naik. Tetapi hal itu tidak mengurangi semangatnya untuk terus berusaha. Penghsilannya bersama suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai staff pom bensin cukup untuk membayar sewa rumah tahunan dan meemnuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga sehari-hari

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Ms. Ramatou D. was born in 1971 in Lomé. She married Mr. Bannah TCHAZODI, who is a sheet metal welder. Her main business is selling cosmetics in the Agoè district in Lomé. With the income from her business, she often lends a hand to her husband, who lack a steady income. The first loan that she just paid back enabled her to stock an inventory and to be able to sell a lot.

She is now requesting a loan of 350,000 francs CFA to buy two boxes of straightening agent, six boxes of pomade, and twelve boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame D. Ramatou est née en 1971 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur TCHAZODI Bannah qui est un tôlier soudeur. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits cosmétiques dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Avec le revenu de son activité, elle apporte souvent un coup de main à son mari qui a un revenu irrégulier. Le premier crédit qu’elle vient de solder lui a permis de faire l’approvisionnement et de pouvoir bien vendre. Elle sollicite maintenant un crédit de 350.000FCFA pour acheter 2 cartons de défrisant, 6 cartons de pommade et 12 cartons savons.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic items

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania is a 30-year-old mother of 2 children, who are her reason for living. She owns two motorcycle taxis, one of which her husband, Wilmer drives. He always supports Tania in everything that she does. They both want to give their children the essentials, provide them with nutrition, and take care of their health. Ms. Tania would like to improve her work vehicles, and for this she needs to purchase spare parts and have them fixed, since she does not have enough money to do so and this business is the family’s sole source of income. For this reason, she turns to you with the promise of repaying the loan in a timely and responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tania tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, los mismos que son la razón de su vida, ella es propietaria de 2 mototaxis, uno de ellos lo maneja su pareja, Wilmer, quien siempre apoya en todo a Tania.Ambos quieren brindar a sus niños lo necesario, velar por su alimentación y salud.La señora Tania quiere mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo y para ello requiere comprar repuestos para mandarlos a arreglar, ya que es el único sustento que tienen y no cuenta con la cantidad necesaria, para ello recurre a ustedes con la promesa de devolver el préstamo de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi repair and maintenance

loans.name: Hudoyberdi

texts.ru:
Hudoyberdi A. was born and lives in the city of Yavan. He has a large family. He has 6 sons all of which are , however, still small. However they too try to help the family as best as they can. Hudoyberdi works at Daewoo as a driver. His salary is not large enough to feed his large family. This is why his entire family is in business of raises cattle. Currently his business experiences a problem with animal feed. For this purpose he has decided to obtain a credit that will allow him to purchase animal feed and carry on with his business. He plans to repay the loan within a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Астонов Худойберды уроженец города Яван. Имеет большую семью , где у него растут шестеро сыновей. Все они еще маленькие , но стараются помогать родителям в домашнем хозяйстве. Худойберды работает водителем в ДЭУ , но его заработная плата не настолько большая , чтобы ему хватало для того , чтобы прокормить семью. Поэтому они всей семьей занимаются животноводством. В данный момент у него возникли проблемы с комбикормом. Поэтому он решил получить кредит , не который сможет закупить корма и продолжать свой бизнес. Погасить кредит Худойберды сможет в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Mrs. Ban Sok's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province form a village bank [solidarity group]. The group members will use the loan in different ways. Mrs. Ban S. is the village bank president, and she raises three pigs and four cows. Because her animals are growing very fast now and she does not have enough money to purchase more food to feed them, Mrs. Ban S. decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Kong Teng, helps his wife with the business. Mrs. Ban S. is a 34-year-old woman without any children.

Mrs. Yin G. L. did not come to receive her loan. Her husband came for her instead, so he is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Ten members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. The product allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK [Kiva’s Field Partner] has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.

Elsa es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Elsa viaja a 3 ferias diferentes de la región en donde vende ropa variada, los días domingos vende en la feria de las Américas ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho de los mayoristas y cada 2 meses viaja a la ciudad de Lima. En algunas oportunidades Elsa viaja a otros pueblos donde hay ferias donde también vende ropa.

Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias, polos, pantalones. Elsa sueña con construir su casa, tener un carro para trasladar sus productos y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank La Kantuta.

Elsa lives with her partner, is 27 years old, and has 2 children. Elsa travels to 3 different fairs in the region in which she sells a variety of clothing. On Sundays she sells in the fair of the Americas, located close to the city of Ayacucho. She acquires her products in the city of Ayacucho from the wholesalers, and every 2 months she travels to the city of Lima. On some occasions, Elsa travels to other towns in which there are fairs where she also sells clothes.

Elsa needs a loan for 1600 soles, money which will be invested in buying stockings, polo shirts, trousers. She dreams with building her house, having a car to transport her products, and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying stockings, polo shirts, trousers

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: M. Dilorom is a happy mother of 4 children. She is 29 years old and married. Dilorom is a teacher. Her salary is very little whicj is’s why she has been running her own grocery business. For five years she has been selling foodstuff like sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee and many other things in her grocery store. Dilorom’s wish is to increase her business, offering various type of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity and with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 9 months. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting her.

loans.use: Foodstuff to increase the range of selling goods

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
A resident of Baray Commune in Kompong Tom Province, Mrs. Tha P., the 41-year-old mother of four children, (one a garment worker in Phnom Penh City), raises pigs to sell. Involved in this business since 1995. Tha reports that her business is doing well, and that her $120 per month income helps to sustain her family as it is coupled with the salary of her husband, 43-year-old truck driver Mr. Pom Nou.

Tha is now requesting a loan of $300 both to purchase more piglets to raise and to decorate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Liem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of seventeen people, and is located in Leach village in Kampong Chhnang province. The group members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Liem P., the village bank president, is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this plantation, she sells firewood to make a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. Liem P. tries to work hard, she doesn't earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Liem P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. Mrs. Liem P. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer while the youngest one attends the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These nine members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term ( EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 39 years old and married with three children. Bola sells foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She is a dedicated client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She is grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ester Beatriz

texts.es: Doña Ester tiene la edad de 60 años, desde muy joven ha trabajado en las ventas, vende refresco, alquila sillas, y vende comida, todo que sea un buen ingreso para su bolsillo, empezó solo vendiendo repostería con ahorros propio, sus hijos son independiente, reside en  el barrio 380 en la ciudad de Managua, con este solicitud de crédito es la sexta que va invertir en comprar dos puertas para la sala ya que las que tiene están en mal estado, también  va a comprar una maya y poner en el cerco para repararlo mejor y estar segura. Con este crédito en Afodenic se ha beneficiado ya que ha logrado hacer las mejoras  a su casa. Sus planes es incrementar el volumen de venta para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ester is 60 years old, since she was young she has worked in sales, she sells drinks, rents chairs and sells food, all of which is a good income for her pocket. She started selling with her own savings, her children are independent, and she lives in the 380 neighborhood in the city of Managua, with this credit request it is the sixth which she will invest in buying two doors for her living room now that the ones she has are in bad condition, she is also going to buy a and put it close to repair it better and be safe. With this loan in Afodenic she has benefited since she has been able to improve her house. Her plan is to increase the volume of sales to have better incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying two doors

loans.name: Aleyda De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Aleyda  a sus 35 años de edad, es una mujer activa, trabaja en servicios domésticos desde hace dieciocho años, que inicio con la necesidad de apoyar a sus padres,  como para cubrir sus necesidades  personales, habita en Lomas de memorial sandino con una hija de 9 años de edad, que cursa el segundo grado, su esposo se desempeña como cadete de taxi, ella no dejo de trabajar para poder ayudarse entre si con los gastos y ahorrar para hacer su propia casa, en Afodenic esta es su sexta solicitud lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficios ya que ha podido hacer las mejoras a su casa y poder gozar con sus familia de una casa digna, con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en frente de su casa, y poder estar segura y mejor protección para su hija. Sus planes a futuro es poder lograr tener una pulpería donde pueda gozar estar apoyando a su hija en casa.
texts.en:
Doña Aleyda, aged 35, is an active woman who has worked in domestic services since the age of 18, when she began working because of the need to help her parents and to cover her own personal expenses. She lives in Lomas de Memorial Sandino district with a 9 year old daughter who is currently in second grade. Her husband works as a taxi cadet. She hasn't stopped working though so she can help with the household bill sand save money for their own house. This is her sixth loan from Afodenic: her loans have been very beneficial and have already allowed her to improve her house and allow her family to enjoy a dignified home. With this loan she is going to purchase construction materials to make a wall in front of her house to provide security and better protection for their daughter. Their future plans are to be able to set-up a grocery store where she will be able to enjoy helping her daughter in the home.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a wall

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sells traveling bags and hair extension. She has been in the trade for the past four years.

She lives in Okoko, in Lagos state with her four children. Susan is 45 years old and needs a loan of N80, 0000 to purchase more hair extension and traveling bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase more traveling bags and hair extension to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 50 years old and is married with 8 children. She sells wine and drinks and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 150,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more wine and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and drinks to sell

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 44 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Radwan has been working as a car repairer. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. Radwan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

Radwan is special in his work because he does it well and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Radwan decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Phou's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phou K., 39, was selected as the team leader by the other two members of the group. Phou K. currently sells snack cakes from a hand-cart that she transports around her village. She is able to make an income around of $3 each day to support her family's daily expenses. She is divorced but has no child so she lives alone in a medium-size house. Phou K. noticed that selling beef is a profitable business and is a good idea to invest in; thus, she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to be used as capital to begin selling beef in the local market. The other two borrowers are Un R. and Khun N.. Un R. is a used goods seller who looking for a loan to buy more used goods to sell. Khun N. sells breakfast foods for neighbors and is applying for a loan to start a new business as a hairdresser.

loans.use: To order beef to begin selling in the local market

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad says every day is wonderful because she spends it in the company of children. She has been running her in-home day care center since 2003, but her experience extends decades back. She is married and is the mother of three grown children.

Trinidad received a loan from ACCION USA to make improvements to her in-home day care. She is refinishing her floors, painting and purchasing some new toys and practical items for the children. As a licensed day care provider, she is required to make these improvements. 

With the help of her daughter, Trinidad would like to one day open a larger day care outside of her home where she can make an even greater impact on her community.

loans.use: New flooring and paint for her home-based business as well as new toys and playpens

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods. Precious is married with 2 children and she is 32 years old. Precious hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase of more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Winfa Yovana

texts.es:
La señora Winfa Yovana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 3 hijos y  tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (4to grado).  Vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Ella es socia nueva, y requiere unpréstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizará para la elaboración de artesanías y quesanas (calaminas/tejas), comprará totora y chillihuas (plantas).

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de abarrotes en su comunidad.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Winfa Yovana belongs to “Las Totoritas” Community Bank in the community of Chimu, district of Puno, Peru. She is a 27-year-old mother of three with a fourth grade education and lives with her common-law husband. She lives in central Chimu and is a new member to the community bank. She is requesting a loan of 500 soles, which she plans to use to purchase reeds and other weaving plants to make her artisan crafts. Her wish is to set up a grocery store in her community. Winfa Yovana enjoys the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Sokhna Diarra

texts.fr: sokhna diarra S. evolue dans la vente d'habillement depuis deux(02)ans.celibataire sans enfants elle a une grande experience dans le domaine du commerce.elle sollicite un credit de deux cent(200 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement et afin de repondre ala demande croissante de sa clientele.
texts.en:
Sokhna Diarra S. has been developing her business selling clothes for 2 years. Single and without children, she has a large amount of business experience. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to increase her working capital and so to respond to the growing demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy boxes of sardines, tomatoes, cookies, and various other goods

loans.name: Faanimo

texts.en:
"Faanimo T. (0) is a 30 years-year-old woman living in the town of Ulutogia.  She is married and has 2 children school-aged children.  To make a living, Faanimo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale.  Faanimo has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 270 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Faanimo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faanimo is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Faanimo is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Faanimo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en:
Abdulatif is a young entrepreneur who started his own business selling foodstuffs six years ago, as a way to help his mother. With hard work and a lot of effort, he has succeeded in growing his business. This is also thanks to daily improvement in the quality of the service and products he offers his clients.

Abdulatif is now married and has a little child. This is his motivation for continuing to improve and grow his business. To cover current demand from his clients, Abdulatif is requesting a loan of 6000 somoni. With your help, Abdulatif will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to grow his business. He appreciates the opportunity your support offers him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase confectionary for selling

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
23-year-old Leah R. is a young mother to 2 children. She has been married to her husband, Julio, for 5 years already. Leah owns a rice farm. Her crops are starting to grow now but she said insects also started to inhabit on her farm. This gives difficulty to Leah’s farming.

She heard of CEV and its good feedback from neighbor barangays and was more than glad to qualify as a member last September 2009. She requested to loan Php6, 000. Leah will use this loan to finance her farm and hopefully get rid of the insects and have a good harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es: Marta Elizabeth G. R. reside en Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. Marta tiene 42 años de edad es madre soltera y vive solamente con sus dos hijos Gabriela de 21 años de edad y Felipe de 18 años de edad, ambos estudiantes. Marta maneja su propio negocio donde vende productos cosméticos y ropa, para Marta ha sido difícil su estabilización económica ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico de nadie, pero ahora con su negocio encuentra estabilidad ya que sus ventas son frecuentes, ella esta solicitando de este crédito para poder surtir su inventario en productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta Elizabeth G. R. lives in Colon in the La Libertad department. Marta, 42, is a single mother. She lives alone with her two children; Gabriela who is 21, and Felipe who is 18. Both of them are students. Marta manages her own business selling cosmetic products and clothes. It has been difficult for Marta to stabilize her economic situation because she does not receive economic support from anyone. Now that her business is stable and she has frequent sales, she is asking for a loan to be able to stock her inventory with products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in Takeo province. To earn a living, she buys and sells bananas at the local market and typically makes US$2.30 profit every day. Her husband is a construction foreman. On average, he makes US$8 every day. Two of the children are in school. Pech S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en: Juliah M. is a 23 year old medical nurse and is married to Pius Chovi. The couple lives in Shanzu, Mombasa where Juliah runs a pharmacy (chemist's shop). She has been in this business for two years and has been able offer her services to the local residents. Juliah intends to increase her supplies of antibiotics, analgesics and antiflammatories in her pharmacy with this first loan that she is accessing in KADET. She hopes to establish an even bigger pharmacy in future to be able to reach out to the communities around Shanzu, and that she hopes will be a reality with subsequent KADET loans. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy antibiotics, analgesics and antiflammatories.

loans.name: Milka Achieng

texts.en: Milka Achieng O. has owned and run the Dafina Highway Hotel in Kisumu for nine years.  She has seven employees and sells soft drinks, beer and food to local residents, travelers and businesses.  The hotel is located along a busy highway and her challenges are frequent power failures and bad weather.  She is using the proceeds of KES20,000 to buy more crates of soft drinks like sodas and fresh juice.  She is looking forward in running a three star hotel in the future.  Milka is married with three children and describes herself as passionate and caring.

loans.use: Crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Munh-Ochir

texts.en:
Munh-Ochir J. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children both go to a local kindergarten.

Munh-Ochir has a small business selling a variety of small goods. She rents a small stall at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells various convenience products, including toilet paper, hygienic tissues, Scotch tape, batteries, etc. She has been a saleswoman at the market since 2000 and has gained significant experience in small retail. She mostly purchases the products from Ereen, China, a border town where many of cheap Chinese products are imported from. She dreams of owning a small nice house for her family. She says that it would be nice to live with her family in a comfortable house, especially during the cold winter.

She requests a loan to purchase more products for this business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Helder

texts.es: Helder C. R. esta muy contento de la familia que tiene es por ello que el desea darles una mejor calidad de vida. La casa que el tiene es de Interés social es muy pequeña y necesita algunos arreglos, las paredes con el tiempo se van deteriorando y la puerta la cierra con una cadena atravesada para que este protegida de algún delincuente que quiera robar. Pero el y su esposa al momento de irse a trabajar no se quedan a gusto por que la casa se queda sola y temen que puedan tirar la puerta y robar las pertenencias que con mucho esfuerzo han ido comprando.
texts.en:
Helder C. R. is very happy with the family he has and for this reason wants to give them a better quality of life. The house he has is a very small, publicly subsidized house, that needs repair. The walls have deteriorated over time and the door must be closed with a chain through it so that it can be protected against any delinquent that may want to rob them. He and his wife worry when they leave to go to work because their house is left unattended and they fear that someone could simply push the door down and take their belongings which they have worked so very hard to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair walls and doors.

loans.name: Bolívar

texts.es:
Bolívar F. S., tiene la edad de 53 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 18,14, 10 y 4 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para Compra de inventario para el negocio de abarrotes.El desea darle el mantenimiento adecuado a su negocio para que sus ventas aumenten y por ende aumentar sus ingresos económicos, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería que lo creó hace aproximadamdente dos años. El desea surtir su pulpería con con la compra de mercadería  de la canasta básica sobre todo.
No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron, porque esto le ha ayudado a que su negocio crezca.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Bolívar F. S., 53, is married and has 4 children, who are his first priority in life. His children are 18, 14, 10, and 4 years old, respectively. He needs funding to buy stock items for his grocery store. He wants to stock his store well-enough so that his sales will increase thereby increasing his income. His business is a small grocery store that he created about two years ago. He wants to stock it primarily with merchandise that is typical of the “canasta basica” (Traditionally, canasta basica has represented the minimum food and household items required for a family over a one-month period). This isn’t his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms granted because this has been of great help for his business’ growth. He hopes in the future to provide his wife and children with a better quality of life and improved economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 40-year-old single man. He has been working for the past 12 years in the business of producing cleaning products and detergents. He's well known in the whole region where he distributes his products to the shops and he sells also to individual clients upon their request. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 USD to buy merchandise needed such as raw materials and plastic bottles to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: buy merchandise needed such as raw materials and plastic bottles

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
S. Muzaffar is 40 years old. He is married and has three children of school age. His wife is a teacher in a secondary school. 

Muzaffar manufactures national cradles. National cradles in Tajikistan are very colorful. They are made of wood. As a rule, the national cradle is presented by the grandparents when the baby is forty days old, and this event is celebrated by the entire family. 

Muzaffar has been in this business for seventeen years. His wife helps him. The completed cradles are purchased from their house. The stability of the business allows a steady income which ensures that the family has the possibility of improving their living conditions.

Muzaffar has been working with IMON for four years. For the entire period of time he has shown himself as a successful client, managing his loans with accuracy and precision. Today Muzaffar requests a loan in the amount of $1500 in order to purchase more planks and paints for producing more cradles. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase planks and paints for making cradles.

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Ramona de la Concepción O., tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio Roberto González, tiene alrededor de ocho años que empezo su negocio teniéndolo fijo en su casa ya que antes la señora O. caminaba vendiendo ambulante en las calles todo tipo de mercaderia.
La señora Ramona O., empezo su negocio con C$ 2,000.00 que fueron ahorrado con la ayuda de su esposo, abre el negocio a las nueve de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche aprovechando que ahí esta en su casa y poder vender un poquito mas, ya que ella es una señora luchadora y  se esmera  para mantener a un sobrino que es como su hijo que esta estudiando en primaria, su esposo le ayuda a vender y a colocar barriles vacios con los compañeros de trabajo de el ingenio  lugar donde el  trabaja.
La señora O. tiene dos años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y ella nos manifestó que se siente muy satisfecha con los financiamientos ya que ella ha superado bastante y su negocio a incrementado bastante ahora vende barriles y le saca mas ganancias a este nuevo producto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona has a business selling used and new clothing in her personal home located in the Roberto González neighborhood. She started doing business permanently from her home about eight years ago because before she was a walking vendor on the streets selling all types of merchandise. Mrs. Ramona started her business with C$ 2,000.00 that she was able to save with the help of her husband. She opens the business at 9 AM and stays open until 8 PM, taking advantage of the fact that it is her home and she can be open a little bit later. She is a hard working lady who also devotes herself to supporting her nephew, a primary school student who is like a son to her. Her husband helps her place and sell empty barrels with his co-workers from the factory where he works. Mrs. Ramona has been working with Ceprodel for two and a half years and tells us she is very happy with the financing because she's moving forward and has improved significantly in her business. Now she sells barrels and her earnings are higher with this new product.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel Perez-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pack of used children's clothing

loans.name: Rosy Jean

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for 43-year-old Rosy Jean. She has a rice farming business in Norala, South Cotabato. She lacks capital to finance her business which is why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy farm supplies.

Rosy Jean is the mother of five children; the eldest is five years old. She wants them to have a bright future by providing for their needs. The loan will be of great help.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Harun Muchugia

texts.en:
Harun is a 33-year-old gentleman who is married to Judy, a tailor by profession. They have two children: a son who is six and a daughter who is four. 

Harun was introduced to Kadet by an existing Kadet client. He has been selling ready-made clothes for the past two years. He does tailoring with the support of his wife as his other source of income. He plans to add more clothes stock in his boutique shop with items like trouser suits and children’s clothes. He also has plans to relocate his business to a more viable market.

Harun intends to re-invest in the business and increase his capital to meet demand. His future hopes are to grow the business and sell as a wholesaler. He describes himself as a very enterprising businessman, intelligent and always determined to achieve what he sets out to do.

loans.use: To add more stock like trouser suits and children's clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
At her young age (36 years old), Ruth B. has become a successful businesswoman. She started her business using the loan she received from ASHI. This was just small then but because of so many trials in life, Ruth strived hard to make it grow and expand. 

Ruth feels glad about her business achievement. However, it is not yet stable enough for her to feel financially secure. Without a loan, her business can never grow. Therefore, Ruth is requesting another loan in a larger amount to support and maintain her primary business (E-Load business) and secondary business of buy and sell ventures. She hopes that by having several businesses, she will have more income, have more savings for the future of her children, and will be able to help her other relatives by employing them to work with her in her businesses.

Her vision of giving her three children a better future using the proceeds of her business enhanced her eagerness to explore the potentials of her businesses. Her husband, George has been so supportive of all her ventures.

Ruth hopes with God’s guidance that she can comply with her loan obligation and give a decent life to her family. Her long-term goal is to have her own jewelry shop, to secure a stable source of additional income, and to be financially independent from her parents. Instead of depending on her parents for some of their family expenses, she will be the one to give them financial help. Ruth will use the profits to give a better education to her three children and save some of it to support and fulfill her business dreams.

loans.use: To maintain her E-loading business and her buy and sell ventures

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Sofia es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Sofia venD. leña a diferentes comercios, productos que elL. misma elabora , además Sofia los días sábados viaja a L. ferias D. donD. compra papa que luego venD. en el mercado mayorista.
Sofia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. árboles para hacer leña.
Los sueños D. Sofia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sofía, 42, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is married and has 5 children. She makes firewood that she sells to various businesses. In addition, on Saturdays she travels to farmers' markets to buy potatoes that she then resells in the wholesale market. Sofía needs a 3000 sol loan to buy trees from which to make firewood. Sofía's dreams are that her children complete their schooling and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trees for making firewood.

loans.name: María Hilda Del Transito

texts.es: María Hilda del Transito P. de 55 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, la cual se dedica a vender deliciosos tamales, los cuales son hechos de masa de maíz, en la cual se coloca pequeños trozos de pollo y se envuelve en hojas de huerta de guineo, y luego se cocinan. María vive junto a su hija quien trabaja como profesora, y junto a su nieto de 11 años de edad, el cual esta al cuidado de María. Ella se encarga de elaborar y comercializar los tamales de forma ambulante por diferentes caseríos del departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual también habita junto a su familia. Debido al delicioso sabor de los tamales, cuenta con una cantidad de clientes bastante grande, por lo que la venta es bastante estable, y la cual le permite contar con el dinero suficiente para tener una vida digna, es por ello que María desea contar con un préstamo de Integral, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, hojas de huerta de guineo, leña, pollo y algunas verduras para elaborar más tamales, de esta forma ella podrá mejorar sus ventas y así mismo su estabilidad económica, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para tener todo lo necesario para vivir desea mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Hilda del Transito P. is 55 years old and a cheerful hardworking woman. She sells delicious tamales which are made of ground corn, contain small pieces of chicken, and wrapped and cooked in banana leaves. María lives with her daughter, who is a teacher, and cares for her 11 year old grandson. She is in charge of producing and selling tamales as a traveling vendor in the different villages throughout the Department of San Miguel. María and her family live in this same area. Due to the great taste of her tamales, she has been able to attract a large customer base and maintain stable sales. This allows her to earn sufficient income to have a decent life.

For this reason, she is applying for a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can by corn in bulk, banana leaves, firewood, chicken, and some vegetables for making more tamales. This will enable her to improve her sales and achieve financial stability. Since this is her only source of income, María wants to do everything necessary to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making tamales

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari, Pakistan with her husband and four children. All of them are young and getting their education. Her husband is involved in the business of selling cosmetics while Sajida helps her husband by doing embroidery which she started by taking a loan through Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan).

Sajida has applied for the second time for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s cosmetics business. He will add more variety of cosmetic products to his shop such as nail polishes, creams, lipsticks, and face creams etc. She is hopeful that her husband’s income will be increased by investing money into the business, and her family will be able to enjoy the basic necessities of life. 

Note: The cutter in this photo belongs to Sugran, a member of Sajida's group. She uses it to prepare food for her buffalo.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and improve her land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials for kitchen improvement.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie D. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 47 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $225 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 11th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
