loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport salt.

loans.name: Buyanbaatar

texts.en:
Buyanbaatar, 27 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. They own a house in a suburb of Darkhan. The eldest daughter is 7 and attends a local school and the two other children go to kindergarten. In 2003, Buyanbaatar bought a car on leasing contract from the bank and started his taxi business. He has been in this business for 7 years and bought a house for his family from his taxi business profit. 

Buyanbaatar’s wife is a disabled woman with a lame leg, but she is a very energetic and enthusiastic businesswoman. She runs a small workshop in which she makes interwoven wool clothes and fabrics. She has six looms and employs four weaver workers. She produces wool products for a local textile factory on subcontract. Her order increases in the winter. 

Buyanbaatar and his wife raise a chicken and ducks in the garden as well. The reason Buyanbaatar is requesting this loan is he wants to build a warm garage for his car and save garage rent money. In wintertime in Mongolia, especially at night, the temperature drops to minus 40 degrees Celsius, which makes starting a car a burden for the drivers. He also wants to buy some wool threads for his wife’s business.

loans.use: To build a warm garage for his car and buy wool threads for his wife's business

loans.name: Teofy

texts.en:
Teofy is from the village of Dullan, Aloran Oroquieta City. She is 45 years old. Teofy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teofy  owns  and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Teofy has been in this business for about six years and earns approximately  3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Teofy  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofy  has successfully repaid her previous loan of 12,000 PHP. Teofy  is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for her sari-sari store. This loan will be Teofy's eighth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template so its Field Partners could continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina G. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 61 years old. Rosalina is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Rosalina owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling used-clothing & shoe products in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de verduras y tiene 23 años, Ella vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de una niña de 8 años, su horario de atención es de 6:00am hasta las 4:00pm, aprendió este negocio por su madre quien le enseño a administrarlo.
Martha solicita un préstamo para la inversión de frutas y verduras, considerando que una inversión en este momento le ayudaría a fortalecer sus ventas y sus ingresos, ya que depende de este negocio para mantenerse y mantener a su hija.
Ella quiere tener un negocio más estable con mayor afluencia de clientes, así mismo mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the city of San Miguel and she sells vegetables for a living. She is 23 years old and she lives with her parents. She is a single mother of an 8-year old girl. She works from 6am to 4pm and she learned the business from her mother. She taught her how to run the business.  Martha requests a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. An investment in her business at this time will help her solidify her sales and improve her earnings. She depends on this business to support herself and her daughter.

She wants to have a more stable business with a larger client base. She also wants to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Tula Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Estrellas de Tula y esta ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo México, esta comunidad es conocida por su nombre y tener un monumento representativo a un héroe nacional. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Apolonia C. se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos que inicio hace 27 años solicita el préstamo para seguir reacondicionando su local. Tiene 47 años estudio hasta la primaria y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad y casados, sus clientes son en su mayoría  padres o alumnos de las escuelas ya que esta ubicado a unas cuadras de ellas,  al momento de solicitar su crédito ella se siente feliz y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brinda; quiere este crédito para continuar reacondicionando su local y así seguir mejorando su calidad de vida, tanto de ella como de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Estrellas de Tula” (Tula Stars) and is located in the state of Hidalgo, México.  This community is known for its name and for having a monument dedicated to a national hero.  The group has 10 members.Mrs. Apolonia C. sells Mexican fast food.  She started her business 27 years ago and is asking for funds to continue to equip her eatery.  

She is 47 years old and finished elementary school.  She has three children who are now married adults.  Her customers, for the most part, are parents and school children because she’s located a few blocks from them.  

She is happy and grateful while asking for the loan because of the support it provides.  She wants the loan to continue refurbishing her locale and continue to improve her quality of life both for herself and for her family.

loans.use: To refurbish her food stand.

loans.name: Kov

texts.en: Kov T. is a 62-year-old woman and a widow; her husband died of senility a year ago. Kov T. is a local farmer who has been living in Phnom Penh City, and she owns and operates her farm to cultivate rice. She currently lives with her children, as her two children are single and living under her management. Both of her children work at sewing clothes in the garment factory. Kov T.’s children complain that it is hard to travel to work because they don’t have a vehicle. They go to work by taxi or they walk. Kov T. is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her child to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her child to ride to work.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 12 años tiene su tienda de comestibles donde todos los días vende productos de primera necesidad, es uno de los pocos establecimientos que hay en su barrio y sus hijos la apoyan en la atención de su negocio. Siempre trata de mantener su tienda bien abarrotada de productos variados y con precios cómodos, de esa manera consigue captar más clientes. Manifiesta que le agrada su trabajo porque le permite socializarse con las demás personas, además que la hace independiente, y se genera sus propios ingresos económicos, por ello planea mas adelante crecer en su negocio. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda y aprovechar esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old and has her own house where she lives with her husband and her three children. She has run her own grocery store for more than 12 years now. She works there every day selling basic foodstuffs. It is one of few establishments in her neighborhood. Her children help her out by keeping an eye on the store. She always tries to keep her store well-stocked with various products which she sells at reasonable prices. That way, she is able to attract more customers.

She is happy with her work because it allows her to socialize with others, to be independent, and to generate her own income. For this reason, she is planning in advance to grow her business. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She is also glad to be part of her village bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive individuals.

She would like to thank everyone who contributes to the loan she is requesting as it will be very helpful for the development of her store. She will use the requested loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her store and to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: To stock up on various products

loans.name: Kyamwasha Bakyara Kwebisaho Group

texts.en: M. Victor belongs to Kyamwasha Bakyara group in Ntungamo. He is 50 years old and married with 8 children and he is involved in shoe selling from Rukoni trading center. He has been in business for 25 years selling shoes, most of which he buys from Kampala and he is able to make 150,000/= as weekly profits. He is also involved in the sale of maize, bananas and beans and he is happy about the trend that his business is taking. He has been able to expand his enterprises and educate his children and he needs a loan to be able to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.use: Buying more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem Y., 33, is the mother of three children. All her kids are single and still live under her care. She was once married, but has been divorced from her husband for a year. To earn a living, Sem Y. owns a small store at a good location. 

In her shop, she sells different kinds of products such as soft drink, water, fast food, and other items to people from her village and other villages.  One of her children assists her in the business with the buying and selling.

Sem Y. normally earns an average of $8 per day to help cover the family’s daily living expenses. Sem Y. is currently selling well because she has skills in communicating with people. To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a loan which she will use  to accumulate various items, for example fast food, soft drinks, and other products to sell.  With the rest of the funds, she will buy a piece of land in a good location for farming, and will hire it out to earn additional income.

loans.use: To buy products to sell, and buy a piece of land to lease out

loans.name: Promesa Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “PROMESA” es un grupo de 9 mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  serán parte del centro focal de Senkata, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.

Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos:    costura de deportivos, costura de camisas, venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, tejido de mantas de lana de Alpaca, Taller de Chaperia, costura de Deportivos, venta de cosméticos.

Para su organización, la B. C. Promesa cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Maria Elena, una tesorera, la señora  Luisa y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Beybi Lupe.

La  Presidenta, la señora  Maria Elena vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos (de once, diez y siete años de edad).    La señora  María Elena está iniciando su negocio, ella ha proyectado la apertura de una tienda de barrio en su propio domicilio, por iniciativa propia.  En cuanto a la venta ella espera que sus hijos mayores le ayuden.

El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.2000.- y será destinado para la compra de mercadería, como azúcar, arroz, fideo, pan.
La señora Maria Elena indica que esta es su primera experiencia como socia de Pro Mujer,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “el ahorro y la atención en Salud”.
texts.en: The "Promesa" ("Promise") Community Bank is a group of nine women who have decided to come together to receive a loan, training and health care. They are part of the main center in Senkata and are starting their first loan cycle. Each one of the members has her own business, as a service provider, producer or merchant. Among the jobs are: sewing sportswear; sewing shirts; selling food; running a grocery store; weaving blankets with alpaca wool; running a body shop; and selling cosmetics. The community bank has a board of directors consisting of president Maria Elena, treasurer Luisa, and secretary Beybi Lupe. President Maria Elena lives with her partner and their three children (ages 11, 10 and 7). She is starting her business. She is planning on opening up a neighborhood store and running it on her own out of her home, and she hopes her oldest children will help her. She is requesting her portion of the loan of Bs. 2000 and plans to use it to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, noodles and bread. Maria Elena says this is her first experience as a member of Kiva partner Pro Mujer. When asked what attracted her to the institution, she said "the savings and health care."

loans.use: Compra de mercadería (azúcar, arroz, fideo)

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José de 28, reside en Usulután, vive con padre, tienen casa propia y tiene una tienda móvil, este negocio tiene 10 años de existir y la dinámica es vender mercadería en un pick up, mercadería de primera necesidad y verduras, este vehículo le ayuda muchísimo a transportarse a diferentes zonas y caseríos para ofrecer sus productos. 
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, ya que por el momento no dispone de dinero para comprar verduras y mercadería como maíz, arroz, aceite, azúcar que son necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su tienda y que continúe conquistando clientes por las zonas aledañas.
Su objetivo es mejorar y fortalecer el negocio, esperando que también su condición económica se estabilice y su calidad de vida sea mejor.
texts.en:
José, 28, lives in Usulután with his father.  They have their own house and he is a food peddler from his pickup truck.  He has had this business for 10 years and he sells household staples and vegetables.  This vehicle helps him greatly moving merchandise to different areas and villages where he can offer his products.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise since at the moment he doesn't have money to buy vegetables and products such as corn, rice, oil, and sugar which are all necessary to offer customers.  This loan will help him improve his store and let him continue acquiring customers in distant areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and food products such as corn, rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en:
Uranbileg is 43 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter, son-in-law and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outer ger districts of the city. Her son attends college, while her husband works as a driver at a local company. Uranbileg worked as a teacher at a kindergarten from 1989 to 2000.

Uranbileg supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with regular help from her daughter and daughter’s husband. 

Uranbileg began her business in 2000 and now she has 2,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital at her two stalls. She purchases clothing for her business from China once or twice a month, depending on her income. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT to purchase clothing for spring from Ereen City, China. She wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.  

Her business goal is to improve her business by buying her own indoor clothing store. This will be more comfortable than working outside everyday at Narantuul market.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for spring

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma O. is from the city of Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Wilma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $233 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rossanna Vanessa

texts.es:
Rossanna Vanessa G. C. tiene 27 años, es vive en unión libre vive con el compañero y con la hija en le Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería y otros son comerciantes de carne.

Rossanna Vanessa se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta. 

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es tener casa propia y su propio negocio.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Rossanna Vanessa G. C., 27, lives with her partner and daughter in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.  She has 1 child.

Rossanna Vanessa's community bank, EXITO DEL MANANA, is located in the Ventanas region of Los Rios and meets at the 24 de Mayo community center.  The group's members make their livings as merchants, selling perfumes, clothing, jewelry, etc.  Others are meat merchants.

Rossanna Vanessa buys and sells Yambal beauty products.  She selects what she wants to order from catalogs, calls to submit her order and sells her merchandise door to door.  

Rossanna Vanessa is applying for a loan to stock her business.  The loan will help fund the things she needs for the business.  Her greatest challenges are competition from other businesses like hers and high prices.  Her goal is own a house and shop of her own.

Rossanna Vanessa likes to watch television.

loans.use: to stock cosmetics sales business

loans.name: Freol

texts.es: Freol, de 33 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rosa de 42 años y esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro, para poder tener un mejor futuro. Cuando era niño, los padres de Freol le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha papa, arveja, maíz y habas, para luego venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de las plagas de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea alquilar tierras de sus vecinos, para incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Freol is 33 years old and a very friendly and hard-working man. He lives in his own home along with his wife Rosa, 42, and is prepared to work very hard in order to have a better future. When he was a boy, Freol's parents taught him all he needed to know about farming, and little by little as time passed he took over his parents' land. Now he has extensive fields of crops where he harvests potatoes, peas, corn and lima beans, which he then sells at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What he likes most about his job is cultivating the land, since this allows him to feed his family. He has 13 years' experience in this activity, and the thing he considers to be the most difficult is protecting his crops from harmful pests. With time, he wants to rent land from his neighbors so he can expand his production. This is Freol's 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he has always been punctual with his payments and hopes to be this time as well. He is a very supportive member of his community bank. With the loan of 3,000 soles he is requesting, Freol plans to purchase more fertilizer and manure to care for his crops.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda is 24 years old and lives with his younger brother and mother in the village of Gantiadi, Adjara region. Both brothers are hard workers, but they work in different fields. Imeda’s brother works in a local company, while Imeda is heading the agricultural activities in the family. He has a tangerine garden with an area of 1500 sq meters. Also, he grows different types of vegetables. Harvested fruit and vegetables are sold locally. Along with the above-mentioned activities, Imeda has a pond, where he grows locally widespread species of fish. Starting from the spring season the fish will start to spawn and he will re-start intensive sales of them. 

With the requested amount he wants to purchase feed for his fish. He hopes that the price of fish will not go down and his income will be enough to make some improvements in the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fish.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: Karla tiene 39 años, se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de hablar con sus clientes pues siempre ha estado pendiente del buen servicio y buena calidad en sus productos.  Tiene más de 11 años con este medio de vida con mucho empeño y dedicación ha logrado sacar a sus tres hijos adelante y que todavía están bajo su cargo.  Es por este motivo que solicita su crédito para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, bolsas, comal y frijoles.
texts.en: Karla, age 39, makes her living selling tortillas. She is a very hardworking person who enjoys talking to her clients -- she has always been focused on providing good service and on having high quality products. Karla has been in this business for over eleven years, and with a lot of effort and dedication, she has been able to raise her three children who are still in her care.  Karla is seeking a loan to purchase corn, beans, firewood, comal (a pan for tortilla preparation), and other items.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the preparation of tortillas (corn, firewood, beans, etc)

loans.name: Ada Maria

texts.es:
Ada,vive con su esposo  y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la comercialización de sandalias, zapatos, tiene un molino de nixtamal y vende tortillas, Inicio con el molino hace 2 años, hoy día ha agregado otro rubro que es la venta de zapatos y sandalias desde hace un año.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz para hacer las tortillas, zapatos y sandalias para el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar una buena inversión a ambos negocios, mejorando el inventario y con la posibilidad de mejorar las ventas.
Sus aspiraciones es aumentar su inventario y expandir el negocio, que sus ventas aumenten y que le permita tener una mejor condición de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Ada llives with her husband and two children. She has a business selling sandals and shoes, and also has a mortar and pestle for nixtamal and sells tortillas. She started with the tortillas 2 years ago, and a year ago she added another enterprise selling shoes and sandals. She requests a loan to purchase firewood and corn for making the tortillas, and shoes and sandals to sell. This loan will help her make a good investment in both businesses, improving her inventory with the possibility of increased sales. Her dream is to increase her inventory and expand the business so her sales increase and allow her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn to make tortillas, and shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia vive en Guaitil de Guanacaste, es madre soltera de 6 hijos  y acaba de cumplir su  aniversario 66 
Ella ha logrado mantener su familia gracias a  la venta de artesanías elaboradas por ella misma.  Hace poco decidió también dedicarse a la venta de ropa, es por eso que desea un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de inventario de ropa para venderla a domicilio.
Ella está feliz porque ama trabajar y sabe que con este préstamo sus ingresos mejoraran.
Dona Eugenia es socia de  la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Crediguatil S.A una de las 110 empresas de credito comunal socias de EDESA!
texts.en:
Eugenia lives in Guaitil de Guanacaste. She is a single mother of 6 children, and she has just turned 66.
She has succeeded in supporting her family thanks to the sale of crafts she herself creates. She has recently decided to engage in clothes sale as well, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 500000 CRC to buy an inventory of clothes she will then sell door to door.
She is happy because she loves working and she knows that thanks to this loan her incomes will improve.
Eugenia is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Crediguatil S.A, one of the 110 communal banks belonging to EDESA.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy equipment and ingredients for her bakery. 

Lourdes has been in this business for 24 years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store. 

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: 03.06.33 Quang Trung - Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 58 years old. She is married and has 4 children.   She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 03.06.33 Quang Trung - Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hoa operates a food stall selling tofu. She has been involved in this business for 1 year.   She is applying for a loan to purchase raw materials for her tofu stall.

In 2005, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.   The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, she hopes to maintain a successful business and to build a new house.

loans.use: buy raw materials for her tofu stall

loans.name: Aquiles Adalberto

texts.es:
Aquiles trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 29 años, desempeñandose como  conductor. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de poner el piso de su casa y si el dinero le alcanza cambier el zinc de la cocina que se encuentra en mal estado. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Aquiles has worked for Juigalpa city council as a driver for 29 years.  He is requesting his second loan with the aim of laying flooring in his home and, if the money stretches far enough, he will replace the metal roof on his kitchen which is in a bad state of repair.

Aquiles' biggest dream is to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to replace his roof

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hard-working 61-year-old businesswoman. She and her husband have two children. For the last three years, Virginia has been providing for her family with the income she earns from offering tailoring services. She also earns extra income from operating a cereals shop. In the next five years, she plans to increase her customer base so that she is able to realize her dream of expanding her enterprise.
 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy material for sewing as well as cereals to offer for sale in her shop. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to add stock to her enterprises from the loans advanced to her.

loans.use: to buy material for sewing as well as cereals to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Evelyn Yamary

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es maestro en aluminio y vidrio. Ella es Lic. En Ciencias de la Educación.

Trabaja de maestra por contrato en una escuela en Montecristi, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que ella aprovecha para vender tanto en la escuela donde labora como también puerta a puerta por su localidad en las tardes y fines de semana, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender. Lleva 10 años dedicada a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la fiscal de pagos  y le gusta porque el grupo es bien unido.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The “Primero de Abril” (April 1) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton which is renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Evelyn, 32, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 14 and 12 years old and going to school.  Her husband is a master in aluminum and glass.  Her degree is in Educational Science.

She works as a contract Teacher in a school in Montecristi but she also sells clothes via catalogue and Avon products (beauty articles, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works every day since she avails herself of sales both in the school where she works and door to door in her community in the afternoons and on weekends.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She says that she loves selling.  She’s been in this business for ten years.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and all types of clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she’s the Payments Supervisor.  She likes it because the group is very unified.  Her dream is that her children finish their schooling and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and clothes.

loans.name: Madewa

texts.fr:
Madewa est une femme âgé(e) de 48 ans. Elle est mariée å un monsieur qui est retraité. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 11 ans.  
Madewa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend du charbon de bois et des céréales à toute personne dans sa maison. Elle est la seule personne impliquée dans son commerce. 
Madewa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et du charbon de bois.. 
Dans les prochaines années, Madewa voudrait voir évoluer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madewa, 48, is married to a husband who is retired. She has three children; two of them are enrolled in school. The oldest is 16 and the youngest 11. 

Madewa has been working as a retailer since 2003. She sells charcoal and cereals to passersby, out of her house.  She is the only person involved in her business. 

Madewa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals and charcoal. 
 
In the coming years, Madewa would like to see her business grow. She says that with the profit she intends to contribute to the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and cereals.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old and married to Peninah. They have three children between 21 and 7 years old.

He has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years, making a monthly profit of KES 4,000. This is his second loan, with which he plans to open a boutique in Kitengela and buy more clothes for sale.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees for his children. In the near future, he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To open a boutique in Kitengela and buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Motee'

texts.en:
Motee' is a 35-year-old young man. He is married and has one son and one daughter. He lives in Ramallah city in Palestine. He is a construction worker with a modest salary, and also, he has his own project of selling home and electrical used products. He wants to expand this project and bring more of these products to sell and improve his income, but with the salary he gets the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN to pay. 

When Motee' takes out the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will expand his project and purchase extra amounts of home and electrical used products to sell, so he will have a wider range of goods to sell and increase his income to live with his family in better conditions. 

Motee' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing extra amounts of home and electrical used products to sell.

loans.name: Bertha Paulina

texts.es:
La Señora. Bertha es socia del banco comunal Pisando Fuerte, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica y cultura, su gente es amable y gentil.

Doña Bertha tiene 23 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 5 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Bertha se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad  la realiza en su casa o ambulantemente y lleva un año y medio en el negocio, trabaja todas las tardes  de lunes a sábados.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es estabilizarse en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha is a member of the communal bank, "Stepping Strong." She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca which is the third most important city in the country. Since 1999 it has been the Cultural Heritage for Humanity due to it's agricultural and cultural beauty, and it's friendly and kind people.

Mrs. Bertha is 23 years old, married and has two children of 5 and 4 years of age. Her first son is in kindergarden. Her husband is an industrial mechanic. They do not own a home so they rent.

Mrs. Bertha sells a variety of clothes from her home or door to door and has been doing so for a year and a half. She works every evening from Monday to Saturday.

This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes to stock up her merchandise.

Her goal is to stabilize her business.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is a 36-year-old married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Ma. Lorena and her husband are both engaged in a fishing business. Her husband operates their fishing boat and is the one who catches fish and also crabs. Ma. Lorena sells his catch at their town's market. According to Ma. Lorena, they earn about 8000 PHP per month from this business.

Ma. Lorena has requested this loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Ma. Lorena plans to use their profit to buy house equipment.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other fishing materials

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old and is married with a child. She lives in Bolibol,Oroquieta City. Marilou has a clothing business and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP monthly. She has been a member of PMPC for one month.

Marilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 25 años, es un joven soltero que vive en una casa alquilada y trabaja para sobresalir en el futuro. Cesar, es un joven trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando desde muy temprano café, cacao, asimismo se dedica a sacar la maleza que crece entre sus plantas. Tiene 05 años trabajando como peon y por tanto siempre está en los lugares donde las personas necesitan de su ayuda. Lo que más le gusta es dejar contentos a sus vecinos a quien brinda su apoyo en los cultivos, ya que lo hace muy bien y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar duro para poder solventarse. En lo futuro piensa construir una casa, donde pueda vivir tranquilo y sin tener que pagar el alquiler de donde habita. Este será su crédito numero 03 con MFP y esta muy contento con el apoyo financiero ya que así se siente seguro de cumplir con su objetivo. En su banco comunal se lleva muy bien con todos y es participe en todas las reuniones que se lleva. Con los 3,000 soles, podrá comprar materiales para la construcción de su hogar como: cemento, fierros, ladrillo.
texts.en: Cesar is 25 years old. He is a young single man who lives in a rented house and works to get ahead in the future. Cesar works from early in the day growing coffee, cocoa as well as clearing the weeds growing between the plants. He has been working as a labourer for 5 years and is always to be found where his help is needed. What he likes the most is leaving his neighbours happy after working with their crops, as he works very well and he believes that the hardest thing is to have to work hard to pay his way. In the future, he is thinking of building a house where he can live in peace and without having to pay any rent for where he lives. This will be his 3rd loan with MFP and he is very happy for the financial support as he feels sure that he will reach his goal. He is well-liked by everyone in his communal bank and he is involved in all the meetings that take place. With the 3,000 soles (PEN) he will be able to buy the building materials for his home such as: cement, iron bars, bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and iron bars for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армену 55 лет, он родился в городе Капане. После окончания средней школы он поступил Капанский  строительный техникум. Армен женат и у него трое детей: два сына и дочь. Старший сын не работает и живет с родителями, а младший сын и дочь живут отдельно со своими семьями. Жена Армена работает библиотекаршей в районной библиотеке.
С 2005 года Армен занимается частным предпринимательством на городском рынке, где он арендует небольшое помещение. Он продает автозапчасти, которые дважды в месяц приобретает в Ереване. Благодаря бизнесу Армен обеспечивает постоянный доход своей семьи. Армен работает без выходных и у него много постоянных клиентов. 
Армен получал кредит от организации уже 5 раз, и  сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для приобретения тормозных колодок, фар,  моторных масел, красок, инструментов, и т.д. для своего магазина.
texts.en:
Armen is fifty-five years old; he was born in the city of Kapan. After graduating high school, he enrolled in Kapan's construction college. 
Armen is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. His oldest son is unemployed and lives with his parents; the younger son and daughter live separately with their own families. Armen's wife works as a librarian in the local library. 

In 2005, Armen began his business as an entrepreneur on the local market where he rents a small shop. He sells autoparts, which he purchases two times a month in Yerevan. Thanks to his business, Armen is able to provide for his family. He works without weekends and has accumulated many regular customers. 

Armen has already received loans five times. Now he's requesting 800,000 drams in order to purchase brake shoes, headlights, engine oil, paints, instruments, etc. for his store.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts for his business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old, and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Susan is a married woman with six children. 

Susan owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000.00, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Susan hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica  la venta de pupusas, el negocio lo inicio hace seis años el cual lo apredio de su madre vende solo los sábado y domingo por las tardes.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar la materia prima como: quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, tomates, de esa forma tendrá lo necesario para poder obtener más ingresos.
El objetivo de milagro es cubrir las necesidades de su familia y aumentar en sus ganancias y de esa manera podrá vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Milagro lives with her husband and two children. She sells pupusas (a stuffed thick corn tortilla). She began the business, which she learned from her mother, 6 years ago. She only makes sales Saturday and Sunday afternoons.  

She needs the loan to buy ingredients like cheese, pork, cabbage, and tomatoes. In this way she will have what she needs to get more profits. 

Milagro’s goal is to afford the family’s necessities and increase her profits. In this way she can live better.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork, cabbage, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Samutia

texts.en:
Samutia is forty three years old and is married with three children. Samutia owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Samutia needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase assorted goods such as snacks,bag of rice,sugar,salt ,flour,lollies,cnt of herring,frozen meat.She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Samutia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Samutia 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase assorted goods such as snacks,bag of rice,sugar,salt ,flour,lollies,cnt of herring,frozen meat.

loans.name: Aroum

texts.en:
Aroum is a 36-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She has had a business of selling sugar in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Aroum is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en: A mother of three children and a villager from Kampong Cham province, Channy is 43 years old and strives for a living via rice farming and reselling hand-made roof made by leaf; it is the business that she has had since she was 20 years old. This is the second loan for Channy with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. Now, she teams up a group of two to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Arcelyn

texts.en: Arcelyn is an ambitious woman who wanted to have her own tailoring workshop but was not able ‎to have that because of her family’s financial situation. So she postponed the idea and then ‎decided to start on a small scale at home doing small jobs till she can stand on her own feet. ‎Arcelyn bought a sewing machine and start doing basic tailoring and sewing work for her friends ‎and neighbors. Now she is applying for a loan to help her buy some fabric in order to do more ‎clothes tailoring work and expand the business to include tailoring bed mattresses. ‎

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine and parapernalials

loans.name: Y. Nestor

texts.en:
Mr. Y. Nestor A. was born on February 26, 1979 in Porto-Novo (Benin). He had to drop out of his primary studies, and at the age of 15, he started his training as a tapestry-maker. At the end of his training, he could not get set up because he had no money to buy the necessary equipment, so he has to rent a sewing machine by the day, which he sets up on the side of the road to work. This is not at all profitable for him, because the cost for renting the machine is too high. Mr. A. therefore keeps sinking further into poverty with each passing day, despite his intelligence and creativity. He is currently asking for $950 in financial support, which would allow him to open and equip a workshop. The credit he is seeking would be enough to rent a workshop, and also to buy a sewing machine and other tapestry tools. With all of this, he would be able to have a stable income to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Y. Nestor est né le 26 Février 1979 à Porto-Novo (Bénin). Il dût arrêter ses études aux cours primaire et à l’âge de 15 ans, il entra en formation de tapissier. A la fin de cette formation, il n’arrive pas à s’installer car n’ayant aucun moyen pour s’acheter le matériel nécessaire, il est obligé de louer quotidiennement une machine à coudre qu’il installe au bord de la rue pour travailler. Ce qui ne lui est pas du tout rentable car les coûts de location de la machine sont trop élevés. Monsieur A. continue donc de sombrer dans la misère au fur et à mesure que les jours passent malgré son intelligence et son esprit de créativité. Il sollicite à ce jour un appui financier de $950 qui lui permettra d’ouvrir un atelier et de l’équiper. Le crédit qu’il demande va servir à louer un local pour son atelier, d’acheter une machine à coudre et autres outillages pour la tapisserie. Ce faisant, il pourra alors avoir des revenus stables pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and small tools for tapestry work

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1972, and her husband, Muoi, was born in 1960. They have two children, ages 12 and 15. Both children have had to leave school because the family does not have enough money to continue paying for their education. The family is so poor that they have been given a small home by the government.

Thuy is a day laborer. She gathers waste materials at her local market. Her husband sells scrap and waste materials to the local recycling company. The family's income is only $11 per person/month. Thuy wants to get a loan of $75 so that her husband can begin purchasing larger amounts of scrap material which he can sell to the recycling company. They feel that they are helping their community and the environment through their recycling efforts. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase scrap material which can be sold to a local recycling company.

loans.name: Enjeh Florence

texts.en:
Florence was born in February 1966, and is married to a man with several wives. She has two children now after losing her first son in August, 2005 in a motor accident. This destabilized her completely because this son was already in a professional school and all her hopes were based on him. When he died, it was as if the world had come to an end, since in most polygamous families in Cameroon, each wife virtually takes care of herself.

She is asking for a loan of $75. She intends to do a business of frying of what is called Accra beans (doughnuts). She believes this will be a great success because she is the only person supplying this product to families in her neighborhood for breakfast. Florence also intends to cultivate mushrooms for commercial purposes in her neighborhood. She also believes this will be a success because GHAPE has given her good training. The profit from this business is going to help her educate the rest of her children in school and take care of the rest of her family’s needs.

loans.use: Frying of Accra and Growing of Mushrooms

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Guillermina B. has been in business for fifteen years. She used her own money to start the business. She sells school supplies, gift items, and toys. She runs this business from her home. She also has a dress-making business. She's on the job from seven in the morning until ten at night, every day of the week. Her husband helps her run the business.

Purpose of the Loan

Guillermina would use the loan to by more merchandise, especially gift items in great demand, such as sets of pots and pans, blouses, costume jewelry, and so on.

About the Applicant

Guillermina is fifty. She is married to Pedro. They have three children, including a minor child still in school. Her husband Pedro has a car that he uses to make deliveries, and this additional income helps them make ends meet . Their apartment is made of concrete. They help each other in the business so that they can help the family get ahead and have a better future.

Translated form Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Guillermina lleva 15 años dedicada a esta actividad. Ella inicio su negocio con capital propio. Ella vende útiles escolares, artículos de regalo, juguetes. Su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio. Ella además tiene su taller de costura que también le genera otros ingresos. Su negocio lo atiende desde las 7:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. Su esposo también le ayuda atender el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Guillermina desea el crédito para comprar más mercadería, sobre todo artículos para regalos como juegos de ollas, blusas, bisutería etc. Ya que estos productos tienen bastante demanda.

Información Personal

La Sra. Guillermina tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada con don Pedro, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 1 solamente es menor de edad y esta en la escuela. Su esposo Pedro tiene un carrito en el cual realiza fletes que le generan un ingreso adicional para solventar los gastos del hogar. Su vivienda es de un piso de cemento. Ellos juntos se ayudan en el negocio para así sacar adelante a su familia y tener un mejor futuro.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her gift store

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: Mabinty is married to a subsistence farmer who cannot produce enough food for both sale and consumption.  With little savings she started her business soon after the civil war in Sierra Leone, but could not do much due to insufficient capital.  Her previous loan helped her expand her business and she invested part of the loan to assist with the farming.  Thirty five years old, with six children, Mabinty has to work hard to provide them with an education. Her plan is to obtain a loan of $350 to purchase agricultural products and store them for the off season and also expand the current business.   She plans to invest the profit in the farm where they can grow rice for consumption and sales.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural products to sell for higher profits in the off season.

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
Novruz is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 40 and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Novruz owns and operates a small food market in Saatli town; he has had his business for 15 years. The business is stable because Novruz has been collecting his customers during the time he has been running this shop. Unfortunately, he has no capital to invest to diversify his inventory and increase his turnover, so he does not make enough income to provide all the necessities of life for his family.

Commercial banks demand collateral to give credit, but Novruz has nothing to mortgage. That's why he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch, which gives loans free of collateral. He is requesting a loan of US$ 500. This loan would allow him to sell bigger amounts of more diverse goods and to develop his business.

loans.use: To increase his inventory and improve his turnover

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago is 37 years old and lives with his wife and kids. Santiago offers gardening services and his wife dedicates her self to selling groceries and also works at a call center. The family has quite a lot of experience in all these businesses due to the fact they have always been working in these same businesses. Their diverse services are offered with quality and good customer treatment and has resulted in high demand and returning customers. The loan will be used to offer more merchandise in the grocery shop since parties for the end of the year will increase demand. Right now, Santiago is only requesting a loan from Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Santiago de 37 años de edad, vive con su esopa e hijos. Santiago ofrece servicios de jardineria y su esposa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y también atiende su punto de llamadas. La familia tiene bastante experiencia en todos sus negocios, debido a que siempre se dedicaron a los mismos. La competencia es elevada pero debido al tiempo que ofrecen sus diversos servicios además de la calidad de trato a la clientela cuentan con buena demanda y clientes fijos. El crédito utilizarán para proveer de más mercadería la tienda de abarrotes ya que por las fiestas de fin de año la demanda incrementá. Actualmente Santiago sólo tiene crédito con Agrocapital.

loans.use: Capital for his grocery shop

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Without a doubt work dignifies people, especially Bertilla, a modest mother of seven. Five of her seven children still live at home with her and are getting a good education. Bertilla feels very satisfied because her children are achieving their goals. Her husband's salary, as a school teacher, is insufficient to cover their expenses. Therefore, she decided to start her own ambulatory business 35 years ago selling jello, soda and tunas.

Bertilla makes an immense effort every day in spite of her deteriorated health. Many years ago she got diagnosed with a prolapse, which got her hospitalized for a while. She has rehabilitated and continues to work with the hopes of having her own store one day. Every day, she gets her baskets ready by placing in them all the tunas that she plans on selling. With this income, she will pay for her youngest daughter to get into medical school because she is done with highschool and wants to be a doctor. Therefore, Bertilla requests fro a 300 soles loan to purchase more tunas for this season's sales.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Sin duda el trabajo dignifica al hombre y en especial D. Bertila, una modesta madre D. familia que tiene siete hijos y D. los cuales comparte las instalaciones D. su hogar sólo con cinco D. ellos que estudian para superarse. Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque sus hijos están logrando lo que se han propuesto.El sueldo insuficiente D. su esposo como profesor del sistema educativo D. su país la llevó a decidirse a emprender su pequeña empresa hace 35 años ofertando diversos productos como gelatinas, refrescos y ahora tunas D. manera ambulante, cada día hace un esfuerzo inmenso a pesar D. sus diferentes dolencias por su deteriorada salud, hace varios años le diagnosticaron un prolapso que fue motivo D. su hospitalización por un tiempo ahora ya rehabilitada sigue trabajando con el anhelo D. un futuro establecer una tienda.Diariamente alista sus canastas para depositar ahí las tunas que ha D. vender en ese día y con la ganancia que obtenga podrá pagar los estudios en una academia D. su última hija que ya terminó el colegio y desea ser una doctora, por esa razón Bertila solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles para comprar más tunas para esta temporada D. venta.

loans.use: Increment capital to sell more tunas

loans.name: Yesu Amala Group

texts.en: Anna is 48 years old and lives in Kamwokya with her 3 children, one of whom is at University. She is the secretary of Yesu Amala Group. She has been selling food in the Kamwokya market for the last three years. She purchases bananas, cassava, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and carrots from the farmers’ delivery trucks that travel to various markets. She sells the fruit and vegetables at her stall for a profit. With the loan, Anna plans to expand her business and increase her profit by buying more food to sell.

loans.use: Anna plans to buy bananas, cassava, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, carrots with the loan

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, he is a humble farmer who works very hard in this farming land. Like any other farmer, he receives the profit of his work at the end of the harvest period and during the waiting period he has do other activities. He wishes to acquire a pair of oxen to optimize the sowing in his farming fields and for this reason he is requesting of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio, es un humilde agricultor que cuida afanosamente sus terrenos de cultivo. Como todo agricultor recibe las ganancias de su labor al término de la temporada de cosecha y durante el período de espera tiene que dedicarse a otras actividades. Anhela adquirir un par de bueyes para optimizar la siembra de productos en sus campos de cultivo y a esta razón atiende la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a twenty-eight-year old traditional Chinese herbalist. He was trained locally and has been practicing for over four years. He also performs massages. His office is in the middle of Accra’s busy Agblogbloshie market.

He will use the proceeds of the loan to expand his business and purchase more traditional medicines. He currently has one employee.

Kennedy is a member of the "David" lending group. The lending group works with a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: To buy traditional Chinese medicines

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. is thankful to Kiva for his previous loan. He increased his stock and built his capital. Before the loan, Abdul owned only 60% of the stock while the other 40% of the goods was taken on credit. Now he owns 80% of the business capital, and he is working hard to be 100% owner of the capital. He has a high hope that Kiva will assist him to build his business and is requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000.

loans.use: To increase stock of his grocery

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is an exemplary and loving mother whom has been deceived many times during her life. Since her children's father abandoned her, she has worked very hard to support them so that they don't suffer from this traumatic situation. This diligent mother used to sell hats on the street, but in very small quantities. Now realizing the needs of her children she decided to ask for help from lenders and invest in her business. Currently, with much hard work and dedication her business is experiencing success, with which she has been able to provide safety and tranquility for her two precious children. Nelly now sells her merchandise in two large booths within one of the busiest markets in Juliaca, and aspires to amplify her business to increase her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly, es una madre ejemplar y muy amorosa que ha sufrido muchas decepciones en la vida, desde que la abandonó el padre de sus hijos trabajó arduamente con el fin de que sus retoños no pasen limitaciones económicas y no sufran dicho abandono. Esta diligente madre en un principio vendía sombreros y gorras en muy pocas cantidades y en forma ambulatoria, pero viendo las necesidades de sus hijos decidió recurrir a la ayuda de instituciones e invertir mayor capital en su negocio. Actualmente con esfuerzo, mucha dedicación y entrega su negocio viene proporcionándole buenos frutos, con la cual tiene la dicha de brindarles seguridad y tranquilidad a sus dos amados hijos.Nelly ahora cuenta con dos amplios puestos de venta al interior de uno de los mercados más concurrido de la ciudad de Juliaca, y ahora aspira aumentar su capital de inversión, está segura que con dicha inversión mejorará notablemente su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase hats to amplify  her business.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia is 24 years old and is married, she has a daughter. Lives in Chimbo, Cuturapi district, Yunguyo Province.

Three years ago she worked in Lima, then she had her baby, and went to live in Chimbo, currently Sonia and her husband sell caws, sheep and donkeys, that they sell on the Chacachaca fair, every Thursday each week.

Sonia belongs to the community bank “centrl Progreso” she started with a credit of S/. 500.00 new soles that she used sheep and veal.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00, which will be cancelled in 4 months, she will buy 3 sheep and with the rest her husband will buy jackets and will bring them to the city of Lima to sell them – is the first trip he will do-, and expects to continue with the business.

His vision is to have his own business, a big one in the city of Lima and later on to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito de Cuturapi , provincia de Yunguyo. Hace tres años trabajaba en la Ciudad de Lima ,después que tuvo su bebe, se vino a vivir al centro poblado de Chimbo, actualmente Sonia y su esposo se dedican al comercio de vacas , ovejas y burros, los mismos que vende en la feria de Chacachaca , todos los jueves de cada semana. Sonia pertenece a al banco comunal "Central Progreso" ella inicio con un crédito de S/. 500.00 con lo que compro ovejas y una ternera. Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 3 ovejas y con el resto del dinero su esposo comprará casacas y las llevará hacia la Ciudad de Lima para venderlas - es el primer viaje que hace , espera continuar con ese negocio. Está muy agradecida porque su negocio le está dando posibilidades de tener un nuevo negocio. Lo que ella aprendió al ser socia del Banco Comunal es que, con el dinero que se le presta, tiene que trabajarlo con la finalidad de incrementar su mercadería y sus ingresos. Su visión futura es tener un negocio propio, grande y un puesto en la ciudad de Lima y con el tiempo comprarse una casa.

loans.use: Buy sheep and jackets at wholesale prices / Compra de ganado (ovejas). Compra al por mayor de casacas.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a widow with two kids. She runs a small business selling linen sheets and blankets in the market in Belaya Tserkov, Ukraine. Galina has been in business for over 7 years. Galina has an enterprising spirit. She is very hard-working and persevering. The success she has achieved in her business is a direct result of her efforts and commitment to her work.

Galina would like to get a loan for 5000 Grivnas to open a new vending facility and stock it with necessary merchandise. A wide selection of retail items will help her better present the benefits of her products and services to her customers. Galina tries to avoid copying the products of other market vendors. She has built a good reputation for the quality of her products and support services. We believe that her constant quest to improve her business and services will help her achieve continued success and enable her to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To stock inventory in her new vending facility

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.ru: Аллаяров Собирджон житель района Вахш. Возраст 40 лет, женат , имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент более 5 лет занимается выращиванием пшеницы. Так как готовая мука на рынке стоит дорого,а основным  продуктом питания в е го семье является хлеб,Собирджон сам  занимается посевом пшеницы.Если урожай хороший ,то лишнее он реализует своим соседям. В данный момент клиент хочет закупить качественные семена. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sobirjon A. is a resident of the Vakh region. He is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. Sobirjon has a high school degree and has been growing wheat for more then 5 years for a living. As the market price for flour is very high and bread is the main food staple in Sobirjon's household, he has been growing his own wheat. In years when he has a good harvest Sobirjon is also able to sell some of the grain to his neighbors, which supplements the family's income. Sobirjon wants to ensure a good harvest and would like to purchase good quality seeds for the next year. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wheat seeds

loans.name: Nancy Socorro

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=37844&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Nancy Socorro E. Parano and her three children, live in Ayacucho, Perú and is a member of the community bank, Virgen de Cocharcas. Nancy is an independent distributor of natural products including Gano Coffee and VioLite. She plans to open her own store in December 2008. Nancy, with the help of her daughter, also sells clothes and honey. Additionally, Nancy is a founding member and has been actively working for six years at an NGO focusing on social work, the NGO is called Jatón Sacha.

With her loan of 2,550 soles she will invest in her businesses by purchasing more products including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite. Nancy dreams that one day with the income she has been saving that her children will continue their education and become professionals and that she will build her own house.
texts.en:
Nancy Socorro E. Parano and her three children live in Ayacucho, Peru. Nancy is a member of the community bank, Virgen de Cocharcas. Nancy is an independent distributor of natural products including Gano Coffee and VioLite. She plans to open her own store in December 2008. Nancy, with the help of her daughter, also sells clothes and honey. Additionally, Nancy is a founding member and has been actively working for six years at an NGO focusing on social work, the NGO is called Jatón Sacha.

Nancy asks for a loan to invest in her businesses and purchase more products, including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite. Nancy dreams that one day with the income she has been saving that her children will continue their education and become professionals and that she will build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products including pants, shirts, socks, coffee and VioLite.

loans.name: Wasiu

texts.en: I., 35 years old and married with five children, has sold kitchen utensils, yams and oranges in her shop located in Itire, Lagos State, Nigeria for a number of years. She is now requesting a loan in order to buy additional utensils and oranges to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensil and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mr. Min M., 45, has two children, one of whom is attends a local school, while the other one is still too young to work or study. Min M. lives in the village of Knol Dambang in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Phang Reth, are farmers who cultivate rice on a piece of land that they own. Unfortunately, the plot is located far from an irrigation system, and Min M. needs a loan to be able to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and petrol to improve the productivity of his farming business.

loans.use: Purchase of rice seeds, fertilizers, and petrol for a rice farming business

loans.name: Mrs. Thouk Khlouk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province make up this village bank loan, and they will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Thouk K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Mrs. Thouk K. is a 54-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Mr. Tha C. did not come to take the loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

This is a village bank loan including end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal O. the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments O. time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% O. Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory and to increase her income with this new loan.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
For more than10 years, Andrei’s main activity has been growing potatoes and vegetables. He started to work with his parents. Now he has extended his business by adding his wife. He processes 0.77 hectares of arable land and has a 150-square-meter greenhouse in the yard. Now he has decided to dig a well to irrigate the potatoes and vegetables. The business is located in Dubasari. 

This loan is Andrei's third loan from MicroInvest. The first loan, to raise potatoes, was granted in December 2007. The second loan, in the amount of 20,000 lei ($2,000 USD), was granted in February 2008, and was used to raise potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage and melons. The purpose of this loan is to dig a well to have an easy access to water for irrigation. His future plan is to increase agricultural production and to start growing other types of vegetables.

loans.use: To dig an irrigation well

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi T. est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient depuis 10 ans un restaurant de foufou, un plat préparer à base de l’igname, qui est très apprécié par la population locale. Avec ce crédit Amavi désire mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en achetant les condiments nécessaires à la préparation de ce plat.
texts.en:
Amavi T., age 51, is married and the mother of three. For ten years, she has had a restaurant serving foufou, a dish made from yams that is highly appreciated by the local people. With this loan she would like to satisfy her customers better by buying the condiments necessary for making this dish.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and ingredients for her foufou restaurant

loans.name: Azetou

texts.fr: Cette dame est une cliente fidèle de wages qui vit dans le quartier de bè klikamé, un quartier périphériques de lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de charbons de bois et de maïs, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1995, actuellement la demande qu’elle a est supérieure  ce qu’elle peut offrir à ses clients,elle demande alors à wages un second crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et de sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This lady is a loyal WAGES client who lives in Bè Klikamé, an outlying district of Lomé. Her work involves selling charcoal and corn. She has been in this business since 1995. Right now, the demand she's facing is greater than what she can offer to her customers. So she's asking WAGES for a second loan to buy sacks of charcoal and sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Ashurmo

texts.ru: Сафарова Ашурмо проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 56 лет, замужем и имеет восьмерых детей.Уже 8 лет , занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет  магазин , где торгует продуктами питания и другого рода мелочами. Бизнес налажен , но она планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов  и увеличить  товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ashurmo S. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 56 years old, married and has eight children. She has been in the retail business for eight years. She has a store next to her house where she sells food and other small items. Her business is steady and she plans to get a loan so she can increase the variety of the goods she offers. This will also let her attract new customers and increase sales and commodity circulation. She can pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Moji

texts.en:
Moji sells foodstuffs, sarongs, and prayer items like olive oil, candles, etc. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nairas to purchase more sarongs and prayer items to sell. She is 45-years-old and married with five children.
Moji says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and prayer items to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen Asad Ullah Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is 36 year old lady and a citizen of the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She successfuly repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband’s business.

Her husband’s name is A. U.. He deals in vegetables. He has 5 years of experience in this business. They are parents to six kids: five daughters and one son. All of their kids are getting an education.  Yasmeen baji is a very hardworking lady. She sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and charges $2 per stitching. She does this work to pay off the school fees of her kids. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Razia begum baji wants a loan to buy paintbrushes to sell. Jamila baji and Asia baji each want a loan to buy gentlemen’s undergarments to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tal

texts.en: Tal D., 41, lives in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows both rice and vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of five children. All of them are single and are employed in different occupations. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, her husband works as a construction worker around the community. Tal D. saw that the business of selling groceries was a profitable one, so that is why she requests a loan in order to run a store out of her home for selling grocery items.

loans.use: To run a store out of her home for selling grocery items

loans.name: Juancito Pinto Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Villa Tejada se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación comunal “Juancito Pinto” formado por doce integrantes que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas de un año.
Casadas en su mayoría, afirman que los ingresos de sus esposos no solventan los gastos diarios que tienen en sus familias, por ello se vieron en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que sea rentable para apoyar económicamente a sus parejas.
