Diversas son las actividades de este grupo; Se dedican a la panadería, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, realizan viajes a pueblos cercanos llevando ropa de invierno para su posterior comercialización, también venden material de construcción, entre otros. La asociación Juancito Pinto desea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the area of Villa Tejada you will find the center called Villa Tejada. It belongs to a communal association called "Juancito Pinto", formed by twelve members who have worked together at Pro-Mujer for more than a year. Mostly married, they affirm that the incomes of their husbands do not cover the daily expenses of their families, and that therefore they were seen in need of seeking out a profitable activity to be able to support their partners economically. The group activities are diverse; they work at the bakery, selling cosmetics by catalog, taking trips to nearby towns carrying winter clothes for later sales, and they also sell building material, amongst other things. The association Juancito Pinto wants to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to be able to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Celia Marleny

texts.es: Celia Marleny G. D. M. vive en Rosario D. la Paz en departamento La Paz. Celia tiene 44 años D. edad vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos que actualmente son estudiantes. Celia recibe ayuda económica D. 150$ por parte su esposo, pero Celia también trabaja dedicándose a su negocio que es un deposito D. bebidas gaseosas y jugos, también elabora pupusas para vender es por ello que solicita este crédito por que quiere invertir en materia prima para las pupusas ya que a veces su producción no alcanza para la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Celia Marleny G. D. M. lives in Rosario D. la Paz, in the La Paz region of El Salvador. Celia is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children who currently attend school.
Celia receives $150 in financial support from her husband, but Celia also runs her own business, a shop selling soft drinks, juices and homemaD. pupusas.
She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients used in making the pupusas since sometimes her production does not meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in making pupusas

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora Juanita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 43 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco hace varios años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/. 200.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará pescado fresco en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, sungaro, doncella, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. 

Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Juanita belongs to the Communal Bank “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe” [Our Lady of Guadalupe]”, located in the District of Bellavista, Province of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 43 years old, and is a mother to 5 children, 2 of which still depend on her. She began selling fresh fish many years back because she wanted to help her family with the extra income. She did this with a loan of 200 PEN, which was well invested; today she continues in the same business but with larger quantities and a larger variety of species. With this loan of 1,500 PEN she will purchase fresh fish by the kilo from both the region and the coast of the country, such as: bocachico, pomfret, sungaro, snakefish, toa, gamitada, tilapia, toyo, and pejerey, to be able to keep her business well-stocked and to satisfy her clients’ demanding taste. She tells us that she is happy to belong for so many years to a group of women that has helped her get through the difficult times that she has had to face, but that she now faces with a lot of strength.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase fresh fish such as, bocachico, pomfret, sungaro, snakefish, toa, gamitada, tilapia, toyo, and pejerey.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: G. Jeanette is 25 years old. She is married to a husband who gains 1000 USD per month and she has two children and four dependents. She needs her first loan of 600,000 in order to improve her daily DAIRY business. She is experienced for four years in her business and she employs six people who start at 6 30 A.M and finish at 11 P.M.  She gains 1000 USD.  The reason why she needs a loan is to expand her business and her monthly income in order to be able to support her family and accomplish some other responsibilities.

loans.use: Milk

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 37-year-old father of three who sells second-hand shoes in Muthurwa market in Nairobi. David has been in this business for the past 7 years, and he previously sold insurance policies. David is requesting his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to increase his stock of shoes. He hopes to one day import shoes himself, rather than purchasing from a middleman. In the future, David would like to have a prosperous family and to build a good home.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to his stock of used shoes

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en:
Tafaoga K., a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Manunu, is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Tafaoga plants and harvests taro to sell. Tafaoga has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2004, Tafaoga (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tafaoga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield.

Tafaoga is now requesting a new loan of 1750 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Tafaoga's fifth loan from SPBD. Tafaoga plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding an agricultural business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 44 year old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Salma has been working as a seamstress, from her home. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a new and more modern sewing machine. This is the first time that Salma has requested a loan. 
Salma is speciA. in her work because of her experience and her work quality. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding and opening a sewing shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new and more modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Mrs. Hon Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who are all living in Ta Sman village in Takeo province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Hon O. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Kaem Lounh, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Hon O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field and she would use the rest of money to buy a battery for her family. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a mirror cutter while the others two are sellers and the others are attending the local school. 
All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Ziggida Group

texts.en:
Ziggida United is a group of five borrowers led by Gayduo Y., who is 29 years old and married with two children. They are six and nine years old and their educational levels are 2nd and 4th grades. Gayduo herself is illiterate due to poverty. Gayduo and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, in northern Liberia. Gayduo’s business is food preparation. She buys foodstuffs which she cooks and sells to residents in Ziggida town. She has been running this business for two years, hoping to expand her business into a restaurant. Gayduo’s cooked food is delicious and affordable, which encourages her customers to continue buying from her.

She started her business with a little money from her husband, but because of family responsibilities, Gayduo has been facing some financial constraints. Gayduo needs this loan in order to purchase more foodstuffs so she can cook more food for customers and improve business.

Because Ziggida town has a high rate of poverty, most residents can’t afford to cook their own food. They prefer buying prepared food to eat because it is cheap and is sold by the plate. Gayduo dreams of educating her children and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook more food for customers and improve business.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Солиев Хуршед проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Хуршед более 7 лет занимается земледелием. Он выращивает пшеницу и картофель. Одну часть продает а другую оставляет для употребления. Кредит просит, чтобы купить удобрения семена, для нового посева.
texts.en:
Hurshed S., 34, lives in the city of Kurgan-Tyube. He has a wife and five children. Hurshed has been a farmer for over seven years, growing wheat and potatoes. One part of the crop he sells, while saves the other part for future use. He is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds for a new sowing.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant a new crop

loans.name: Margaret Kaloki

texts.en:
Margaret M. and her husband, David, have three children: John, Amos, and Jennifer who are 19, 16, and 8 years old respectively. Margaret operates a grocery and a charcoal business which she has done for three years. The client's area of business is within the Kibera slum and her customers are low income earners.

The client was introduced to KADET by existing clients, and she will use the loan she has applied for to add more stock of fruits, charcoal and eggs to her business. With he extra profits the client intends to buy kerosene for sale.

Her future hope is to purchase a piece of land and use it to build rental houses, something she believes she can do because of her hardworking nature.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to add stock of fruits, charcoal and eggs.

loans.name: Good Hope Group

texts.en:
Abraham J. is the leader of a group of 4 borrowers called Good Hope. He is 52 years old and married with five children. His children range in age from 14 years old to 38 years old, and their education levels range from fifth grade to university. He also cares for six siblings. He is a high school graduate, but he could not continue to university due to a lack of financial support.

Abraham and his family live in the SKT Community of Gbarnga City, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. His business is the sale of general goods. He buys general goods wholesale, and he sells the items retail to residents of his community. Abraham has been running this business for four years, and he hopes to improve his business by expanding it.

The price of goods and the cost of transportation to the business site are difficulties for Abraham's business, because when these expenses increase, he cannot acquire much profit. He talks to customers in a good manner and always gives them discounts in order to encourage them to patronize his business. He needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business.

Abraham dreams of giving his children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to improve business

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon lives in Djabbar Rasulov, Tajikistan. He is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Ilhomjon is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising livestock and selling them at the local market. Every year he purchases young calves from local villagers, raises them over an 8-9 month period, and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today Ilhomjon is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle and feed for them. That’s why he is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. Extend your solidarity to Ilhomjon so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle and feed for them

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth G. G., reside en Opico en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. A sus 24 años de edad, Roxana posee la responsabilidad de un hogar y el de trabajar por brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos junto a su esposo. Es por ello que Roxana posee una tienda de productos perecederos desde hace 3 años, la cual nació con la esperanza de tener una vida mejor. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos, sobre todo aquellos que cuentan con mayor demanda tales como: detergente, huevos y leche entre otros más. Roxana espera mejorar la situación económica de su hogar, ya que con anterioridad no había podido invertir en la tienda debido a que las necesidades del hogar le han exigido las ganancias del negocio, es por ello que su esperanza es el mejorar las ventas gracias al dinero obtenido del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth G. G. lives with her husband and 2 school-age children in Opico, La Libertad Department. At the age of 24, Roxana takes care of both home and work in order to provide a better life for her husband and children. This is why Roxana has had a shop selling household goods for the last 3 years, which she began with the hope of a better life. She is asking for a loan to purchase a larger quantity of products, above all those that are in the greatest demand such as detergent, eggs, and milk among other things. Roxana hopes to improve the economic situation of her home, since up to this time she has not been able to invest in the shop because she had to spend the earnings of the business on her household needs. This is why she hopes for greater sales thanks to the funds obtained from the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household products

location.town: Opico en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa la señora Aide Pérez.

Esteban A. H. quiere apoyar el negocio de su esposa ya que es un ingreso mas para el sustento de la familia. El negocio tiene 1 año que lo abrieron y es llamado “Abarrotes Hacienda”  en el que ellos ofrecen al cliente de todo en mercancía y a buen precio. Pero en este momento quieren comprar mas mercancía para tenerlo bien surtido.  A pesar de la crisis no dejan de trabajar por que tienen2 hijos que mantener y desean darles lo mejor que se pueda para que en un futuro sean unas personas de provecho. 
Esteban aparte el percibe ingresos por trabajar en una fabrica desde hace 1 año para poder sostener los gastos que se aproximen.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the photo is Esteban's wife, Aide Pérez.

Esteban A. H. wants to support his wife, since she provides a second income to sustain their family. The business they opened is one year old, and is called "Abarrotes Hacienda," where they sell all kinds of merchandise to customers at a good price. But now, they want to buy more merchandise to have a good stock. In spite of the crisis, they haven't stopped working because they have to children to support and they wish to give them the best so that they will have a good future.

Esteban also earns an income by working in a factory, which he has done for a year to provide for the expenses of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock a grocery store

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios O. is from the village of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 64 years old. Remedios is married and has five adult-age children. To make a living, Remedios owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop which sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kasiyet Kalmuratova's Group

texts.en:
K. Kasiyet is 46 years old, and has four children – three sons and one daughter. Her two eldest sons are builders and her third son is disabled and usually helps her in agriculture. Her husband works in a local school as a security guard. Kasiyet has a business selling food. Prior to starting her business, she worked in Moscow for five years. Soon after her return to her village, she commenced this business. She started with just 20K KGS and now her turnover is about 150K KGS. Kasiyet has much experience of working with loans as although this is her first loan with Kiva partner, Mol Bulak Finance, she has previously received loans from other MFIs. This loan will be used to buy 180 kilos of sugar. In the near future, she plans to open a second outlet.
Santalathon, 46, is married with three children. Her husband and only son are working in Russia, and send about $100 almost every month. She fattens cattle and sells them later at the local market. She will use her loan to buy five sheep. She has some free time and wants to spend it most effectively, so that is why soon she will open a little food kiosk near her house.
Mashraphon is a mother of two sons. She lives with her husband and children in a big village near Osh city. Her husband is a security guard at Manas school, and he also uses his car to provide passenger transportation services. All the family members look after the animals at home. They have a very good yard in which they fatten cattle and sheep. Mashraphon's loan will be used to buy sheep.
K. Elmira is 45 years old and a mother of two sons. She will use her loan to start up a new business selling sunflower oil. Her friend has a trade outlet, which she will rent. Elmira is going to spend a lot of her time improving and stabilizing her business.
Jangybek is the only male member of this group and this is his first ever loan. Previously he worked for a few years in Russia. Most of the money that he sent home was saved by his wife to start up their own livestock business, so there will be no need for Jangybek to work abroad again. Now he is asking for a loan to buy two more calves to fatten, thereby earning more income.

loans.use: To buy 180 kilos of sugar

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is 31 years old, married to Beatrice Wanjiru and they have a two year old child.  He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for five years now and he sells his farm output in Nairobi, Kenya’s capital city in bulk.

He has been a client with KADET for more than four years now and this will be his fourth loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and on time.  This year he wants to buy more farm produce from other farmers which he will add with the produce from his farm and sell in bulk.  This will increase his income.

He plans to start selling clothes in future, which according to him is more profitable.

loans.use: To buy more bags of carrots, potatoes and maize for sale

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old, widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Floro owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to transport passengers from the local community. Floro has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Floro joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. Floro is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan he has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Las Kantutas 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Kantutas 2” esta representado por la señora Juana y conformada por 12 miembros residentes del mismo barrió y con la característica D. ser gente alegre, unida y muy dinámica. La señora Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales aun son pequeños pero uno D. ellos va a la escuela del barrio, la señora Juana se dedica a la venta D. frutas en el mercado central, ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo por lo que tiene que verse en la necesidad D. madrugar para agarrar un puesto D. venta cada día D. feria y poder obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. su hogar ella vive en alquiler pero su máximo deseo es poder darle a su hija un techo adonD. pueda vivir con mayor comunidad. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. frutas, shampoo, comida, frutas, polleras, ropa en general y al transporte D. pasajeros. Las señoras son muy trabajadoras y le hacen frente a la competencia  y  continúan  trabajando para salir adelante. La mayoría D. las señoras utilizaran el crédito para incrementar su capital D. operación  y hacerle frente a  la competencia. Es un grupo que se encuentra en su 2do ciclo en la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que saben manejar bien sus fondos para salir adelante y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The "Kantutas 2" Group is represented by Mrs Juana and comprises 12 members living in the same neighborhood. They are cheerful, united and very dynamic people. Mrs Juana is married and the mother of two children who are still young. Her eldest child goes to the school in the neighborhood. Mrs Juana sells fruit at the Central Market. She does not have a fixed stall, so she is forced to get up early every market day to get hold of a place and earn the necessary income to proviD. for her family. She lives in rented accommodation, but her greatest desire is to proviD. her daughter with a home where she can better live in comfort. The other group members sell fruit, shampoo, food, skirts, clothes in general, and passenger transportation services. The ladies work hard in a competitive environment and are eager to succeed. Most of the ladies will use their share of the loan to increase their working capital and better face competition. This is the group's second loan cycle with the microfinance institution Fundación AgroCapital and its members know how to manage their funds to succeed and grow.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their working capital

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B., 54 years old, is a farmer. She has one child who is 16 years old and works so hard to be able to support her child’s needs. The income, which she gets from growing rice, has helped her family a lot to buy food and other basic needs.

Now, Leonida has a little problem in financing her rice farm and that is why she needs to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and farming tools

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn D., 28, is from the village of Christine, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Jackielyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a retail and wholesale of "chicharon" (deep- fried pork rinds). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crispy fried pork rind in the local community. 

Jackielyn has been engaged in her business for over one year. She also has a direct selling business for almost three years. Both these businesses earn her around 6,000 PHP a month. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support her throughout her fourth loan cycle.

In 2008, Jackielyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jackielyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jackielyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai S., 34, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. plants bananas for an income of USD 0.70 per day. Her husband plants sweet potatoes and corn, earning an income of about USD 10.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase sweet potato plants and rice seeds to grow. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy sweet potato plants and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Madelaine

texts.es: Madelaine, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Teodoro de 47 años y sus 3 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Junto a su esposo, cultivan papa y alverja, que con mucho esfuerzo han logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y cada cosecha que tienen es de muy buena calidad, por lo que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas que afectan su cosecha. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Madelaine is 42 years old and a modest cheerful mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Teodoro, age 47, and their three young children who are the reason behind all her efforts. Madelaine and her husband work together to grow potatoes and peas and have strived to make their land productive. With each harvest, they have achieved good quality crops that are in high demand at the wholesale market in the city. What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops and protecting them from pests that can impact her harvest. Madelaine has been farming for five years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the market in Tarma where they are sold. In the future, she wants to buy additional land so that she can increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels these funds will be a great help in developing her business. Madelaine is one of the most responsible members of her Communal Bank, a distinction of which she is very proud. The loan of 1500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to buy more compost to improve the productivity of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio es casado, tiene una hija de 8 añitos de edad la cual estudia su segundo grado de primaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar. Julio labora como mecanico dental desde hace 10 años en la clinica dental San Juan, ademas tiene su propio negocio de reparaciones de celulares para obtener ingresos adicionales que le permitan darle mayor comodidad a su familia.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una habitacion con mejores condiciones y tener mejor comodidad en su hogar,  se caracteriza por ser un hombre que le gusta el progreso, por ser muy responsable y servicial en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Julio is married and has an eight year old daughter. She goes to school, and she is in the second grade. His wife is in charge of the household chores. Julio has worked as a dental technician in the San Juan dental clinic for ten years. Also, he has his own business repairing cell phones. He does this to get additional income, which will allow him to make his family more comfortable. He is requesting his first loan to buy construction materials to build an improved room and to make his home more comfortable. He is a man who likes to progress. He is very responsible, and he is helpful in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn M. is from Barangay Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 31 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Jovelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,300 PHP a month. In 2008, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
El señor Juan Elias García se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, en el taxi No. 31 el cual tiene varios años de conducir, tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad es mas casi todo el tiempo se a dedicado al transporte de taxi. las personas lo prefieren por ser una persona muy respetuosa. 
Don Juan vive en unión libre y su compañera de hogar se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la elaboración de chicharras (Pellejas de Cerdo) 
De la relación entre ambos, tiene un hijo el cual depende en un 100% de ellos y con los ingresos que le genera el transporte el cubre todos las gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar repuestos para arreglar el automovil.
texts.en:
El señor Juan Elias García has driven taxi number 31 for several years. Not only does he have a great deal of experience in this work, he drives his taxi almost all the time. People prefer him because he is very respectful. Don Juan lives in a common law marriage and his partner makes pork cracklings (pork rinds). They have a boy who is 100% dependent on them, and the income from taxi driving pays all the expenses of their home. He will use this loan to buy parts to fix the automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase parts for automobile

loans.name: Chuchie

texts.en:
This is Chuchie S., a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Freddie S., a driver, and is the mother of a young adult currently enrolled in college and a youngster enjoying his high school days. By the grace of God, Chuchie has managed to support her older child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Chuchie, who herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Chuchie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Chuchie earns an income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Chuchie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more products, such as groceries, toiletries and beverages, to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Chuchie dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory by purchasing groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Rita Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Rita Esmeralda M. C., es un joven de 28 años de edad, casada con dos hijos pequeños que se dedican, el mayorcito a estudiar la escuela secundaria y el menor la escuela primaria. Su esposo es albañil y es el principal apoyo económico de la familia, habitan en un humilde Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, con las lluvias del invierno su hogar se ha desmejorado amenazando con el bienestar salubre de la familia, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de  laminas de zinc  para cambiar el techo de su hogar y apoyarles a mejorar las  comodidades con las que actualmente cuentan. 
Como se muestra en la foto ellos son una familia muy humilde y este es su tercer ciclo, ello han sido bien responsables con sus cuotas, y es para nosotros de importancia el poderles ayudar a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rita is a young woman of 28, married with 2 young children to whom she is dedicated. The older one is in secondary school and the younger is in primary school. Her husband is a brick layer and the principal economic provider for the family. They live in a humble development called Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla. Since last winter's rains, their home has deteriorated, threatening the family's health conditions. For this reason, she is soliciting a loan to buy zinc sheeting so they can install a new roof on their home, helping to provide comfort they can count on. As the photo shows, Rita's family is very humble and this is their 3rd loan. They have been very responsible in making payments, and it is important for us to help them improve their conditions of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING ZINC SHEETING TO PUT A NEW ROOF ON HER HOUSE

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu M. is a single parent who sells underwear by moving from one area to the other at Abura. She has been in this trade for a year now. She has been though senior high school. She will use the loan to buy more of her goods for sale. Zenabu plans on reinvesting the profit she hopes to get back into her business.

loans.use: buy more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Carlos Beltran

texts.es:
el señor Carlos A. es una persona que dedica a la actividad de venta de abarroteria en general. la cual la realiza a medio tiempo ya que tambien trabaja como maestro en un centro basico cercano a su comunidad.
cuando el no esta en el negocio lo atiende su esposa, mutuamente trabajan muy fuerte para sacar sus hijos adelante.
Carlos y su esposa son personas bien honradas y responsables.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos A. earns his living running a general grocery store part-time. He also works as a teacher at a centre near where he lives. When he is not at the store, his wife looks after the business. Together they work hard to make a good life for their children.

Both Carlos and his wife are honest and responsible people. The loan will be used to buy more stock for the store.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store such as eggs, milk, rice, bread etc.

loans.name: Celsa Francisca

texts.es: Celsa Francisca es una mujer que tiene muchos clientes y siempre llegan a solicitarle diferentes prendas de vestir. Hace más de 25 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil lograr obtener este medio de vida. Ella dio inicio con muy poco capital, pues es muy importante es por su familia la razón por la que se preocupa por mejorar su condiciones de vida todos los días sabe que tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar los diferentes encargo que tiene pendiente de realizar. Este crédito es para la compra de tela, agujas, tijera, hilos, entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar la calidad de sus prendas.
texts.en: Celsa Francisca has a lot of customers who come to order different clothes from her.  She has been in this business for 25 years and it hasn't been easy.  She started off with very little capital but her business is very important to her as every day she worries about improving her family's standard of living.  She has to get up early to carry out the different tasks that she has pending.  This loan will be used to buy fabric, needles, scissors, thread, etc.  She dreams of improving the quality of the clothes that she offers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Farizat Mambetova's Group

texts.en: Farizat M. has a traditional Kyrgyz family consisting of five members. Her husband helps to give proper upbringing to their three daughters. The eldest of their daughters is a student, the second one is a schoolgirl, and the youngest goes to kindergarten. The adult family members contribute to their common budget in different ways: the head of the family is an employee of the District Department of Inner Affairs and his salary comes to 15,000 soms per month; Farizat raises money by helping a kindergarten teacher; the eldest daughter helps her parents financially by working as a yard-keeper. At the same time, the family is occupied in cattle breeding. The total earnings from these activities make it possible to purchase the necessary household items. A large family has large requirements. Therefore in order to improve their well-being, Farizat wants to increase the total number of animals they keep. For this aim, she plans to buy two sheep. This is the main purpose for getting this loan. In the future, the family hopes to make their intention to buy a new house come true. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Manuela Del Rocio

texts.es:
Manuela de 32 años, vende ropa en una pequeña tienda de víveres que tiene en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposo y seis hijos en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella empezó a trabajar desde muy joven vendiendo cosméticos por esas ventas y unos ahorros pudo comprar víveres y ropa para vender en la parte delantera de su casa.  Vende a sus conocidos y vecinos diversificando su mercadería para que la conozcan. En la actualidad vende ropa de niños y caballeros. También tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres donde vende arroz, azúcar, enlatados, dulces. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar camisetas, conjuntos de ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres y así surtir su mercadería. En el futuro quiere tener un local de ropa y otro de víveres.
texts.en:
Manuela is 32 years old and sells clothing at a small general store that she has at the front part of her house.  She lives with her husband and six children in the Playas canton, one of Ecuador's tourist sites that has a large variety of seafood.

For a lack of opportunity, she began to work when she was very young selling cosmetics.  From these sales and some savings, she was able to purchase supplies and clothing to sell in the front part of her home.  She sells to her friends and neighbors and expands her merchandise because she knows who she is selling to.  She currently sells clothing for children and men.  She also has a small general store that sells rice, sugar, canned goods, and candies.

With this loan she would like to buy shirts and other clothing for men, women, and children to expand her merchandise.  

In the future, she would like to have a store to sell clothing and another to sell supplies.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Sara Maria 30 años de edad, su esposo es el dueño del negocio por lo que trabajan en conjunto, no tiene hijos, habita en el Barrio Madrid casa # 42 en Juigalpa Chontales, es una mujer muy activa, se dedica al comercio como es compra de productos veterinarios desde hace muchos años, de donde obtiene sus ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.

Es una mujer enprendedora con muchos deseos de superacion por lo que solicita el credito para seguir creciendo en el mercado del negocio y el bienestar de su familia; es merecedora del apoyo de Kiva ya que la situacion economica esta dificil por lo tanto tienen que trabajar con creditos para mantener su liquidez y de esta manera brindar mayor estabilidad laboral y Familiar.  

Su mayor sueño es procrear sus hijos y darles lo mejor en la vida.
texts.en:
Sara Maria is 30 years old.  She and her husband work together in the business that her husband owns.  She does not have children.  She lives in the Madrid neighborhood in house # 42 in Juigalpa, Chontales.

She is a very active woman, and she is a businesswoman.  She has been buying veterinary products for many years.  That is how she gets her income to meet her obligations.

She is an enterprising woman with a lot of desire for self-improvement.  That is why she is requesting the loan in order to keep growing in the business and for her family’s well-being.  She is deserving of help from Kiva because the financial situation is difficult.  Therefore, they have to work with loans in order to maintain their liquidity.  This is the way they will have greater work and family stability.

Her greatest dream is to have children and to give them the best in their lives.

loans.use: To buy veterinary products for the business

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San M. (in the photo with her loom) and her husband have been married since 2004.  They have two children  – one son and one daughter, both are still young. 

San is a weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She had previously requested and repaid several Kiva loans.  She is now asking for another in the amount of $200 to buy weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
Sandra Yaneth es una empresaria que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una finca en el municipio del Cármen de Viboral en el Oriente Antioqueño, ella y su esposo se desempeña como administradores de una finca en la que hacen diferentes oficios del campo y esto les ayuda a su sustento diario.

Esta empresaria en sus ratos libres es una vendedora de diferentes productos como ropa y cosméticos por catálogo, esta labor se la aprendió a su tío que lleva toda su vida como vendedor.

Sandra con las ventas de sus productos le ayuda a sus hijos y a su esposo a mejora su calidad de vida, por esto ella necesita el crédito para así poder invertir en más mercancía y ampliar su negocio a clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Sandra Yaneth is an entrepreneur who lives with her husband and two children on a farm in the municipality of Cármen de Viboral in Oriente Antioqueño. She and her husband work as administrators on a farm in which they perform different farm duties, which helps them with their daily needs.

During her free time, this entrepreneur sells various products, like clothing and cosmetics, by catalog. She learned this trade from her uncle, who has been a salesman his entire life.

With her sales, Sandra helps her children and husband to improve their quality of life, which is why she needs this loan so that she can invest in more merchandise and expand her business with new customers.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alejandra Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Alejandra tiene 45 años de edad, está en pareja, tiene 3 hijos, dos menores y una mayor e independiente.
La sra. Alejandra se dedica a comercializar cosméticos por catálogo en forma ambulante, tiene una clientela formada por más de 8 años, actualmente ella es distribuidora de un grupo de 8 mujeres de distintas ciudades cercanas a su domicilio.
Se inició dentro del rubro con una línea de cosméticos de procedencia paraguaya cuando visitó una peluquería,  luego por cuestiones personales abandonó dicho vínculo e inició un negocio con la firma Monique, cuenta que sus clientas son personas de diferentes edades y estilos, a las cuales trata de adaptarse día a día.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos varios de temporada como: bronceadores, cremas de limpieza, tratamientos capilares, loción con filtros solares y otros.
texts.en: Mrs. Alejandra is 45 years old and has a partner.  She has three children, two  younger and one self-supporting adult.  Mrs. Alejandra sells cosmetics by catalog, door-to-door, and has a developed clientele of eight years.  She is currently the distributor for a group of eight women who live in different cities near her residence.  She got started with a line of cosmetics from Paraguay when she visited a beauty shop.  Later on, for personal reasons, she abandoned that connection and started a business with the firm Monique.  She says her customers are of various ages, and styles that she tries to adapt to each day.  She is taking out a loan to buy cosmetics for different seasons like:  bronzers, cleansing creams, treatments for capillaries, lotions with sun block and others.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal cosmetics (bronzers, creams, lotions with sunblock, with capillary treatments, etc.)

loans.name: Algrace

texts.en:
Algrace is a 29-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: tricycle transport, pig fattening and networking (Natasha & Avon).  She lives in Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,800. Algrace is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her business. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Algrace aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her business

loans.name: Frizelma

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Frizelma; la socia tiene 32 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia es enfermera de profesión pero por ahora no ejerce su carrera ya que esta al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son pequeños y la necesitan, la socia vive de sus rentas que tiene en la provincia de Apurímac, donde allá tiene una casita, ella ahora quiere construir una parte de su casa que tiene en la ciudad de Cusco donde actualmente vive y ese es el motivo por el cual solicita el préstamo.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la construcción de su casita.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Frizelma is 32 years old, has a live-in partner and two children. She is a nurse by profession but has put her career on hold to look after her children who are still young and depend on her. She makes a living renting out her small house in the province of Apurímac. She would now like to do some work on her home in Cusco, where she actually lives, and this is why she is requesting a loan.
She is requesting a loan to do construction on her home.
She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Construction on her home

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.es: La señora Jeaneth dedicada a la confección D. pantaletas en su domicilio, ella trabaja ya hace años atrás teniendo conocimiento en esta actividad por que su madre le enseño lo que es la confección D. prendas D. vestir. Durante la semana confecciona las prendas que entrega los  fines D. semana y así poder tener ingresos para aportar al menos con la alimentación D. su familia, la Sra.  Desea el crédito para poder comprar una nueva maquina para así poder tener más producción y hacer crecer su taller D. costura ya que la maquina que tiene ya tiene bastante tiempo y le esta fallando, la Sra. es una persona responsable y trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jeaneth sews underwear in her home.  She has done this work for many years and learned it from her mother who taught her to sew.  During the week she sews the items and then sells them on the weekends so that she can earn money to at least help with feeding her family.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a new sewing machine so that she can increase production and grow her business.  Her machine is old and has been malfunctioning.  Jeaneth is responsible and a hard worker who is thankful for the assistance.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en: Ma. Corazon, who is a 40-year-old married mother of six children, works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as toothpaste, sugar, groceries, etc. Ma. Corazon has thus far borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF and aspires to save money to expand her business. She has been running the sari sari store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucila Emilia

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Lucila Emilia Gracia que tiene la edad de 52 años, solo estudio primaria y es viuda, tuvo seis hijos de los cuales 2 ya estan casados y cuatro trabajan.

Doña Lucila nos platica que desde que hace siete años cuando murio su esposo tuvo que iniciar a trabajar para poder sacar a su familia adelante, pero como ya es grande le fue muy dificil conseguir un empleo asi que con el apoyo de sus hijos inicio a vender pollo destazado, ella saca todos los dias una mesita al patio de su casa en la cual pone su venta de pollo y sus vecinas y amigas llegan a comprar para realizar su comida.
ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de mas pollos y bolsas desechables para realizar su venta, tambien nos dice que aveces es un poco pesado su trabajo ya que tiene que madrugar todos los dias para preparar su pollo pero ella no se desanima ya que le gusta trabajar mucho y es una señora muy alegre.

Doña Lucila Espera en un futuro con sus ganacias poder invertir poco a poco en la venta de ropa para dama y caballero y de esta manera lograr tener mas ingresos economicos en su hogar para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec, which has a large lake which provides abundant fishing and work each year.  It’s also known for the presence of the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam.

Lucila Emilia Gracia is 52 years old and lives in this community.  She has an elementary school education, is a widow, and had six children, two of whom are married and the others work.

Lucila tells us that when her husband passed away seven years ago, she had to go to work to get her family ahead, bit it was difficult for her to find a job.  With her children’s backing she began selling chicken.  Every day she puts a table out on the patio where she sells her chicken to her neighbors who buy from her.

She needs this loan to invest in more chickens and disposable bags.  She says that her work is sometimes tough because she has to get up so early every day, but she is not dismayed because she enjoys working and is a very happy lady.

Lucila hopes that she will eventually be able to invest her earnings into sales of men’s and women’s clothing and in this way increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken and disposable bags

loans.name: Pablo José

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MARTINEZ  LABORA COMO GUARDA DE SEGURIDA, ES CASADO, TIENE  TRES  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ESTE ES EL CUARTO  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPROTUNIDAD QUE LE BRINDA, ESTE DESEMBOLSO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA PARA PODER COMPRAR  MATERIALES DE CONNSTRUCCION PARA HACER UN ANEXO DE UN CUARTO.
texts.en: Mr. Martinez works as a security guard.  He is married and supports three people.  This is his fourth loan with Ceprodel and he appreciates the opportunity offered him.  He needs this loan to improve his house and will use it to buy construction materials to add to a room.

loans.use: To buy construction materials and improve his house

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a un taller de electrónica, él vive solo y ha instalado su propio taller en la vivienda, ahí repara equipos de sonido, radios, televisores, tiene muchos clientes y a parte del taller, también vende papas fritas los domingos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo, el cual invertirá en reparación del equipo de soldadura, ya que es el que le ayuda a realizar sus reparaciones, por el momento está dañado, este préstamo le ayudara para cubrir el gasto y estar nuevamente con sus herramientas en buenas condiciones.
El aspira que a través del taller pueda comprar un mejor equipo para el taller, que le permita mejorar los servicios a los clientes.
texts.en:
Juan works in an electronics workshop.  He lives alone and has set up his own workshop in the house where he repairs stereos, radios, and televisions.  He has many customers and in part of the workshop he also sells french fries on Sundays.

He is currently requesting a loan, which he will invest in repairing his welding equipment. That is what helps to make repairs and for the moment it is damaged. This loan will help to cover the expense and be back with his tools in good condition.  He aspires to be able to buy better equipment for the workshop, which will improve services to customers.

loans.use: To repair the welding equipment

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 60 years old and is a married woman with nine children. The oldest child is 39 years old. Her two youngest children still go to school.

Margarita is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops and vegetables to sell. Margarita does her best to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

Margarita hopes to improve their house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for larger quantities of electrical items

loans.name: Oscar Darío

texts.es:
Desde sus 16 años Oscar Darío aprendió a pintar y  realizar acabados en obras de construcción labor que desde entonces desempeña con esmero y dedicación de lunes a sábado de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. o según el horario que sus clientes requieran, ya que como dice él mismo, el servicio es lo mas importante para que su negocio prospere ya que así serán mas clientes quienes prefieran sus servicios y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida mejorará.

Actualmente Oscar quiere mejorar su microempresa y para ello necesita un préstamo que le permita hacer adecuaciones locativas y reforzar el inventario de insumos necesarios para su trabajo. Oscar sueña con incrementar día a día sus ventas y que su negocio finalmente sea un legado para sus hijos con el cual les podrá ofrecer un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Oscar Darío learned to paint and decorate on building sites when he was 16 years old.  Since then he has carried out his work with care and commitment.  He works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm, or whenever his customers want him to do the work because, as he himself says, the service he provides is very important if he wants his business to prosper as good service will provide him with more loyal customers and this, in turn, will lead to an improvement in his quality of life.

Oscar would currently like to improve his small business and needs a loan which will allow him to do some structural work and strengthen the stock of supplies that he needs to carry out his work.  Oscar dreams of increasing his sales day by day and for his business to finally become an inheritance that he can pass down to his children and which will enable him to offer them a better future.

loans.use: to do some structural work and strengthen his stock

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир женат, у него двое взрослых детей. Он живет и работает в Никополе. Владимир торгует мужской спортивной одеждой. Клиент вовремя увидел малую перспективность торговли на рынке и поэтому перенес торговлю в магазин, где товар не затаскивается и не пылится. У Владимира просторный магазин в удобном, проходном месте. В городе мало кто занимается торговлей спортивной одеждой в таком ассортименте и количестве. В магазине есть кондиционер, телевизор, ионизатор воздуха, удобная подсветка. К тому же в магазине есть больше возможности уделить внимание каждому покупателю. 

Владимир занимается торговлей одеждой уже 7 лет. Его доход составляет 27.000 гривен. Владимир регулярно делает закупки нового товара для пополнения ассортимента. Чем больше он закупит товара, тем больше и вероятнее будет его прибыль. Владимир планирует использовать кредит в 17.500 гривен на закупку спортивных костюмов, шортов, футболок, кроссовок и мокасинов. Он знает, что спортивная одежда способствует более здоровому образу жизни молодежи, так как многие покупают одежду для пробежек, занятий в атлетическом зале, катания на лыжах. В планах Владимира – расширять торговую площадь для размещения и продажи большего количества товара.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Vladimir is married and has two adult children. He lives and works in Nikopol. Vladimir trades in man's sportswear. One of his clients suggested that he move his business from the market to a store where his goods do not get worn out and beaten up, and so he did.  Vladimir has a spacious shop in a convenient place on a main thoroughfare. In the city, very few people sell such an assortment and quantity of sportswear. In the shop there is an air conditioner, TV, air ionizer, and good lighting. Additionally, there is a great deal of opportunity to pay attention to every single customer.  

Vladimir has been selling clothes for seven years. He makes 27,000 hryvnias. Vladimir regularly buys new goods to maintain his inventory.  The more variety he has, the more he can profit.  Vladimir plans to use his 17,500 hryvnia loan to buy track suits, shorts, T-shirts, tennis shoes, and deck shoes. He knows that sportswear promotes a more healthy way of life for youth since many buy clothes for jogging, working in gyms, and skiing. Vladimir plans to expand his shop to display and sell more goods.

loans.use: to buy track suits, shorts, T-shirts, tennis shoes, and deck shoes

loans.name: Rosa Abigail

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hija D. 22 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración D. tortillas y venta D. tamales, además venD. atol, todos los días realiza las ventas en las zonas cerca D. su vivienda.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, leña, pollo y materiales para mejorar la vivienda, este préstamo contribuirá no solamente en el negocio, sino que también mejorar las instalaciones D. su vivienda.
El objetivo D. ella es poder algún día terminar D. construir su vivienda, ya que aún le quedan varias cosas que construir.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her 22-year old daughter, and supports her family by selling tortillas, tamales and atol, selling her products in her neighborhood.
She now seeks a loan to buy corn, chicken and firewood for her business, as well as materials to repair her home, putting the capital to good use for both her business and to improve her housing conditions.  Rosa hopes one day to complete construction of her house, as there are various parts still awaiting construction.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken and firewood.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 29-year-old man. He is married to a businesslady and they have one child aged two years old to whom they hope to give a good education to university level. He sells mangoes and oranges to local people. His business is located within Kakamega town. He has been running this business for three years now and has one employee. 

George says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business  so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy more mangoes and oranges to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In future he hopes to become a wholesaler. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy mangoes and oranges

loans.name: Angele

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 56 ans, célibataire et mère de 03 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 16 et 28 ans. Avec un niveau d’études secondaire, voyant sa charge , elle s’est lancée dans la vente des produits alimentaires.
Ses ventes sont de 15.000 frs a 30.000 frs par jour.
  Ce prêt la permettra de renforcer le stock des produits alimentaires comme les cartons de tomates , cartons de conserves, bidon d'huile,
Minimiser ses dépenses pour plus épargner est la stratégie qu’elle envisage mettre en application pour réaliser son ambition d’être propriétaire d’un supermarché. Très entreprenante, elle fait face aux droits de ces enfants
texts.en:
Angele is 56 years old and the single mother of 3 children aged between 16 and 28. She has a secondary level education and started selling food products in order to be able to support her family. Her daily sales total between 15 000 and 30 000 francs.
She will use this loan to restock on food items including boxes of tomatoes, canned goods and cans of oil. A very enterprising woman, she plans to minimize her business expenditures so that she can save up, provide for her children, and one day fulfill her dream of owning a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, canned goods, cans of oil etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo, a mason, and mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Zenaida is a "balut" vendor. She sells fertilized duck eggs (balut) which is one of the exotic foods that can be found here in the Philippines. Balut vendors go around the community to offer their product while some have their stand located on the side of streets where people can easily locate them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of the duck eggs that she sells. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Zenaida dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and also for her business to grow more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of products for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is married and has five children. Edna is 40 years old and lives in Bañadero, Osamiz City. To earn a living, Edna owns a boarding house. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 8,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase lumber for some renovations to her boarding house. Edna has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Edna wants to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: for purchase lumber for boarding house repair

loans.name: Karlo Kristoffer

texts.en:
Karlo Kristoffer is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with 2 children. 

Karlo Kristoffer has a shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. Karlo Kristoffer is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Karlo Kristoffer hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Jacelyne

texts.en:
Jacelyne has operated her business selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past year. She is 24 years old and married to Nicholas. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing client, and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more inventory of assorted fruits and vegetables for her business.

In the future, Jacelyne hopes to grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora y soltera, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 04 hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.  Desde muy pequeña a Cirila, le enseñaron sobre el cultivo de plantas en la chacra. Ahora trabaja en sus propios cultivos para salir adelante, lleva 30 años cultivando cacao y es uno de los mejores granos que se puede ofrecer. A pesar de ser una mujer, sabe que tiene que esforzarse y dedicarle tiempo a sus cultivos, no hay nada difícil, su único es fin es solventar los gastos económicos de su hogar. Con el tiempo desea mejorar su chacra comprando materiales como: fertilizantes, abono. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP y agradece el apoyo financiero, ya que puede seguir cumpliendo con su trabajo. En su banco comunal se lleva bien con todos y comparten experiencias del trabajo. Con el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar sacos de fertilizantes, y abono.
texts.en:
Cirila is a 38-year-old single workingwoman who lives in her own house together with her 4 children and she wants to give them a better quality of life. From a very early age they taught Cirila about the cultivation of plants on the farm. Now she works with her own crops in order to get ahead and she’s been growing cacao for 30 years and it is one of the best beans you can offer. Despite being a woman, she knows she has to work hard and spend time with her crops, it’s not difficult, and her only purpose is to be able to meet the household expenses. 

In the future she hopes to improve her farm buying supplies such as fertilizer and compost. This will be her 4th loan with MFP and she is grateful for the financial help, so she can continue her work. She gets along well with everyone in her communal bank and they share work experiences. With this loan she will buy bags of fertilizer and compost.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is a farmer in Murang'a. He is 41 years old with 20 years of experience in farming. His farm currently produces milk and tea for the local market. He  runs a retail business in a nearby market in addition to farming. He is married with two children ages 13 and 7 years.

Ephantus has requested a loan of 63,600 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow to boost his dairy farming business. He hopes to improve his dairy breeds and earn more income, which will enable him to educate his children and improve her family's living standards.

Ephantus also mentions low prices for milk in the local markets as his main challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 44 years old, married and has four children.

Hiam has owned a cow farm since 2003, raising cattle for milk and cheese. She has sufficient experience in this field from her parents and her husband. She has a good reputation and she is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a Friesian cow. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a Friesian cow

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Sam Ath is a 64-year-old mother who is married with five children: two of her children are dependents who work in the rice field and sell peanuts. Having earned a living as a rice farmer for 30 years, she supplements her income by selling peanuts and cakes. With her current business, she earns around 17 US dollars per day to feed her family. 

Sam Ath has been with VisionFund since 2009. She successfully repaid her last loan with VisionFund. After two loan cycles, she is able to generate a regular income and have a good business. She will use this loan to buy an old motorbike for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her business and earn more income to improve her living standard and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her business
