location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her late sister's children).  Safina has a business selling fruit.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Safina sells her products at the market, wholesale.  She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of mangoes, onions, tomatoes, and passion fruit. The main business challenges for Safina include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for fruit and also to open up another branch in the same market.   

Safina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mangoes, onions, tomatoes and passion friut.

loans.name: Kort

texts.en: Kort, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells rice and bran from her home. Her husband is a veterinarian. Kort is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase rice to store in the warehouse in order to sell it when the price is higher. In the future, she would like to purchase rice in large amounts to store and then sell when the price is higher. Moreover, she plans to build a fence around her house and to support her children's education until they get their bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase rice to store in a warehouse in order to sell it when the price is higher

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 14 to 28. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. 

Zipporah operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, black beans etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a conducive area. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals such as maize, beans and black beans. Her business goal is to diversify her cereal store within five years.

loans.use: To buy more cereals such as maize, beans and black beans.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Annabel sells food as her business. She has had this business for 29 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,800. Annabel has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.


In the future, Annabel hopes to purchase home appliances and have savings to be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for pawned ricefield.

loans.name: William Bismark

texts.es:
William tiene la edad de 46 años, es transportista desde hace mas de 10 años, ademas realiza siembras agrícolas en su pequeña parcela de donde obtiene parte de la provisión y se ayuda económicamente con las ventas de estos productos en tiempo de cosechas; estas actividades le han permitido poder asumir sus responsabilidades adquiridas en su vivienda tanto Familiar como Económicas, su familia esta integrada por él y su Esposa, pues sus cinco hijos son mayores de edad.

Cada día la vivienda de Don William necesita hacerle mejoras y con este préstamo mediante Kiva resolverá una de tantas como es la realización del sumidero e instalación de inodoro en la parte interior de la casa, para que su familia tenga un lugar seguro e higiénico donde hacer sus necesidades, sobre todo sus nietos cuando lo visitan ya que la letrina esta llena y empeora con el invierno por las fuertes lluvias que hacen introducir agua fluviales. 

Su próximo proyecto es sembrar maíz y comercializarlo y pretende hacer otro préstamo para esta inversión que piensa sera de buen provecho, con el fin de mejorar la economía familiar.

loans.use: Invertir en hacer su propio Sumidero con su inodoro para tener un lugar adecuado donde hacer sus necesidades.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres en el chaco, estudia la carrera de derecho a través de la cual quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pedro está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir sus anhelos de ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Tandika, the Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children. Rehema sells charcoal in a store located in her family house. She has been in this business for over eight years now.

Rehema thanks all lenders for her first loan with Kiva. With the loan she was able to open another charcoal store in the next street and employ an assistant

Rehema is now requesting a second loan with Kiva. With this loan she is planning to add a stock of charcoal for the two stores. The two stores are doing good business for she has employed herself and an assistant. Dar es Salaam is now in the rainy season, so having enough stock is an advantage for her. USD 750 will facilitate her stocking requirements.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1955, Mary is married and has eight children. She faces difficulties taking care of her children’s needs and her husband is also unemployed. She joined GHAPE in the year 2000 and took her first loan of $30 which she used in retailing firewood. In her community, firewood is the major source of energy for cooking and the small households can’t go to the forest to buy from there due to distance and heavy cost of transportation. Mary has been solving this problem by bringing in the wood in bulk, splitting it and retailing to the small households for immediate use.

Given a loan of $800, Mary plans to buy two trucks of wood and pay for splitting. In this way, she will be able to meet up with the ever increasing demand for firewood. She plans to repay the loan over a period of 18 months.

loans.use: Sale of firewood

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana C. R., 37, raises goats. She also has one pig and sells cans of juice in the streets of Nebaj. When she receives this loan, she will take the bus to a fairly distant village to buy as many baby goats as she can– she's hoping to get several. She will then walk home for many hours with the goats instead of taking the bus because she would be charged about US$3/each to bring the goats back by bus. She will leave at 3:00 in the morning and will arrive home well after dark.

Juana has been Friendship Bridge for the past 3 years. During a previous loan she had bought chickens to sell when full grown. The chickens all died after a brief illness so she decided to change to goats and pigs.

Her life has been hard and shows in every way possible. She is trying to work her way out of deep poverty she has experienced for all her life.. Both of her parents died in the Guatemalan civil war of the 1980´s and early 1990´s. And she lost most of the use of her right hand, including three fingers, in the war years.

She is married to a husband who works in the corn fields and they have 5 children. Though she is resource poor she is resourceful and looking forward to a brighter future.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: To purchase goats, pigs and juice to sell

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio, 60, is a butcher and his wife Irene Contreras is a homemaker. They have four sons; all of them have finished high school and help their father on the farm. Eladio works hard to sell beef that he himself raises. He starts his day early. He can be found in the butcher's shop while his sons gather the herds and feed them. The family unites their efforts in their daily work.

Eladio plans to use the loan to purchase more cattle to breed. He will be able to improve his standard of living and support his children to go to college since they wish to study genetic engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Eladio tiene 60 años, de profesión carnicero, está casado con Irene Contreras quien es ama de casa. Tienen cuatro hijos, todos ellos terminaron sus estudios secundarios, ayudan en la actividad ganadera al padre. Eladio se dedica a la venta de carne de vaca que el mismo faena, inicia sus actividades a primera hora de la mañana, mientras él se encuentra en su carnicería, sus hijos ordeñan sus vacas y dan alimentos a sus animales vacunos, la familia es muy unida y comparten el trabajo diario.

Proyecta invertir el crédito en la compra de animales vacunos para faenarlos, con ello mejorar su nivel de vida y poder ayudar a uno de sus hijos a que ingrese en la universidad ya que desea estudiar Ingeniería Forestal.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ni Nengah Mas Ardani

texts.id:
Ardani has been in the profession of Food and vegetable sales since 2 years. Starting as a hobby in cooking and a having lots of free time. Wife of Putu Widana, up to now still childless started to fill in her free time by making food assortments, like: vegetables, cake and fish. Afterwards Ardani brought her cooking to a foodstalls, or to a travelling sales person in her village. Since Ardani's income looks promising, this is currently the family's main income. Profit of Rp25,000 (about US$3)/daily is felt by Ardani not enough for the family, so Ardani works harder. To expand the business, Ardani borrows the capital from Dinari, that she used to buy a motircycle to support her business, since with a motorcyle, Ardani who earlier brought her production to foodstalls or other salesperson as middlemen, could sell directly to the consumers, by travelling sales in her village, and also other villages. This activity is done 2X/day, morning from 5:00-8:00 AM, and afternoons from 2:00-6:00PM. Income / profit received by Ardani also increases to Rp60,000-80,000 (about US$7-()/daily.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Berprofesi sebagai pedagang sayur dan makanan sudah dilakukan Ardani sejak 2 tahun yang lalu. Berawal dari hoby memasak dan banyaknya waktu luang yang di miliki. Istri dari Putu Widana, yang sampai saat ini belum di karuniai anak ini memulai mengisi waktu luangnya dengan membuat berbagai jenis masakan seperti: sayur, kue dan ikan . Kemudian oleh Ardani semua masakannya itu di serahkan ke warung –warung ataupun di titip pada pedagang sayur keliling yang ada di desanya. Melihat hasil yang di dapat oleh Ardani sangat menjanjikan , usaha ini dijadikan sebagai sumber pendapatan utama keluarganya saat ini. Keuntungan Rp 25.000, / hari yang di dapat oleh Ardani dirasakan kurang mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya , hingga Ardani harus bekerja lebih keras lagi . Untuk mengembangkan usahanya Ardani meminjam modal dari Dinari , yang di pergunakan untuk membeli sebuah sepeda motor untuk menunjang kelancaran dari usahanya, karena dengan sepeda motor ini Ardani yang dulunya hanya menyerahkan hasil produksinya pada warung atau pedagang lain , kini Ardani bisa menjual langsung kepada konsumen (pelanggan )dengan berkeliling di desanya bahkan sampai keluar di desa-desa lain. Kegiatan ini dilakukan Ardani sampai dua kali sehari, yaitu pagi dari jam 5 sampai jam 8, dan sorenya mulai pukul 2 sampai 6 . Hasil / keuntungan yang di dapat Ardani pun meningkat yaitu berkisar Rp 60.000,- sampai Rp. 80.000 / hari .

loans.use:
To buy a motorcycle to support business activities

Membeli sepeda motor untuk menunjang kelancaran usahanya

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.es:
Soledad, Lidia y Katy are members of the “Dos Mil” (Two Thousand) Communal Bank. Soledad is single, while Katy and Lidia are married and have children.

Soledad sells ice creams as a peddler in the downtown area of the city. She used to work at a restaurant and started this business following the advice of a friend.

Lidia, on her part, buys and sells potato wholesale at the Santa Elena market. She also cultivates it in Matara.

On the other hand, Katy sells clothes on demand and, along with her husband, owns a Mototaxi. Taking advantage of the Christmas season, she will also sell toys.

Soledad, Lidia and Katy say there is camaraderie in their Communal Bank, which is patent when a member gets sick or has a special need and they collect money to support her. Soledad, Lidia and Katy are requesting loans for 200, 800 and 200 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of ice creams and popsicles, potato and for the repair of the mototaxi. Their savings are for their children, for emergency situations and, in Soledad’s case, for her higher studies.

They have many dreams: Lidia wishes for a big cart to transport her products, Soledad wants to become a professional and Katy wants a united family and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Soledad, Lidia y Katy son socias del Banco Comunal Dos Mil. Soledad es soltera, mientras que Katy y Lidia son casadas y tienen hijos.

Soledad vende helados en forma ambulante en el centro de la ciudad. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como empleada en restaurantes y por consejo de una amiga inició este negocio.

Por su parte, Lidia compra y vende papa al por mayor en el mercado de Santa Elena, y también siembra papa en Matara.

Por otro lado, Katy vende ropa a pedido, y junto a su esposo tienen una Mototaxi. Aprovechando la temporada navideña, también venderá juguetes.

Soledad, Lidia y Katy dicen que en su Banco Comunal hay compañerismo, que se demuestra cuando una socia se enferma o tiene alguna necesidad y ellas hacen una colecta para poder apoyarla. Soledad, Lidia y Katy necesitan préstamos de 200, 800 y 200 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de helados, chupetes, papa y para la reparación de su Mototaxi. Sus ahorros son para sus hijos, alguna emergencia y, en el caso de Soledad, para sus estudios superiores.

Sus sueños son muchos, como el caso de Lidia, quien sueña con comprar un carro grande para transportar su carga; Soledad quiere ser profesional y Katy quiere tener una familia unida y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Soledad, Lidia and Katy are requesting loans for 200, 800 and 200 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of ice creams and popsicles, potato and for the repair of the mototaxi.

loans.name: Doylith

texts.es:
Doylith Esther is a 42-year-old primary school teacher, and a friendly, super active woman. She has copy machines that she uses to provide the general public and businesses in the city the services that they require. Mrs. Doylith and her husband, Mrs. Oswaldo, have a 13-year-old daughter named Brenda, who is the light of their progress, and of course they want to give her everything she needs to one day be a successful professional. She has a goal, and that is to perform the necessary maintenance on her machines; she has also decided to open Internet service booths, and to do that, she requires an investment of capital. Let’s give a breath of hope to Mrs. Doylith so that she can complete her outlines proposals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doylith Esther, de 42 años de edad de profesión profesora de educación primaria, es una mujer jovial y súper activa, ella tiene máquinas copiadoras, con los que brinda servicios al público en general y a las empresas de su ciudad que lo requieran.La señora Doylith Esther junto a su Esposo el señor Oswaldo tienen una hija de 13 años de nombre Brenda, quien es la luz de su progreso y desde luego desean entregarle todo lo necesario para que en un futuro sea una profesional de éxito.Ella tiene una meta y esa es implementar y realizar el mantenimiento respectivo de sus máquinas, también ha decidido poner cabinas de Internet y para ello requiere de un capital de inversión.Demos un aliento de esperanza a la señora Doylith, para que cumpla sus propósitos trazados.

loans.use: Open a new Internet service and maintain the tools of her trade.

loans.name: Wampala South A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Getrude N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Getrude is 40 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 10 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Getrude makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more goods. Getrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in a poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.

Getrude is joined in her small group by Madina K., Jesca N., Madina N., and Ruth Namukose. Madina K. has a business operating a video cinema hall and wants to add more capital. Jesca N. is currently operating a business in brick making and wants a loan to add to her business. Madina N. operates a business selling milk and wants to boost the business. Ruth Namukose is currently in the business of running a hotel and is requesting a loan to buy more hotel equipment.

loans.use: To increase quantity of products in shop

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
From a very young age, Bertha has been involved in farm and agricultural work, due to her beloved parents' hard work in that sector. Currently, Bertha has five cows but she would like to own more. Therefore, due to her economic situation, she is seeking a loan to meet that goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Bertha, desde muy pequeña ha estado vinculada a las labores agrícolas y ganaderas gracias al buen desempeño de sus queridos padres en este campo. Actualmente tiene cinco vacas y su deseo de seguir incrementando el número de las mismas y las condiciones de su desarrollo la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Ebo

texts.en:
Ebo M. is in the telecommunications business; he also sells phone credits. He is a single parent with 1 child. He wants to expand and improve his business but lacks capital.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to enable him to improve the conditions of his business.

loans.use: As additional capital to enable him to improve the conditions of his business

loans.name: Rose Baganize's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a leader of four members and she is the first one from the left. She is 42 years old and is married with 6 children, who are 26, 24, 22, 20, 18 and 16 years old. Four of them are in school. The community she lives and works in is in a slum and low lying area, and this area is prone to floods in times of rains.

She purchases local brew for onward sale at retail, which she has done for 20 years. Her main challenges are the rising price of the commodity, which reduces the number of clients and selling more on credit, thus affecting profits.

She has managed to buy a refrigerator for home use, contributes to the running of the home, and is able to educate her children. Her plans are to increase her stock and invest more in her children’s education. Rose has successfully paid back more than 20 loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock and invest more in her children’s education.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy T., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Theng, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have a son and a daughter. The daughter helps in the business and the son is in school.

Mrs. T. has been selling cucumber pickles and fruit for seven years. She buys them from her village, and other nearby villages, and resales them at the market in Phnom Penh. Cucumber pickles are very popular for people who live in Phnom Penh and nearby province. Mr. Theng has been a motor taxi driver for three years and also assists in his wife’s business. Mrs. T. has hired one shop to sell pickles and fruit. Now she needs money to buy a shop to run the business.

Mrs. T. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a shop to sell fruit and pickles.

loans.use: To purchase a shop to sell fruit and pickles.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
Grisel Y. lives in a tropical paradise in the Dominican Republic. Surrounded by the jungle, with a small waterfall nearby, most would consider this exotic location the perfect vacation destination. But the tranquil image is shattered by the reality of the poverty confronted in the small town of Imbert every day. Grisel works everyday to provide meals and school materials for her three children (and a 4th on the way). With her two small barbecues, she sets up shop at a popular intersection in town, where she sells Chicharrones (deep fried pork) and other meets. With this loan, Grisel intends to purchase propane, paint for her BBQ, and a supply of raw meet and oils. While her current business is selling food, she dreams of one day owning her own boutique clothing store.

Grisel is the leader of a 10 person micro bank Mujeres de Fe, which means "Women of Faith". Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another's payments in order to receive their next loan together. As these 10 women embark upon their first ever loan from Esperanza, we are confident that they will all succeed in bettering their lives and the lives of their families with this loan. One of the women in the group just began a small general store, one owns a small hair salon, and several of the others plan to sell clothing.

On behalf of Grisel Yocast, the Mujeres de Fe group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase paint to decorate a barbecue, propane, and pork to be sold on the street.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 46 years old and married with two children. Currently, the two kids are in school. She lives in Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana with her family. She has been a seamstress for fifteen years. She sews all forms of female outfits with various styles that suit the tastes of her customers. She sews kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She also sells ladies' wear, such as jeans, skirts and tops, and other clothing. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, thread and thimbles to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called Asomafo Group. In this group, members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral. Patience is in the photo with her daughter and one of her apprentices.

loans.use: To buy more sewing tools and materials

loans.name: Rosario Alejandra

texts.es: Rosario M. es soltera y  vive en la avenida Santísima Trinidad de la zona villa Cooperativa  en la ciudad de El Alto, junto a sus padres. Es enfermera en un hospital de la ciudad. Solicita crédito para pagar sus estudios de post grado. Es su primer crédito en Impro, pero a diferencia de otros clientes, su ocupación laboral es más estable por lo que aseguramos todo tipo de garantía.
texts.en:
Rosario M. is single and lives with her parents on Santísima Trinidad Avenue in the Cooperativa neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She is a nurse in a city hospital. She is applying for a loan to pay for her post-graduate studies. It is her first credit with Impro, but her occupation is more stable than other clients, which is why we are sure of her collateral.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of Post-Graduate Studies

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa T.  est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est boulangère depuis 3 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère par ce crédit de FECECAV, se faire construire un nouveau four et aussi acheter des sacs de farine de blé ainsi que autres condiments nécessaires à l’exécution de son travail. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus de profits pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa T., age 43, is married and the mother of 5 children. She's been a baker for 3 years in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this FECECAV loan,she hopes to have a new oven built for her, and to buy sacks of wheat flour and other products necessary to her work. This will enable her to make more profits to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new oven and to buy sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is a beautiful young woman. Ngozi sells wrappers (sarongs), shoes, bags and hair gear in her shop. Ngozi has been in this business for the past three years. Ngozi is 27 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 N to purchase more merchandise to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret K., 70, and his wife, Ouch Chik, 59, live on an island near the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1959 and have three children; one son and two daughters. The children are all married and both sons live outside the family home. The daughter lives at home with her husband and three children.

Saret and his wife have been farming since 1973. They grow ginger, corn, bitter gourd, and pumpkins on their farmland. Sometimes they sell their yield at Derm Kor market in Phnom Penh and sometimes they sell them to the middleman in the village.  

Saret is requesting a loan of $600 for growing more ginger and to help his daughter raise pigs.

loans.use: for growing more ginger and to help his daughter raise pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of fifteen people is located in Krang Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Arn O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets for her current breeding. She hopes she can improve her living conditions with this new loan.

Her husband, Mr. Bong Vang, is a firewood seller who can make only a little income to support the family. Mrs. Arn O. is 47 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy three more piglets

loans.name: Unidos Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Juana B., a mother of three from Hato Mayor, is the leader of the Bank of Hope group called Unidos Por el Progreso.  The members of this group will share the loan and use it for their various businesses. 

Juana has a business selling ice cream and fruit and will use the loan to buy needed supplies such flour, oil, and peanuts.  She is having trouble finding a house of her own and would one day like to own her own cafeteria and support her children in their studies.  

Thanks for your interest in supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy oil, peanuts, and other supplies

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
CLAUDIA ISABEL, pertenece al banco comunal “vecinas Unidas” ubicado en Jr. Piura N° 136 –Distrito de Callería, tiene 29 años de edad, 2 hijos, es madre soltera, es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años. 

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, viajó a la ciudad de Lima a comprar ropas al por mayor, para venderlos a sus amistades, como short, polos, pantalones, zapatos, todo solo pedidos. El negocio cada vez creció, en su casa apertura una bodega pequeña.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro 1 saco de arroz, 01 saco de azúcar, 30 Kg. de fideos, medio paquete de detergente, 24 unidades de leche grande, 02 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 caja de huevos, jabones, 1 saco de sal, ambiento su local.

Feliz muy contenta por pertenecer a Manuela Ramos,  porque tiene amigas que la apoyan y la acompañan  siempre.
texts.en:
CLAUDIA ISABEL belongs to the communal bank called “Vecinas Unidas” located on Piura N ° 136 – district of Callería. She is 29 years old and she has 2 children. She is a single mother and she has been a partner of Manuela Ramos for 5 years. The first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles ($90), she traveled to the city of Lima to buy wholesale clothes, and sold them to her friends, like short, shirts, trousers, shoes. The business grew every time and then she open a small grocery shop at home. With this loan of 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles ($325) she will buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 30 kg of noodles, half a pack of detergent, 24 units of milk, 2 bundles of toilet paper, 1 box of eggs, soap, 1 sack of salt. She is very glad to belong to Manuela Ramos (Kiva's partner), because she has friends who support her and always accompany her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 30 kg of noodles, half a pack of detergent, 24 units of milk, 2 bundles of toilet paper, 1 box of eggs, soap, 1 sack of salt.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Batoul has owned a clothing shop for a year.

She has requested a loan of $700 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase a computer for her shop. This is the first time that Batoul has requested a loan.

Batoul's clients are people from her region. She decided on doing her business because of her experience in the business.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her shop

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Georgina es separada tiene  48 años, tiene dos hijos de 30 y 23 años que trabajan.
Ella empezó el negocio de venta de menú, al frente de su casa había un lugar donde daban menú y siempre estaba lleno, converso con su hija que no-tenia trabajó y decidieron vender menú hasta el día de hoy han pasado cuatro años y le va bien, tiene mas clientelas. 
Georgina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de una cocina industrial de tres hornillas.
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mas capital, puede comprar al por mayor, a comprado ollas, platos para su negocio. 
El sueño de Georgina es terminar de construir su casa, para alquilarla y vivir de sus rentas.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of "Bancomunal Amistad Unida" (United Friendship Community Bank).

Georgina is separated. She is 48 years old. She has two children who are 30 and 23 years old and working.

She began selling food. In front of her house, there was a place where they sold food and it was always full. She spoke with her daughter, who was not working, and they decided to sell food. Today, they have been working for four years and the business is going well for them. They have a growing number of customers.

Georgina needs a loan of $650 (2000 PEN) in order to buy an industrial kitchen with three ovens.

Since she has been in FINCA, she has more capital, and can buy wholesale and buy pots and dishes for her business.

Georgina’s dream is to finishing constructing her house so that she can rent it and live on the income.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Georgina needs a loan of $650 (2000 PEN) in order to purchase an industrial kitchen with three ovens.

loans.name: Jèkafo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Jèkafo toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à Médine un des quartiers populaires de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de savons, de pomme de terre, la teinture et la restauration (avec la vente de pâté).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire, tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 10 cartons de savon, 20 sacs de pomme de terre, 2 sacs de farine de blé, 2 sacs du sel de cuisine, 10 complets de bazin blanc, 5 sachets de soude caustique, 10 boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes, etc. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Médine et au grand marché de Sikasso. Les marchandises sont vendues  au marché, dans les concessions et de  façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Jèkafo ambitionnent être  grossiste.
texts.en:
The five members of the Jèkafo group, all married, have an average age of 30 and 3 children. They live in polygamous families in Médine, one of the working class neighborhoods of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They have various businesses, among others, the sale of soap and potatoes, dyeing cloth, and selling cooked food (together with the sale of pâté). They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 10th solidarity loan, all the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed.

With this new loan they intend to buy 10 cartons of soap, 20 sacks of potatoes, 2 sacks of wheat flour, 2 sacks of cooking salt, 10 outfits made of white damask fabric, 5 envelopes of caustic soda, 10 boxes of dye of various colors, etc. They buy their supplies in the market of Médine and the big market of Sikasso. The merchandise is sold in the market, out of their compounds, and door-to-door, to a clientele composed of men and women and mostly for cash.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest reinvested into their businesses.

The ambition of the women of the Jèkafo group is to be wholesalers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale, for dyeing, and for food service

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is forty-five years old and lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hassan has owned a bakery for ten years. He does “saj” and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where he makes saj bread, and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh.  A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Hassan requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase ingredients like oil, flour, thyme and cheese, and also to change the décor of his bakery. Hassan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his bakery. Hassan is well-known for his baked goods because of the good taste of his mankoucheh. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He did not find it difficult to get his business established. Hussein decided to open his bakery because he wanted to improve his family’s situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his baked goods.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 39 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. He has been working as an electrician for twenty five years.

Tarek requested a loan of $3,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to pay for his children's school tuition. This is the first time that Tarek has requested a loan.

Tarek is special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Tarek decided on his business because of his experience and he also wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and pay for his children's school tuition

loans.name: 10-Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hà B. Thị (247) is a 37-year-old woman who lives in the town of ThA. Hoá. Hà is the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by the ThA. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10-Đông Sơn (10-13-010).

Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Hà sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hà joined the ThA. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà is requesting a second loan from the ThA. Hoa Fund for Poor Women of 1.626.900 VND that she will use to expand her business. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

  • T. Thị Ý (5) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
  • N. Thị Thương (246) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her service-based business.
  • T. Thị Hương (248) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

loans.use: To expanding her business

loans.name: Isedra

texts.en:
Mrs. Isedra E. is 46 years old and lives at Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer and lends a hand in farming specifically in corn production, which is their primary activity. 
She is a member of Paglaum MPC since June 2006. Now she is applying for Php 8,000.00 intended to buy farm fertilizers and pesticides. She has many plans for the future -- to buy a carabao to toil the land, build a simple concrete house and be able to send their children to school and finish a degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the corn

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer: Grupo 8 Group

texts.en:
Renata R., 38, is looking forward to taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use the funds to expand a home-operated beauty salon she managed to fund herself. Now, with an inside knowledge of her customers’ preferences, she will use her loan to sell beauty products door-to-door in her neighborhood.

Looking ahead, Renata plans to use her new income to both continue taking out future loans to expand her business, and to provide benefits for her two children, Jose (12) and Katherine (14), who already attend school.

Renata is Coordinator of the newly formed solidarity group “Nuevo Renacer” (“New Rebirth”), pictured above. From left to right: Yessi, Evelin, Renata, Juana and Carmen.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
El señor Marlon C. es un agricultor del municipio de Telica el cual se dedica a la siembra de ajonjolí, maíz y sorgo desde hace varios años teniendo experiencia amplia en esta actividad que requiere de muchísimo esfuerzo para llevarla a cabo.

Hoy en día, el señor Marlon atraviesa una necesidad y es la de invertir en la compra de los fertilizantes para llevar a cabo su actividad ya que la siembra de ajonjolí, maíz y sorgo requiere de estos fertilizantes a lo inmediato. Muy confiadamente espera ser beneficiado con un crédito para dar lugar a su actividad y así alcanzar una cosecha muy buena.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon C. is a farmer from the municipality of Telica. He has grown sesame, corn, and sorghum for many years, and he has a lot of experience in this activity, which requires a lot of effort to carry out. Today, Mr. Marlon needs to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to pursue his activity, since his sesame, corn and sorghum crops need these fertilizers immediately. He is hopeful that he will benefit from a loan to support his activity and, in this way, to achieve a very good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Generacion 2009 Group

texts.es:
Diversos son las actividades económicas de las  integrantes del grupo “Generación 2009”,  como la venta comida (salchipapa), tienda de abarrotes, venta de pasteles, revistas, colorantes para ropa y pisos de goma. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería e insumos y seguir operando en sus negocios.
“Generación 2009” es un grupo nuevo de 10 personas y son vecinas de la zona Los Andes, su presidenta es Verónica L. y espera trabajar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer. Todas están dispuestas a cumplir los reglamentos internos de su grupo y los de la institución, además de capacitarse en todos las reuniones que vengan.
texts.en:
The Generación 2009 Group members own diverse businesses, such as food sales (salchipapas—Peruvian street food made of pan-fried sausages and French fries), general store, cake sales, magazines, clothing dyes, and rubber flooring. The members need a loan in order to purchase merchandise and supplies so that they can keep their businesses running.

Generación 2009 is a new group that is comprised of 10 members who are all neighbors in the Los Andes zone. Their president is Verónica L., and she hopes to work with the Pro Mujer family for a long time. They are all willing to comply with both the group and institute regulations, as well as receive training at all the scheduled meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a member of the sokoni borrower group in kiboriloni,Kilimanjaro. she is a 27-year-old single.    
Salma has owned a food business for 5 years.She works 8   hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Salma’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania.She has requested 150,000TSH in order to buy more food product to her business like rice,cooking oil.

 With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Salma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Nyadid

texts.en:
Nyadid M. is currently in the business of selling beer from her home and is requesting a loan to open up a bar at the nearby market. Nyadid is 29 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has two children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more chairs and tables to improve the bar and also to buy more refrigerators.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bar

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 30 year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. For eight years, Khaled has been working as a tomato farmer. He is seeking a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan cycle and previously he always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business by producing more tomatoes. His clients are tomato traders. When Khaled first started his work, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on this business because he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business further.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Here is Mustapha G.. Mustapha wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children. 

Thirty-year-old Mustapha is married and has five children. His children are attending schools: two are in primary schools and three are in secondary school.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Hadija A. R. from Morogoro. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents can’t take care of him. Since 2000, Hadija has been running a mama lishe (a local restaurant or café). In Tanzania, this usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantains (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. Hadija works at the business for 13 to 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 Tsh in order to purchase additional ingredients in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Hadija thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Jean Nepomscene

texts.en:
Jean Nepomscene is 20 years old and single, and he lives in the western province of Rwanda which is approximately 3 hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here, Jean Nepomscene has had a shop selling a variety of goods for the past 2 years. Even at a relatively young age, he is proving to be a successful businessperson and loves having his own shop. The hours of his business require that he work from 7 AM to 8PM every day.

Jean Nepomscene employs 2 people as helpers. The nature of his business is somewhat capital intensive and in order to grow, Jean Nepomscene is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his shop through purchasing larger quantities of bulk goods and supplies at lower costs. This additional capital will allow him to get the best pricing and adequately satisfy the product needs and wants of his customers. As any entrepreneur, Jean Nepomscene hopes to make more profit, which will help him to build a secure future for himself.

loans.use: More inventory and more varieties of goods

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 25 years old, single, and works primarily as a taxi driver.  He also has a dairy cow farm and sells milk for additional earnings.  Vicente learned dairy cow farming as a teenager, and has had his own dairy cows now for 8 years.

Vicente is going to use this loan from CIDRE to construct a stable for his cows.  If the dairy cows are more protected from the weather, they will be healthier and produce more milk.

Vicente hopes to marry his girlfriend Roxana and start a family with her in the near future.  He also hopes to help his younger siblings financially, as his parents are aging and he wants to make sure the children attend and complete high school.  He himself did not finish high school because he began working instead, so he only finished primary school, and thus he considers educating his siblings extremely important.

loans.use: Construction of a stable for dairy cows

loans.name: Ronald Shake

texts.en:
Ronald Shake is 41 years old and married to Eunice Charo. Together have a daughter named Carol.

Ronald's business is situated in Gongoni-Malindi and he sells retail goods which include items such as sugar, rice, milk and other household necessities. His business has been in operation for the last 12 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 8,000. He also runs a vegetable shop on the side which boosts on his income.

He was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a client. Ronald plans to add stock of flour, sugar and other items in the shop as well as supply paraffin to other retail shops with the loan that he has been advanced. He hopes to expand the business by opening another retail shop with the extra earnings from the business loan.

Ronald describes himself as a determined man with a heart to succeed and dreams of owning a wholesale shop that will cater for both small and large retail shops in Malindi.

loans.use: To add general stock of flour, sugar and parrafin for sale

loans.name: Teresa Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Teresa del Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de 04 hijas, que aun dependen de ella, es por esta razón que se esfuerza día a día.

Teresa del Pilar, se dedica a la confección de manualidades y venta de juguetes, se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 
Teresita, como le dicen de cariño, es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, le pone empeño a su trabajo, de esta manera, cumplir sus demás sueños y darle una buena educación a sus hijas y verlas profesional, mas adelante.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará materiales, para la confección de sus diseños como: temperas profesionales, pinceles, lápices, telas, para sus manualidades. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de juguetes de plástico para niños y niñas.

Teresa del Pilar, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciarse en su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa del Pilar belongs to the “Las Abejitas” Communal Bank, in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old, in a stable relationship, and the mother of 4 daughters who still depend on her. It is for them that she endeavors day after day. Teresa del Pilar dedicates herself to making hand-sewn artistry and selling toys. Her shop is located in her own house, in an ambiance well conditioned for attending to her customers. Teresita, as she is lovingly called, is a very hard-working woman who day after day, puts much effort into her work. In this manner, she attempts to achieve her dreams and provide a good education for her daughters and see them become professionals down the road. With this loan of 1,300 New Sols she will buy materials to create her designs, including professional patterns, artist's brushes, pencils, and cloth for making her hand-sewn artistry. Part of the money will be used to buy plastic toys for boys and girls. Teresa del Pilar today feels like an accomplished woman, with much desire to continue forward and turn her dreams into reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela de Ramos for helping her start her business, as well as those of many other women who wished to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY  MATERIALS FOR MAKING HER EMBROIDERY AND PLASTIC TOYS TO SELL

loans.name: Ulda Maria

texts.es: Ulda Maria tiene 38 años, esta joven tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente 2 están a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 14 años que se dedica  a este negocio, ella va a realizar la compra de sus productos porque es mucho más favorable comprar al por mayor. Ella no tiene mucha competencia pues el lugar donde habita es una comarca donde ella vende de manera accesible y no tiene mucha competencia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, pan, leche, pollo, detergentes y jabón. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ulda Maria is 38 years old. This young woman has four children, of whom only two are in her care. She has been operating a grocery store for the past 14 years. Ulda plans to buy more merchandise because it is better to acquire them in bulk. Her business is located in a region that is accessible and does not have much competition.

The loan she is requesting will be use as operating capital to buy candy, natural sodas, juices, bread, milk, chicken, detergents, and soap. She hopes to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kuku (chicken) feed and drugs.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.fr: A. Zeynab est née vers 1980 à Bonou, mais vit depuis quatre ans au quartier Djèdjèlayé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à HOUNTONDJI Sylvain, un chauffeur, Zeynab est mère d’un enfant.  Zeynab vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Zeynab n’a jamais fréquenté l’école mais a appris le métier de coiffure. Parallèlement à cette activité, Florence vend des mèches et des produits pour les cheveux dans son salon de coiffure.  Zeynab a quatre ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Zeynab est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé.  Elle a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits et sollicite un autre crédit pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.  Elle ambitionne plus tard réaménager son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Zeynab A. was born in 1980 in Bonou, but has been living for four years in the Djèdjèlayé neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Sylvain HOUNTONDJI, a driver, and she's the mother of one child. Zeynab lives together with her husband and her child. The couple provides for the family expenses together. Zeynab never attended school, but was trained as a hairdresser. In parallel, she sells hair extensions and haircare products in her salon. She has four years of experience in this field, and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market place in Benin. She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The first two loans were repaid without problems, and she's now seeking another loan to bolster her business and increase her profit. She ambitions to later rearrange her salon.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and haircare products

loans.name: Bin

texts.en: Mrs. Bin C. is a 47-year-old cake seller. She usually makes the cakes at home and then walks around her community to sell them, generating approximately $5 per day. Bin C. has another income earner in her husband, who drives a motorcycle taxi. The couple has a child who goes to school. Recently Bin C.’s husband has hardly been able to find new clients since his old taxi is unattractive. Therefore, Bin C. has requested a loan which would enable her husband to replace his old motor.

loans.use: To replace an old motor

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng K., age 44, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has seven children. She is engaged in a business of producing Cambodian traditional cakes, earning a gross income of about $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband works at the market to help transport goods for the people at the market, earning an income of about $2 per day. K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a driver. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene seis hijos mayores, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicado en la hermosa selva de Ayacucho. En años anteriores, vendía panes recorriendo las calles de su comunidad, pero en vista que no lo daba resultados, decidió emprender un nuevo trabajo, que es el cultivo de Cacao y frutas Cítricas, en donde le está otorgando buenos beneficios económicos. Usualmente se establece en su chacra de lunes a sábado a partir de las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero por lo general tiene a cargo peones que le puedan facilitar el trabajo de la siembra de cacao y frutas cítricas. En un futuro cercano quiere seguir apostando en abrir un Panadería, por considerarlo como un buen negocio, puesto que sabe que es una necesidad para el desayuno familiar. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente contento por el respaldo que le están brindando sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su chacra, de esa manera obtener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 years old, married, and has 6 grown children. They all live together in their home, which is located in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle. In the past he sold bread on the streets of his community, but as he was not having much success, he decided to begin a new business farming cocoa and citrus fruits, which has benefited him financially. He is usually on his land from Monday to Saturday from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm. His family will occasionally help, but he generally has laborers who help with the harvest of cocoa and citrus fruits. In the near future he wants to try his luck opening a bakery, which he considers a good business since bread is needed for family breakfasts. This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to make the payments. He is happy for the support given to him from his peers in the community bank. He will use the loan for maintaining his farm plot to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For maintaining farm land

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie B., 41 years old, is a pig grower. She has two children; the eldest is 18. She works very hard so that she can provide her family's needs. She started her piggery in 1990. Up to now, she has been growing pigs because for her it is a profitable business to be in.  Aside from pigs, she also maintains a 1-hectare farm. She grows rice. Her rice farm supplements the family income. She would like to request a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Tepeko Ole

texts.en:
Tepeko Ole S. is 45 years old. He is married to Wanjiku S. and he is the father of five children.

Tepeko is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

Tepeko learned about KADET from a friend in his locality who is already a KADET registered client. This will be Tepeko’s second loan. He is planning to plant twenty acres of wheat which has proved to be doing very well in his area and keep some sheep for fattening to sell later.

With the profits Tepeko hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat production. The area has favorable climate for wheat farming thus making him think of wheat farming only.

Tepeko’s future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial purposes and be the leading farmer in his area.

Tepeko’s hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To plant twenty acres of wheat and raise sheep

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia C. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 52 and married with four school-aged children.  Lilia runs a general store selling a variety of different products. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product line

loans.name: Jay Ven

texts.en:
Jay Ven G. is from Camen Annex, Ozamiz City. He is 25 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Jay Ven owns and operates a business operating motorcycle transportation services. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jay Ven joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jay Ven is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Josue

texts.en:
Mr. G., 29 years old, lives together with Ms. Laura Rivarola who is 23 years old.  They do not have any children and live in the downtown area of Itá with his parents.

Josue has dedicated more than 5 years to making and selling wooden plates, spatulas, serving platters, as well as thermos coverings for mate and tereré (traditional tea drinks of Paraguay). On request, he sells to supermarkets and wholesalers in the cities of Asunción, Misones, and Santaní but also possesses a formidable clientele that continually buys his products.  His whole family is dedicated to this activity, each contributing with their own customers.

The loan that Josue is requesting will go towards buying wood and thermoses for mate and tereré so he can handcraft them and sell them commercially.  He already has a very important order that he wishes to take advantage of and this loan will help him meet that order.

loans.use: Making wooden plates, spatulas, serving platters, and handcrafted covers for thermoses

loans.name: Alexanhder

texts.es:
El señor Alexanhder R. V., tiene la edad de 29 años vive en el populoso barrio las Coneheras, con su esposa y su hijo de un años de edad, se dedica la venta de ropa y pesee una pequeña tienda en donde ofrerta sus productos, su señora se dedica a las actividades del hogar y le apoya en la administración de su negocio, ellos son una familia que comienza a labrar su futuro y que han tenido sufrido robos que afectan la zona y que no le permiten vivir en tranquilidad donde su familia y su negocio se desarrollan, es de esta forma que él espera a futuro asegurar su negocio y hogar para evitar estos problemas que afectan su economía y su vida diaria.
Es para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería, que solicita un préstamo y de esta manera aumentar sus niveles de venta y mejorar sus condiciones familiares, y llevar a cabo su planes para la expamncion del negocio y/o proyectos de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Alexanhder R. V. is 29 years old and lives in the populous neighborhood Las Coneheras with his wife and their young son. He has dedicated himself to selling clothing and owning a small store to offer his products. His wife is dedicated to the household chores and supports him with the business. Although they have suffered from robberies that affect the neignborhood and don't allow them to live in peace nor develop their business, they are a family that is beginning to build a future. He hopes in the future to insure his business and home to avoid these problems that affect their economic well-being and daily life. He is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to increase sales, improve their living conditions, and to carry out his business expansion plan and/or family projects.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Frorence

texts.en: Frorence is married with four children who are in school.  She owns and operates a retail shop.  She has been in the business for five years.  She also sells clothes to supplement her family’s income.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to add to the stock of clothing in her boutique.  She also wants to buy sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour in order to expand what her shop offers.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her shop and buy sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour

loans.name: Sayra Esmelin

texts.es:
La señora Sayra R. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de producos para la limpieza del hogar, cosméticos y plásticos de manera domiciliar y ambulante, además de este negocio también se dedica a la repostería (elaboración de pasteles), mismo con el que cuenta con seis años de experiencia.
La señora R. convive actualmente con el señor Héctor Enrique Castellanos el cual se dedica a la ganadería.
Del hogar de los señores Castellanos R. dependen sus 4 hijos y con las ganancias percibidas del negocio de la señora R. ayuda a su compañero de hogar a pagar los gastos de alimentación, vivienda, salud y educación de sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar productos de limpieza, cremas y lociones.
texts.en:
Sayra R. works in commerce. Her main activity is the home sale of household cleaning products, cosmetics and plastic utensils. She also works baking (cakes) and has six years of experience. She now lives in common law marriage with Hector Enrique Castellanos who raises cattle. Their home and four children are supported by them. She helps her partner pay for the cost of food, housing, health and education for their children with the income from her business. She will use the loan to buy cleaning products, moisturizers and lotions.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household cleaning products, moisturizers and lotions.

loans.name: Adiara

texts.fr:
Madame Adiara Sangaré est une femme mariée de 29 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école dès à son jeune âge, elle s’initia aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et la vente des pagnes et chaussures. Avec plus de 6 ans d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité, qu’elle a appris auprès de sa mère. 
C’est dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, qu’elle décide de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des pagnes et  des chaussures. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali)
Elle est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle mène cette activité dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni et  au  grand marché les jours des foires. 
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 38 000FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir un jour grossiste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiara Sangaré, 29 years old, is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hérémakono North district of Bougoni. Having left school at an early age, she started working to earn an income, in particular by selling “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabric] and shoes. Now, with over 6 years of experience, she excels in this line of business she has learned from her mother. Looking for additional financial resources, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to purchase “pagnes” cloth and shoes. She stocks up in Bamako (the capital of Mali). This is her first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. She sells her wares in different districts of Bougnoui and at the big market on market days. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 38,000 West African Francs. Thanks to this income, she envisages expanding her business and eventually becoming a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing shoes and traditional "pagnes" fabrics

loans.name: Mirembe Women's Group,nyenje-Mukono

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Robinah M. of the Mirembe Women's Group exemplifies business purposefulness in its essence. On the strength of that attribute, combined with other factors, she has established a dependable niche for her brick sales and poultry business that she has been at the helm of for the last five years in Nyenje-Mukono. 

Robinah is happily married with five kids. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 50,000 shillings and with this loan, she wants to buy more chickens to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of more chickens to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Né le 16 Juin 1976 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Adama B. est marié résidant avec son épouse et leurs trois enfants à Banconi, un des quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur B. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au  domaine du petit commerce notamment  l’achat et la vente de volailles il y'a huit ans. Il dispose d’une place au niveau de marché de volailles de Wayerma I. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses volailles qui sont de bonnes qualités et bien suivis par des vétérinaires qualifiés. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qui a été correctement remboursement. 
Ainsi, il sollicite ce deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso plus de volaille : 40 poulets, 18 pintades, 11 paires de dindons, 4 paires de canards, 3 paires d’oies etc. 
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce deuxième crédit, un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama B. was born June 16, 1976 in Sikasso. He is married and lives with his wife and their three children in Banconi, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

After attempting several activities without success, Mr. B. became involved in the business of buying and selling poultry eight years ago. He has a stall at the poultry market in Wayerma I. He is in high demand for the quality of his products, which consist of high grade poultry closely monitored by qualified veterinarians.

To satisfy a steadily growing customer base, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and was granted his first loan, which he repaid in full.

He is now seeking a second loan to buy more poultry in the villages surrounding Sikasso: 40 chickens, 18 guinea fowls, turkeys 11 pairs of turkeys, 4 pairs of ducks, 3 pairs of geese, etc. 

With this loan, he expects to make an average monthly profit of 100 000FCFA, which will be used primarily to increase his working capital, cover family expenses and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry (chickens, guinea fowl, turkeys, etc.).

loans.name: Elbia Antonia

texts.es:
la señora Elbia A. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Portillo de la ciudad de Choluteca, Elbia se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos en general, tiene una gran mayoria de clientes los cuales le encargan
productos todos los meses, esto hace que tenga un buen movimiento de su mercaderia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas cosmeticos al por mayor.
Elbia distribuye su producto en San Marcos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Elbia A. is 59 years old and she lives in the community of El Portillo, in the city of Choluteca. Elbia sells cosmetics in general. She has a large client base that place orders for products every month. The merchandise she has sees quite a lot of movement.  The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetics in wholesale. Elbia distributes her products in San Marcos.  The profits she earns are used to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase various cosmetic items.

loans.name: Sop Sën Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de Solidarité SOP SËN FALLOU est créé le 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD 2.

Madame Rokhaya S. à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge d'un neveu et d'une nièce.

Elle fait depuis 5 ans un petit commerce de thioub. Elle est aussi vendeuse de poulets locaux. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement pour accroitre ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la nourriture, de la santé, de la scolarisation et de l'habillement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SËN FALLOU was created on March 28, 2008.  It is composed of 9 women who come from the same neighborhood.   They are organized according to where they live and by common interest. The group are members the Banc Villageios of Montagne Nord 2.

Madame Rokhaya S., to the right in the picture, is the leader of the solidarity group.  She is 54 years old and the mother of four children.  She also takes care of a nephew and a niece.  

For five years, she has been in the business of selling thioub (dyed cloth).  She also sells local chickens. 

With her new loan she plans to increase her stocks so that she can increase her revenue.  

Her goal is to provide food, health care, education, and clothing to her children.

loans.use: To develop and promote their small businesses

loans.name: Bolotbek

texts.en: Bolotbek M. is 39, married and has three children of school age. He lives in Dobolu village and engages in cattle breeding. He started this business in 1990 in order to earn a living and support his family. With initial capital of only 1,200 Kyrgyz Soms, Bolotbek worked hard to make his business successful. In 2009, he applied for his first loan for purchasing cattle, which he used as intended and repaid without any delays. Using the revenues from selling fattened cattle, he was able to buy a used car for his family. Today Bolotbek’s farm accounts for three milk cows, five goats, four sheep and one horse. Bolotbek plans to use this loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden his business by purchasing bull calves. With the revenues from this investment, Bolotbek plans to reconstruct his barn. Bai-Tushum and Partners Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Iris María

texts.es: Iris María G. C. de 18 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora quien desde muy pequeña ha trabajado junto a su madre, la cual se dedica a la venta de productos varios, así mismo vive junto a su hermana mayor de 19 años de edad. Iris se dedica a la venta de plantas en la plaza llamada Bendición de Dios, ubicada en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual cuenta con muy buenas ganancias, debido a que posee plantas muy bonitas y a precios accesibles. Esto lo hace con el deseo de mejorar la economía familiar y poder brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su madre. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero para invertir en nuevas plantas como: pascuas, orquídeas, entre otras más las cuales sean muy buena opción de regalo para esta navidad. Con esto Iris espera mejorar su negocio y seguir creciendo en el.
texts.en:
Iris María G. C. is 18 years old.  She is a very enterprising young woman who has worked together with her mother since she was very young.  Her mother works selling various products.  Iris also lives with her older sister who is 19.  She sells plants in Benedición de Dios Square, in Colón, in La Libertad department.

Iris makes good profits because her plants are very pretty and she sells them at an affordable price.  She carries out her business with a desire to improve her family's finances and provide all the help she can to her mother.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will provide her with the money she needs to invest in new plants such as poinsettias, orchids and others which make very good gift choices this Christmas.  With this loan, Iris hopes to improve and continue growing in her business.

loans.use: To buy plants to sell

loans.name: River
