texts.es: River, de 24 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Gladis de 18 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeño River aprendió ha trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra café, cacao y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su producción. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
River is 24 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working young man who lives in his parents' house together with his 18 year-old wife Gladis.  What he wants more than anything is to improve their quality of life.  From a very early age, River learned to work on the farm together with his parents who taught him everything that needs to be done in order to achieve a good crop.

River now has his own land which he farms and takes cares of with a lot of love and patience.  He grows coffee, cacao and coca leaf.  He then takes his products to the market in the city of San Francisco to sell.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since he feels then that his hard work is bearing fruit.  River has been in this business for 3 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from the insect infestations that can affect his production.  His biggest wish is to buy a car which he could use to transport his products to market.

This is River's first loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his repayments on time and he is ready to do this.  He will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy more manure and insecticides to improve the quality of his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Yat Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Dak Por village in Takeo province, there are 16 people who make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Sao Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to grow rice to support her family. She is a silk weaver at her home where she is able to earn some money for selling silk cloth. Since her weaving is going well, she wants to expand. For this reason,  Mrs. Sao Y. is seeking a loan to buy more silk. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a driver who gets a low salary to support the family. The other is a seller at a clothes shop who earns a low salary too.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Luciano Antonio

texts.es:
Luciano de profesión agricultor desde mucho tiempo ha trabajo en conjunto con su familia en la tierra de su finca de donde ha obtenido sus bienes. Tiene dentro de sus proyectos la construcción de su vivienda cerca de la finca así cuidar mejor la cosecha de los robos que se dan de los productos. Inicio a la falta de empleo en el país, siendo de gran beneficio ya que emprendo en el camino de tener su propio negocio. Se ha visto afectado con plagas y robo en la zona de la cosecha. 
Con el préstamo que solicitad lo invertirá en la compra de insumo y fertilizante obtenido mejores productos para vender. Con un gran agradecimiento a la financiera ya que del préstamo brindado el mejorara su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luciano is a farmer.  He has worked on the land, along with his family, for many years and the farm is his main source of income.  One of his projects is a plan to build a house near the farm so that he can better protect his crops from the thieves who steal from him.  Sadly, thievery and crop disease are common in the area.  Given the lack of employment in the country, this investment should be considered worthwhile. 

Luciano will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other supplies for the farm so that he can ultimately get a better return on his crop.  He is very grateful for the loan because it will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and other supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “ROCA FUERTE”, es un grupo de 8 personas, 7 mujeres y un varón.  Esta Banca Comunal es parte del centro focal de Villa Exaltación, están iniciando su ciclo número 14, durante este tiempo las socias han tenido tiempo para conocerse entre sí.

Cada una de ellas tiene negocio propio, de diferentes tipos ya sean productivos, de comercio y de servicio.

Para su organización, el banco comunal “Roca Fuerte” cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Antonia, una tesorera, la señora  Maritza y una secretaria de actas, la señora Maria.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Antonia, es una mujer de 59 años de edad, vive  con su esposo y es madre de siete hijos.   El negocio de la señora Antonia  es "taller de balatería" (balata es la pieza del automóvil referido al freno)  la iniciativa fue de de su hijo pues conocía del rubro, el negocio ya tiene cuatro años.  Su primer crédito fue de $us100.- y le sirvió para comprar maquinas de coser, ese fue su primer negocio.  En este ciclo comprará material para el taller de balatería.
Cuando se le consulta a la señora presidenta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde la capacitación y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The "ROCA FUERTE communal bank is a group of 8 people of which 7 are women and one is a man.  This bank belongs to the Villa Exaltación focus center and is beginning its 14th period.  During this time the members have been able to get to know each other well.

Each member has her own business, be it in production, sales or services.

The "Roca Fuerte" communal bank's organization is run by the board of directors which is comprised of the president, Mrs. Antonia, the treasurer, Mrs. Maritza and the secretary, Mrs. Maria.
 
The president, Mrs. Antonia, is 59 years old and lives with her husband and seven children.  She has an auto repair shop (brake parts) which she established because her son was knowledgeable in this area.  The business is four years old.  Her first loan was for US $100 which she used to buy a sewing machine for her first business.  With the current loan she plans to buy items for the repair shop.

When asked what she liked most about the lending institution the president responded saying it was the training and savings.

loans.use: To buy auto repair parts

loans.name: Banchani

texts.en:
Banchani is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for six years now and sells his milk, eggs and vegetables at the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family.

Banchani has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve their livelihood. He says that in the next five years he plans to have four dairy cows and a power saw.

Banchani is 33 years old and married with no children yet.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eudez

texts.es: Eudez, de 47 años, esta casada con Eduardo, con quien tiene 8 hijos, a los que cría en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años sembrando café, naranja y achiote. Lo que más le gusta de su labor son las épocas de cosecha, pues recoge con satisfacción los frutos que cuidó con mucho esmero. Asimismo su esposo trabaja en jornadas de trabajo en otros terrenos agrícolas obteniendo un dinero extra para su hogar. Ahora ellos se están preparando para la “rebusca” de la primera cosecha de café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura podrá obtener al aliado incondicional para el progreso de sus cultivos. Eudez, dentro de pocos días comenzará a cosechar los granos de café, por ello con el crédito está pensando contratar personal para que le ayuden en la recolección y en el limpiado de sus plantaciones de “achiote”.
texts.en: Eudez is 47 years old. She is married to Eduardo, with whom she has 8 children. She is raising them in the family home, located in the native community of Kivinaki (central Peruvian jungle). The work she does is farming, and she has been planting coffee, oranges and annato for 20 years. What she likes the most about her work is the harvest times, since she reaps the products she cared for so much with satisfaction. In addition, her husband works on other farmland, obtaining extra income for their home.  Now they are getting ready for the first coffee harvest. She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” [Almond Flower] community bank and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP, where she is certain she can have an unconditional ally for her crops' progress. In a few days, Eudez will start to harvest her coffee beans. Because of this, she is planning on hiring workers to help her in the picking and in clearing the annato plantings.

loans.use: To hire workers to to pick coffee and clear the annato plantings.

loans.name: Tircio Aurelio

texts.es:
El Sr. Tircio R. se dedica al comercio y su principal actividad es la venta de abarrotería, negocio el cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “MAICKOL” mismo que esta ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Su negocio luce surtido y se encuentra lo más necesario para el consumo diario.

El Sr. Tircio R. es un hombre con espíritu de trabajo, tambien tiene una fabrica de ladrillos y se a convertido en fuente de empleo en la aldea.
Don Tircio se ha sabido ganar la clientela por el buen servicio y atención que les brinda a sus clientes, su local es de un ambiente bonito, agradable e higiénico.

Don Tircio esta casado y junto a su esposa han procreado 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos y que en estos momentos están cursando los estudios secundarios, su esposa le ayuda en la administración de la pulpería cuando el no se encuentra en casa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mr. Tircio R. is a businessman, and his primary activity is selling groceries.  He operates the grocery store under the name "MAICKOL", and it is located in his home.   His business is well-stocked, and you can find all of the daily necessities.

Mr. Tircio R. is a man with a great work ethic.  He also has a brick factory which has become a source of employment in the small village.  Tircio has been able to win customers through good service and the attention that he gives them.  His store has a nice environment, friendly and clean.

Tircio is married and together with his wife has 2 dependent children who are currently in high school.  His wife helps him to manage the grocery store when he's not home.  

The loan will be used to buy merchandise to supply his store.

loans.use: to buy soups, pasta, milk, cereal, beef, pork, chicken, oil, shortening, margarine, toilet paper, cookies, sanitary napkins, mayonnaise, mustard, tomato sauce, bread, coffee, sodas, juices, soaps, bleach, sugar, rice, beans and tortillas

loans.name: Luzcetty Moserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Luzcetty, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 10 y 2 años, está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo, la mayor estudia en la escuela. El marido es comerciante, vende frutas y legumbres en el mercado de la ciudad.

Es una joven ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana en sus ventas ya que el resto de días trabaja en un restaurante en la cual le pagan un sueldo, sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y las cremas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, frutas y legumbres para el negocio del marido. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
The Dios Con Nosotros (God With Us) Community Bank gets together every 15 days in the Florón residential complex of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province which is known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.

Here is where we met Ms. Luzcetty, who is 22 years old and has a live-in partner and two daughters, ages 10 and 2. She is in her sixth month of pregnancy with her third child. Her eldest attends elementary school. Her husband is an entrepreneur who sells fruits and vegetables at the city market.

In order to obtain her own funds, this young homemaker sells Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and accessories for women). She sells these products only three days a week because she works in a restaurant the rest of the week. She accepts credit from her customers and bills them weekly. What she sells most are fragrances and lotions.

This loan is for purchasing fragrances, lotions, and cosmetics, as well as fruits and vegetables for her husband's business. This is her fourth loan cycle in the bank, and she likes it because it is so easy to make payments.

Her dream is to open up her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Baryagye

texts.en: Baryagye A. is a very hard-working and determined 40-year-old father of 2 children. He is a businessman buying and selling cows and bulls for meat, some of them after fattening. He has been in this business for some time now and is able to make 600,000 UGX monthly. He is happy that he sells to the people around his home and the neighboring areas. Baryagye also has another source of income whereby, at times, he sells produce. He needs a loan to be able to buy more bulls for resale.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for resale

loans.name: Abakiroziremu Ebirungi Kibyasi Group

texts.en: Emmanuel is 27 years old and married to a teacher. Together they have three children who are 7, 4 and 2 years old. He is the leader of Abakiroziremu EB. Kibyasi Group, which literally means "those who work together for the good of the nation". He lives in a semi-permanent house with his family of five people and his family goal is to build a permanent house and educate his children. For three years, he has been running a retail shop and he faces the challenge of defaulters. Emmanuel intends to use his loan to purchase sugar, salt and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt and paraffin to sell

loans.name: Bertha Elisa

texts.es:
Bertha  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Ella tiene estudios en educación primaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace un ciclo, su primer préstamo solicitado  fue  por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de  compra y venta de animales domésticos como ovino y vacuno.
Con éste nuevo préstamo por de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles comprará una vaca  para luego venderla, trabaja junto con su esposo.
Nos cuenta que  también se dedica a la chacra como papa, etc.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y crecer como empresaria.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la reunión y el compartir con las demás socias.

Nota: La foto muestra cierto brillo debido al intenso sol.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the community bank "Hermanas de Choquetanca II", located in the Ilave district in the El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 25 years old, married, and has a child.  She went to primary school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase and sale of domestic animals like sheep and cattle.

With this new loan for 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase a cow that she will later sell.  She works with her husband.  They also grow potatoes.

Her dream is to improve her business and grow as a businesswoman.  The things she likes best about the community bank are the meetings and sharing with other members.

Note: The picture is bright because of the intensity of the sun.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Eivert Mario

texts.es:
El señor Eivert Mario tiene 36 años de edad y vive en una casa de propiedad de él y de sus hermanos gracias a la herencia que les dejaron sus padres. Vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio Juan  de la ciudad deTarija. Eivert es padre de 1 hijo, a quien cuida y apoya en sus estudios, por circunstancias de la vida se separo de su esposa ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. Eivert se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años al servicio de topografo en una empresa constructora que prefieren ocupar sus servicios por ser una persona puntual y responsable. Por otro lado percibe ingresos por concepto de renta de taxi. Eivert quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hijo, pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar una línea de taxitrufi. Es por eso que ahora el crédito será destinado para la compra dicha línea. Que será de gran necesidad para realizar el transporte de pasajeros de esa forma poder incrementar sus ingresos que mucha falta le hacen.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Eivert nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Eivert Mario, 36, lives in a house that he and his siblings own thanks to an inheritance left to them by their parents.  This house is located in the city of Tarija’s Juan neighborhood.  Eivert is the father of a son who he cares for and supports his schooling.  Due to life’s circumstances, he separated from his wife and now he has to work to raise his son.  

For over three years Eivert has been employed as a Topographer by a construction firm that prefers to avail themselves of his services because he is a punctual and responsible person.  Additionally, however, he earns income leasing out a taxi.  Eivert wants to earn improved income through the taxi rental.  He wants better income in order to get ahead with his son.  He tells us that the opportunity to buy a cooperative taxi route has come up and this is what the loan would be used for.  This will be of great use to him to provide passenger transportation services and increase his income which he very much needs to do.

Eivert tells us that he wants to improve his vehicle’s condition so the next loan he will request will be to improve his vehicle’s condition.

loans.use: to buy a taxo route.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and is married with 11 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns an additional income from selling dried fish and other foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money, expand her business, and send her five children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s animal sales business. He buys young animals from the animal market and sells to the customers who require them, after raising them, at a good profit. His income becomes double on the Eid (Muslim holy day) because people buys animals for slaughter. At other times, he sells to butchers. 

With the loan, he will buy goats to be able to raise them and sell them for a good profit. He has been doing this business for many years and has got a good reputation among his clients for his good business sense and knowledge about animal breeds. 

Sardaran herself is a housewife but also supports her husband in taking care of his animals. She provides them timely food & water and keeps their stalls clean. She is hopeful that the loan investment will be a productive one for her husband. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo tiene 28 años, es un hombre responsable y trabajador. En armonía familiar convive con Eraida y su hijo Johan, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. A pesar de ser muy joven, tiene las ganas de triunfar y salir adelanta al igual que los integrantes de su asociación. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 6 años es la siembra de diferentes productos oriundos del lugar como: papa y arveja. Los que gracias al apoyo de su madre, quien le apoya en los cuidados que brinda, los puede comercializar en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el tiempo que le dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos, ya que puede aprender mucho más de las técnicas para lograr una cosecha de calidad. Ahora él tiene sembrado papa, por ello su principal prioridad es fertilizarlos. Ahora requiere de capital para incursionar en la ganadería, y así obtener un dinero extra, ya que así le aconsejaron en su banco comunal. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera logar sus objetivos con el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además se compromete en cumplir con todas sus cuotas. Hugo de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un “torete”, llamado así al Toro que tiene 12 meses de edad. Asimismo comprará sacos de abono orgánico para distribuirlos en sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “yungay” que cosechará dentro de unos meses.
texts.en:
Hugo, age 28, is a responsible and hard-working person.  He lives in familial harmony with his common-law wife, Eraid, and their son, Johan.  They live in their own house in a rural community in San Juan de la Libertad.

In spite of being very young, he has the desire to triumph and get ahead like the other members of his association.  For six years he has been growing different native products like potatoes and peas.  Thanks to his mother’s help in taking care of the plants, he is able to sell them at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  What he likes the most about his work is the time devoted to taking care of his crops.  By doing so he is able to learn a lot more about the techniques of achieving a quality harvest.  He has planted potatoes, and his first priority is to fertilize them.

He now needs a loan to enter the livestock business.  He will do this to get extra money.  This is what his communal bank advised him to do.  He belongs to the “Capital Semilla” (Seed Money) Communal Bank.  This is his second loan with MFP.  He hopes to achieve his objectives with help from all of you.  He pledges to make his payments on time.

Hugo will use the requested loan to buy a “torete”.  This is the name for a bull that is 12 months old.  He will also buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread on his crops of “Yungay” (round white potato good for boiling) potatoes, which he will harvest within a few months.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and a bull.

loans.name: Mwandiki

texts.en:
Mwandiki is aged 43 and has been in farming for the last 20 years producing and selling bananas, milk and coffee on the local market. He is married with two children aged 12 and 9 years. He has one farmhand.

Mwandiki has made a loan request amounting to 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says he will use the income generated to educate his children and repay the loan. He is also focusing on buying three more dairy cows in order to run a farm of five.

Mwandika laments poor weather conditions and animal diseases as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algunos años José se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, papel higiénico, atún, etc), su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos familiares.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar algunos acabados en el interior de su domicilio, para que tenga mayor seguridad para los suyos.  José es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old, he lives with his wife and children in his own house, equipped with water and light, which is located in Mórrope, a district of the Lambayeque department. In these areas people engage in agriculture, breeding and craftsmanship.

For the past few years, José has been engaging in selling basic necessities (milk, rice, oil, toilet paper, tuna and so on). He has established his shop in his own house for his own comfort and security. With the incomes he gains from selling his products he tries to pay for his family’s expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN in order to expand his shop: he will do some finishing jobs inside of his house in order to grant better security to his family. José is a responsible and hard-working man concerned with offering more life comforts to his family.

loans.use: To do some finishing jobs inside of his house.

loans.name: Bassirat

texts.fr:
Basirat est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un photographe. Elle a 2 enfants, qui vont tous à l l’école. Le premier a 11 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.  
Basirat travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle  revend du charbon de bois et des chaussures pour ses clients à son domicile. Elle travaille toute seule. 
Basirat a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois et des chaussures. Elle veut aussi commencer la vente de céréales. 
Dans les prochaines années, Basirat voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle pourra assurer une meilleure scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Basirat is a 41-year-old woman. She is married to a photographer. She has two children who all go to school. The first is 11 and the next is 8. Basirat has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells charcoal and shoes to her customers at her home. She works alone. Basirat has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal and shoes. She also wants to begin selling grains. In the coming years, Basirat would like to expand her business. She says that, with the profits, she will be able to ensure better schooling for her children.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and shoes

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “La Nueva Esperanza de Corcona” es un grupo formado por 10 personas trabajadoras y unidas que su único propósito es de seguir mejorando cada día, donde Félix es tesorero del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Félix tiene 55 años de edad es casado y tiene 04 hijos 03 de ellos en etapa escolar todavía, Felix  se inicio vendiendo comida ambulatoriamente, pero poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio y es así como decidió instalar su  restaurante pues el sabia  que obtendría mayores ganancias, donde  actualmente  brinda desayuno, almuerzo y cena, negocio familiar que le a permitido apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y aportar con los gastos del hogar. Para el futuro a Félix le gustaría agrandar su restaurante y mejorarlo ya que nos comenta que solo es de material pre-fabricado. Con el   crédito que ha  solicitado lo va a invertir en la compra de  insumos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, aceite, entre otros. Félix junto a la Alcancía Comunal “La Nueva Esperanza de Corcona” están muy agradecidos con los préstamos brindados ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Nueva Esperanza de Corcona [New Hope of Corcona] is a group made up of 10 hard-working and united individuals whose sole purpose is to keep improving every day. 

Felix is the group's treasurer, a post he has carried out with responsibility. Felix is 55 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. Felix started as a food street vendor, but little by little his business grew and so he decided to set up a restaurant. He knew that he would make a greater profit by offering breakfast, lunch and dinner as he does now. The family business has allowed him to support his children in their studies and contribute to household expenses. 

In the future Felix would like to expand and improve his restaurant; he mentions that it's only made of prefabricated material. With the loan that he has requested, Felix will purchase consumable products like rice, pasta, sugar, and oil, among other things. Felix and the communal bank La Nueva Esperanza de Corcona are very grateful for the loan they've been offered, as it makes progress possible for them.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, sugar, oil.

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Batkhuyag, 25, works as a watchman in a public organization. He lives with his two children and his wife in Kherlen, a town in the Dornod province of Mongolia. He has been doing this job since 2008 and this April he bought a car with his savings. When he has days off, he runs a taxi business, earning additional income which is important for the daily expenses of his family.

Now, he needs to build a garage behind his home due to the breakage his car faces in the winter time. Mongolian winters are freezing cold and this badly affects cars. Therefore, Batkhuyag is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to build a garage for his taxi car.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials to build a garage for his taxi car.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст 69 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а старшая дочь уехала в Россию на заработки. Сам Абдурашид предоставляет услугу. Он работает парикмахером в мужском салоне. В этой области он уже 40 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения кресла и аксессуаров.
texts.en: Abdurashid lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 69 years old, married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker and his oldest daughter went to work in Russia. Abdurashid provides a service. He works as a barber in a men's hair salon. He has been in this business for 40 years. He is taking out the loan to buy a chair and accessories.

loans.use: to buy a chair and accessories.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
This is Anatalia, 49, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband, John, is a driver and the couple has two children, both in elementary school. Anatalia, her husband and children manage their household while operating the business. Anatalia works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Anatalia operates a variety store, which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Anatalia earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Anatalia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anatalia hopes her business will be stable and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 43-year-old single woman, living and working in Ain. Saada opened a  grocery store three years ago to secure her living and to prove to her neighbors that a single woman can make her own living through a small business, that by her enthusiasm and hard work she can turn to a very important business that can provide her with life’s necessities, in  order not to ask for others' help since the government doesn’t take any interest in elderly people. So, Saada is thinking about her future life, and how she has to make her own living. 

That’s why she requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to increase her shop’s merchandise with the necessary autumn-winter products highly requested during these seasons, since transportation in these two seasons becomes hard, so most villagers prefer to buy from a nearby grocery shop than heading to a faraway mall. This helps in improving her business during these season and it’s almost the same during the summer season since most of the citizens come to spend the summer season in their beloved village.

Saada hopes to expand her business more and more in the future. She hopes to keep her shop updated with all newly released products.

loans.use: To expand her shop’s merchandise.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah lives in the coastal town of Changamwe. He runs a battery charging and repair business, which has been in operation for four years. Besides this, he runs a salon business. He is married and has one child who has not joined school.  

He joined Milango in May of this year and repaid his first loan well. Since he also repairs batteries, he has decided to apply for a loan of KSH 40,000 in order to purchase battery repair raw materials.

The income from this loan will help Josiah provide for his family's needs and start saving for his child’s future education. He looks forward to be a new battery dealer in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase battery repair equipment

loans.name: Yuuya Shg Group

texts.en:
Rose is the facilitator of the Yuuya SHG group. Rose and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to eradicate poverty and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Yuuya SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Rose is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives with her six children who are 20, 18, 15, 14, 12 and 8 years old. Razia runs a store where she sells basic household products. She has been in this business for many years. All her neighbors and friends from her area are customers. 

Her husband has a dairy business that provides him a decent income every month.   

Razia is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy oil, lentils, rice, spices, etc. This purchase will increase her stock and will help her to improve her customer service. 

Razia’s aspiration is to improve her business’s financial conditions, so she can provide better living facilities for her children and make them successful in their lives.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock for grocery store business

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence, a 49-year-old married father of three children, lives in Hioma, Uganda where he has been a primary school teacher for 22 years. His personal goal is to educate his children, and his business goal is to complete the construction of his rental houses.Faced with the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, Lawrence is requesting a loan to complete building his rental houses.

loans.use: to complete building his rental houses.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con sus hijos, ella administra en su hogar una tienda de productos domésticos, sus hijos le ayudan para atender a los clientes, tiene 6 años de estar en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia y hoy está bien establecido.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como plásticos, comestibles como pastas, aceite, harina, embutidos, pan, huevos, con esta compra estará surtiendo de variedad el negocio y con la posibilidad de generar más ingresos.
Su objetivo es por medio de los préstamos, poder diversificar el negocio y atender a los clientes de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her children. She runs a store with home products out of her house. Her children help her tend to the customers. She’s had this business for 6 years. It came into being from her own initiative and today it’s well-established. 

She asks for a loan to buy merchandise like plastic products and food like pasta, oil, flour, sausages, bread, and eggs. With this purchase she will have a lot of variety in her stock and the possibility to earn more income. 

Her goal is to use the loans to diversify the business and better serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, pasta, oil, flour, sausages, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.
 
Mary Jane has a tailoring shop that makes and sells office and school uniforms and dresses. She has had this business for nine years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring.

Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for tailoring.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 30 years. She describes herself as a polite woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells tomatoes, cabbages and bananas. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located near a murram (gravel) road and her primary customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of sources of obtaining cabbages during the sunny season. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cabbages. Hellan's business goal is to be a wholesaler of cabbages within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more cabbages.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with four children, aged 20, 13, 9 and 6.

Ramon has been a farmer for five years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Ramon works hard to feed his family and send his children to school. He requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ramon hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest.

In the future, Ramon hopes for his children to finish their studies and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Leh We Try Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Leh We Try group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve upon their living conditions. 

Isata is the featured leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a trader and they have four children. Isata has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells market food – rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, margi, tomatoes, etc. in wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Isolina Del Rosario

texts.es:
Isolina tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la provincia de Morropón, ubicada en la región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. Es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio y cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz.

Ella se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas, actividad que realiza hace más de 03 años, contando con experiencia en el negocio y con clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado, para posterior engorde y venta de la carne, con esto Isolina espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isolina is 48 years old, single and lives in the province of Morropón, located in the region of Piura in the north coast of Perú. The people living in this place are dedicated to agriculture, stockbreeding and commerce, and the town has basic services such as water and electricity. 

She sells red meats, an activity that she has performed for the last three years. She has a lot of experience in this business and a loyal clientele who give good personal and work references of her. 

The loan will be used to buy more cattle for fattening, and afterwards sell the meat. With this she hopes to offer more variety of products to her customers, and have a positive impact in her incomes and improve hers and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening and sale of meat.

loans.name: Lisie

texts.es:
La Señorita Lisie es de la ciudad de Itá, ella está estudiando la carrera de medicina, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a las personas que necesitan atención en su salud.
Ella está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder convertirse en alguien que sea útil no solo para si mismo, sino también para los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.

loans.use: Pagar gastos de titulacion.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana Harrison is part owner and manager of Boomerang Creek Café, which is located on the south east coast of Upolu. As can be seen in the photo, this is one of the main tourist areas in Samoa as it is located near some of the best beaches. Ana is pictured in front of some of the beach hut accommodation which she has used her loans to help build. In the background can be seen the beach and Pacific Ocean. On the other side of the road can be found the café which sits above the road but above very steep cliffs and waterfalls. The café includes an open entertainment which is used for Samoan dancing on the weekends, group functions during the week and on Thursdays Ana runs a bingo game for the local women. Bingo is very popular in Samoa.

Ana is one of the leaders of her village lending group in Saleapaga. Some of the other members also run beach hut businesses further down the road. Ana has been very instrumental in helping and supporting the women in her village and is a role model for them.

She is pictured wearing a pouletasi which is a traditional style of Samoan dress, usually hand sewn.

loans.use: Purchase building supplies

loans.name: Mary Afor

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Mary is married and has four children. The pain of seeing her children sent away from school for lack of books or school fees, and the absence of formal credit facilities, motivated her, as she puts it, to “take advantage of the services provided by GHAPE at my door steps”. She is a third-time borrower. With her two previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with cooked food. She is proud of having repaid her previous loans and acquired skills in credit management.

Given a loan of $200, she plans to buy pots, cups, plats, spoons and country fowls. Her location will provide her with a comparative advantage in providing cooked food to her immediate community. Her immediate goals are to build skills to manage bigger loans and to provide for her family.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling cooked food

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un C. is a mother of 2 children and is 22 years old who lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She looks after her young aged children and cook meal for her family. To supplement the family's income, C.'s husband is talent and has experienced for ages in painting, which he makes around $3.5/day.Due to a great demand of his clients, C.'s husband is asking for the loan to purchase extra paints and other paintbrushes, so it enables him to maximize his painting size and makes more additional income for his entire family. In the future, her husband hopes to save enough money to own a painting shop near a market, where he is able to increase his savings.

loans.use: To purchase some paints and other paint brushes for a business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her paint business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela C. T. is a businesswoman who knows the value of diversification in her income streams. She traditionally has made and sold ice cream products such as helados, Gelatinas, and choco covered bananas. She realizes selling these kinds of foods has had limited opportunity for her so she is taking out this loan with Friendship Bridge to expand into selling men’s and women’s casual clothing. She will use the loan to buy new clothing and resell it in the local market. She is strongly committed to providing a complete selection of desirable clothing to please her customers.

Her dream of growing this business little bit by little bit is now becoming a reality. She feels very satisfied that she now has the resources to work hard at her new business, which will result in improved quality of life for herself and her family. She can develop a growing business and pay off the loan simultaneously, a reality that signifies her dreams are being realized. She is very pleased with her prospects for the future.

Her personal life has its ups and downs. She is 51 years, she is married and has 7 children ranging in age from 17 to 32 years. Although she cannot read or write she knows the importance of education. She is committed to insuring that the two youngest ones living at home complete their studies. One is currently studying technical drawing and the other one is a student in high school. Currently her health is her biggest challenge. She suffers from gall bladder problems, for which she is currently undergoing treatment. However, the trips to the National Hospital in Chimaltenango for the operations take much out of her because the two-hour ride by “chicken bus” over a bumpy dirt road is quite painful.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase women's and men's casual clothing for resale

loans.name: Atália António

texts.pt:
Atália António M. is a 34-year-old married mother of 2. She lives in the Mahotas neighborhood and runs a used clothing business on the Praça dos Combatentes plaza in Maputo. She is new to the program and is taking on an initial loan of 3,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Atália António M. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de dois filhos. Vive no bairro Mahotas e tem um negócio de venda de roupa usada na Praça dos Combatentes em Maputo. É nova no programa e vai tomar um empréstimo inicial de 3000MT para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 25 years of age. She lives in Papaigalagala Center. She has three children, who are all in school. She joined SPBD in order to start her ice cream business. Her business is the main source of income for her family. They all now rely on what she earns. She sells the ice cream she makes seven days a week. She earns $60 WST ($24 USD) a day.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment and tools (Compra de equipo y herramientas)

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long C., 38, is a housewife who lives with her husband and three school-aged children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Her husband works as a construction foreman and generally earns about $7 each day. This money is used for family expenses.  Mrs. Long C. hopes to apply this loan of $800 to the purchase of construction tools for her husband to facilitate his works.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her husband to facilitate his works.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth is a member of the communal bank located in the district of Calleria. She is 33 years old, and happily married. She has one child.

She currently owns a restaurant, where she offers breakfast and lunch. She wakes up early to go to the marketplace and buys ingredients need to make food.

With her upcoming loan she hopes to buy bulks of: sugar, chicken, fish, meat, spices, vegetables, oils, tables, plates and utensils.

Lizbeth is a hardworking woman. She hopes to increase her sales and make her restaurant a great success.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lizbeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Juntas Hasta el Final, ubicado en la Av. Alfonso Ugarte 683, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años es casada, tiene un hijo.

En la actualidad tiene un restaurante, donde ofrece desayunos y almuerzos, se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los víveres que necesitara para la preparación de sus comidas, con la ayuda de empleados realizan la preparación de las comidas, por las tardes descansa para la faena del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, pollo, pescado, carne de res, condimentos, verduras, aceite, mesas, platos, cubiertos.

Lizbeth es una mujer muy trabajadora y con las ganancias obtenidas agrandara su restaurante y también ofrecerá otros tipos de platos para todos los gustos.

loans.use: Products for making her restaurant's meals.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo lives in zone “14 de septiembre” in the city of La Paz. He owns a workshop located at the center of the city where he manufactures footwear for men and women. He lives with his son who is also dedicated to the same activity. The loan will be spent on buying material (leather, rubber studs, etc.) in order to continue manufacturing footwear as demand has been growing. This is the second loan with Impro, and the evaluation made qualifies him for the loan. The previous loan of $150 was repaid with no problems in four months.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Bernardo vive en la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene un taller ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad donde elabora calzados para damas y varones. Vive junto a su hijo el cual trabaja en la misma actividad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material (cuero, tacos de goma, etc.) para continuar elaborando calzados ya que es una actividad que tiene mucha demanda. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. El préstamo anterior fue de $us 150 y a solo cuatro meses de plazo y fue cancelado sin problemas.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for the manufacturing of footwear for men and women.

loans.name: Donah Tusiime`s Group

texts.en:
Dona is the leader of 5 members. She is aged 25 and married with 1 child who goes to school. He is 5 years old. She is servicing her first loan. She resides in a slum area, which is vulnerable to flooding when it rains.

She sells cosmetics in one of the taxi parks in the city center of Kampala. She has done this for 2 years.

The main challenges include the effects of weather on her and on what she sells, although she does it under an umbrella. Some of the cosmetics react with the heat and they become poisonous. Some of them look like old stock after a short time and clients reject them. The taxes levied by the authorities push the high prices yet higher. She would like to move to a shop.

loans.use: To move to a shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with four children. All of her children are currently in school. She treks to the nearby villages to buy foodstuffs like gari (milled and fried cassava), maize and cocoyams and then retails them in the local market. Due to an inadequate supply of foodstuffs, there is high demand in the market that has created a good business environment for Elizabeth. Unfortunately, high transport costs do not allow Elizabeth to purchase in large quantities. Elizabeth would like to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs to increase her inventory. She is a member of the group Humbleness. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bags of gari (milled and fried cassava), maize and cocoyam

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Johana del Socorro is 32 years old and lives in the René Cisneros neighborhood. She is a single mother who wants to offer her child and herself better quality of life.

She is a shopkeeper. She has a convenience store in her home which has been growing over the years, thanks to her good and organized management. At times, however, the lack of capital has made it difficult for her to offer a large inventory.

Her father gave her the financial support with which she started the business. Her future plans are to expand the business by offering a wider range of products. With the loan she will buy basic grains, cosmetics and clothing, all of which which help her increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Johana del Socorro tiene 32 años de edad, habita en el barrio René Cisneros es madre soltera de un menor de edad, al que desea darles las mejores condiciones de vida.

Es comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación la que ha ido creciendo a través de los años, gracias a su buena y ordenada administración, aunque a veces se le dificulta por falta de capital para poder agrandar su inventario.

Su papá la apoyó económicamente para poder montar el negocio. Sus planes futuros son ampliar el negocio con una gama más grande de productos.Con el préstamo comprará granos básicos, cosméticos y ropa para tener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: To invest in basic grains, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Juana Petronila

texts.es:
Juana is 46 years old and is separated from her spouse. She completed the first part of an accounting degree, but left the program when she got married. Juana has two daughters: one works while the other is in school.

Juana used to work in a cobbler’s workshop. Because she had to work all day and didn’t have anyone to take care of her daughters, she decided to work for herself in her own business. Now she sells food out of her house in Laredo District, Trujillo Province in La Libertad state. Seeing she lacked capital, Juana decided to become a member of the Mercado Modelo Community Bank. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. She used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase a kitchen for her business.

With a loan of 1,200 soles [about US $ 425], which will be paid back in six months, Juana plans to purchase one sack of potatoes, oil, rice, pasta, vegetable stock, etc. Juana’s goal is to start a business selling artisan goods from Chulucanas, a town in northern Peru, in the state of Piura. According to Juana, her house once had no floor, but she has been able to upgrade her house thanks to the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Juana Petronila, actualmente está separada, tiene 46 años, estudió I ciclo de la carrera de contabilidad, no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 2 hijas, 1 trabaja y 1 estudia.

La empresaria trabajaba en un taller de calzado, pero ella laboraba todo el día y no había quien cuide a sus hijas, entonces decidió trabajar en un negocio propio como es la venta de comida en su casa en el Distrito de Laredo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, pero como no tenía capital es cuando decide integrarse al Banco Comunal “Mercado Modelo”, tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró 1 cocina para el negocio.

Con el crédito de S/. 1,200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 6 meses tiene pensado comprar 01 saco de papas, aceite, arroz, tallarín, menestras, etc. La socia tiene como meta tener un negocio de venta de artesanía de Chulucanas, un poblado ubicado al norte de nuestro País en el Departamento de Piura. Ella cuenta que antes su casa no tenía piso y que gracias a las ganancias que obtienen ha ido mejorando su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Estefania Lesly

texts.es:
Estefanía vive en la avenida Unión  Fátima  de la zona villa Cooperativa  en la ciudad de El Alto. Junto a su madre y sus hermanos, ella es soltera.
Actualmente continua sus estudios,  también se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza por lo cual recibe un porcentaje sobre ventas.  Las ganancias son invertidas en la compra de material de estudio  

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería con el fin de aumentar  sus ganancias
 
Es su primer  crédito en Impro, es una colegiala pero a su edad ya es bastante emprendedora y por lo tanto se debe fomentar a esta persona
texts.en:
Estefanía lives on Unión Fátima Avenue in the Villa Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto with her mother and siblings. She is single. At present, she is continuing with her studies. She also sells beauty products, for which she receive a percentage of the sales. The earnings are invested into the purchase of materials for school. Estafanía will use this loan to buy merchandise with the goal of increasing her earnings. This is her first loan with Impro. She is a schoolgirl, but at her age, she is already quite enterprising and, as a result, you should support her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita V. Ramírez tiene hijos grandes los cuales ya necesitan su propia recamara para la privacidad de cada uno. La Señora primero con el préstamo va hacer la construcción de un cuarto en la parte de atrás y en caso de completar hará su proyecto en la parte alta. Su casa es de INFONAVIT una dependencia de Gobierno las cuales son iguales todas y muy pequeñas pero ella recurre a nosotros para ampliarla a su gusto. Solicita la cantidad de $600 dólares. 
Juanita V. trabaja de secretaria con un Licenciado, su esposo en una maquiladora de la ciudad y también su hijo que vive con ella trabaja  en una guarecería de asistente para ayudarla en sus gastos con estos ingresos pagaran el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Juanita V. Ramirez has children who are at the age where they need their own room for their privacy. She will first use the loan for the construction of one room in the back of where she lives, and if they finish that project with money left over they will start the construction of another room on top of their home. The home is subsidized by the organization INFONAVIT, which part of a government program, and Juanita has come to our organization in order to get help to increase her families standard of living with a loan of $600 dollars. Juanita V. works as a secretary for a Lawyer, and her husband works in a factory in the city. Her son that lives with her also works as an assistant in a shelter in order to help out with expenses, and with all of these incomes they will be able to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a new room

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy H., 34, and her husband, Mr. Phalla Mok, 42, were married in 1990 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. All of them study in a local school.

Chanthy has been a tailor for five years, a skill she learned in 1995. Her husband has been farming for eighteen years, a skill he learned from his parents when he was young. The couple hopes that in the future they will be able to set up one grocery store at their home to earn an extra income.

Now, Chanthy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one more sewing machine and one plowing machine for her husband's farming.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine and one plowing machine for her husband's farming.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 6 femmes (deux veuves et quatre mariées), le groupe Benkadi de l’association Benkelema de Yangasso (préfecture de San quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) ont en moyenne 50 ans,  5 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec les coépouses et autres parents. 
Elles mènent les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments alimentaires et la préparation vente des plats alimentaires.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de riz, de haricots  (pour la restauration), des sacs d’oignons, des bidons d’huiles alimentaires  et divers condiments destinés à la vente. Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement au grand marché de Yangasso auprès des commerçants grossistes pour les condiments alimentaires et quant aux céréales sèches auprès des paysans producteurs des villages environnants.
Elles vendent les condiments alimentaires devant la porte de leur maison nuit et jour, et pour la restauration elles ont des gargotes au marché de Yangasso.
Elles comptent réaliser chacune en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group from the Benkelema association in Yangasso (the prefecture of San - the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) is made up of six women (two widows and four wives). On average these women are 50 years old, have five children each and live in traditional extended families with their husbands and other relatives. They buy and sell condiments, and prepare and sell meals. In order to grow their business activities, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva partner) loan program two years ago. The total amount borrowed has risen from 50,000 FCFA for the first loan to 100,000 FCFA for the fourth loan. All previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid. The current loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice and beans (for the catering), sacks of onions, cans of cooking oil and various condiments to sell. They buy their stock of condiments mainly from wholesalers at the large market in Yangasso and they buy the dried grains from farmers in the nearby villages. They sell the condiments in front of their houses both night and day, and for the catering they have small luncheonettes in the Yangasso market. They reckon on each making an average profit of 100,000 FCFA per cycle, which will be used to repay the loan interest and cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and grain

loans.name: Mr. San Preab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of eight people is located in Slaeng village in Kandal province. Mr. San P. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. He is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Since his fields are both far from an irrigation system, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water his field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Srey Phorn, is a housewife who cooks for the family. This couple lives together without any children.

One member in this village bank loan has applied for an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term (EoT) loan is AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a pump to bring water to his fields.

loans.name: Klara

texts.en:
Klara is married with two grown-up children. She sells decoration articles and souvenirs at a market in Beregovo city. Her profit is about 3,500 UAH per month.

Klara has been in this business for 5 years. She offers her customers good quality products at affordable prices. Good location and a large assortment are keys to Klara's business success.

Klara would like to receive a loan of 7,000 UAH to increase her inventory. Her goal is to develop this business even more and attract even more customers.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Mitsi Esther

texts.es:
MITSI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” ubicado en la Av. Alfonso Ugarte n° 830, puesto 79 del Mercado de Bellavista en el distrito de Callería, tiene 26 años de edad, 1 hijo, su esposo es técnico electricista.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró harinas al por mayor (plátano, soya, maíz suave, maca), maní, achote guisador, comino en grano, especerías, embutidos, vende paquetes de 250gr. las harinas que ella misma envasa  en su puesto del mercado, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 4 sacos de harina (maca, plátano, soya, maíz, etc.) canela 3Kg., pimienta y comino 2Kg de cada uno, achote 1Kg, palillo 1Kg, para aumentar su venta 
  Ella está  muy contenta con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo, gracias a ello su negocio crece cada vez más.
texts.en:
Monica Lizbeth is a member of the Banco Comunal (Communal Bank) Las Triunfadoras, located on Av. Alfonso Ugarte n° 830, post 79 in the Bellavista Market in the Callería district. She is 26, and has one child. Her husband is an electrician. The first loan she received was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought flour (banana, soy, soft corn, maca) wholesale, as well as peanuts, achote, cumin, spices, and sausages. She sells 250g packages that she wraps herself in her market post. She gets up very early to attend her customers. With this new S/. 1,500 Nuevos Soles loan, she will purchase 4 bags of flour (maca, banana, soy and corn), 3 kg of cinnamon, 2 kg each of pepper and cumin, 1 kg of achote, 1 kg of turmeric in order to increase her sales. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support. Thanks to her, her business is growing.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 bags of flour (maca, banana, soy and corn), 3 kg of cinnamon, 2 kg each of pepper and cumin, 1 kg of achote, 1 kg of turmeric

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Luisa P. se dedica a laborar en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde a diario lleva a cabo su actividad de venta de chinelas de diferentes estilos y para todas las edades.

Se ha destacado por vender bonitos modelos de chinelas y por este motive es muy visitada por sus clientes que a diario la visitan. Ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de dichas chinelas y por esto su anhelo es que su solicitud sea aprobada y así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa P. works in the La Terminal Market in the city of León. Every day she works selling sandals and slippers in different styles, for people of all ages. She has distinguished herself by selling attractive styles, which is why she is sought out by her clients. She has requested support from Ceprodel to help purchase the sandals and slippers and hopes that her application will be approved so that she can progress with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Luisa es casada tiene 50 años, tres hijos de 29, 24 y 18 años, ellos trabajan.
Ella tiene familia en el norte y le animaron a  que vendiera  en Lima, así es  como empezó, ahora trae zapatos  del norte y los vende por docenas para algunas tiendas. Han pasado cinco años y le va muy bien. 
Luisa necesita un crédito de 1200 soles para comprar zapatos, sandalias de cuero que trae del norte del país.
Desde que esta en Finca, le va muy bien, lo préstamos le han ayudado mucho, y las charlas que ha recibido en el Bancomunal también.  
El sueño de Luisa es tener una tienda de zapatos.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Amigas Unidas Communal Bank. Luisa is 50 years of age and married. She has three children ages 29, 24, and 18, all of whom are working. Members of her family in the north encouraged her to try selling in Lima, so that's how she began. Now she brings shoes from the north and sells them by the dozen to various stores. She's been doing this for five years now and it's going very well. Luisa needs a loan of 1,200 Sols in order to buy shoes, leather sandals that she brings from the north of the country. Since she's been with FINCA Peru, things have gone well for her. The loans she has received have helped a lot, and the talks she participates in at the Communal Bank have also been helpful. Luisa's dream is to have a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather sandals.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells foodstuffs like bags of rice and groundnut oil. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Ann is 32 years old, and she is married with 5 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Шаходат-женщина 47-ми лет,замужем,имеет двоих детей.Она начала свой бизнес с одного маленкого стола,который ставила возле входа в вещевой рынок.Её мужу Икрому пришлось уехать на заработки в Россию,где заработав небольшую сумму он решил вложить в бизнес своей жены.Сейчас они имеют хорошее место в самом центре вещевого рынка.На полученный кредит Шаходат решила привезти из Истаравшана сезонный товар и этим расширить свой ассортимент.До осени она решила накопить намного денег на учёбу своего сына.
texts.en:
Shahodat is a 47-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. She started her business with one small table that she placed near the clothing market entrance. Her husband had to go to Russia for work, where he earned a small sum of money and decided to invest it in his wife’s business. They now have a store right in the center of the clothing market. Shahodat wants to use this loan to bring in seasonal goods from Istaravshan and expand her assortment. Before autumn, she decided to save some money to use for her son’s education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding goods assortment

loans.name: Atsa Adoté

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur était un déclarant en douane, mais comme le revenu de cette activité ne lui permettait pas de couvrir ses charges, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées et de pneus. Il a commencé ce commerce en 2007 et s’approvisionne au marché local du port de Lomé, son stock de pneus est épuisé, il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 40 pneus.
Il est veuf et a 03 personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
This gentleman used to be a customs agent, but since the income from it did not allow him to support himself, he got started in the commerce of spare parts and tires. He started this business in 2007 and supplies himself at the local marketplace of the port of Lomé. With his stock of tires exhausted, he would like to stock up again and is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 40 tires. He is a widower and has three people in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai C., 29, was married in 1999. She has three children: two daughters and one son. Two of them are in school and the other one is still young. The family lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sokhai has been a silk weaver for fourteen years; it’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then take them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es: Patricia Guadalupe L. D. C. vive en Tenancingo el departamento D. Cuscatlán junto a su esposo Ernesto y sus dos hijas Guadalupe D. 9 años D. edad y Adamaris D. 2 años D. edad. El esposo D. patricia trabaja como albañil y da un aporte mensual D. 100$ a la familia; Patricia también trabaja ya que es ella quien monto y actualmente dedica tiempo para atender su negocio que es un tienda con variedad D. productos ubicada en su casa, Patricia solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir su tienda con mercadería que es solicitada por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia Guadalupe L. D. C. lives in Tenancingo, in the department of Cuscatlán, with her husband Ernesto and their two daughters, Guadalupe, who is 9 years old, and Adamaris, who is 2 years old. Patricia’s husband works as a mason and provides the family with $100 per month. Patricia also works because she took the initiative to open a business, which is small store with a variety of products in her house. Patricia is requesting this loan because she wants to stock her store with merchandise that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao Y. lives in Khsom Village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

In this plantation, Mrs. Mao Y. faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to build a cow stall for her cow-breeding.

Mrs. Mao Y. is a 41-year-old mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Yim Sokhim, is a laborer who is a hard working man. Her husband is on her right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field

loans.name: Luz Olivia

texts.en:
Luz engages in two different business ventures.  She has a fruit stand next to the lake of Yarinacocha, the small town where she lives.  Luz also purchases fish from small fishing communities along the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the nearby city of Pucallpa and joins the Amazon to the north.  Luz takes several-day-long trips upriver with a cooler and a bunch of ice to keep the fish fresh.  Upon return she sells everything she has purchased at the port of Pucallpa.  Luz sets up her fruit stand during holiday periods and in the winter when the river is high and purchasing fish becomes more difficult.  

Luz has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years.  She hopes to invest this loan of 1000 soles in the purchase of more fish and fruits for her business ventures.  She will also save some of the loan to ensure that she can make all of her payments on time.    

Luz is 48 years old and is a single mother of three adult children (ages 25, 27 and 29).  Although all of her children live with her, none is still dependent on her.  Luz also has three grandchildren.  

According to Luz, things have gone very well for her working with Manuela Ramos.  Her credit has helped her a lot.  Her goal is to keep working and continue to expand her business ventures.  She hopes to someday purchase her own small passenger boat.  In this way, her son could have a job as its driver and Luz would not have to pay for her transport upriver on her fish-purchasing trips. 

Luz is pictured here at her fruit stand around the time of Peru's Independence Day holiday.  The lake of Yarinacocha is in the background.

loans.use: Fruits and fish for sale

loans.name: Oghale

texts.en: Oghale is 36yrs old and married with 6 children. She lives in warri with her family. She sells fruits and she has been in business for the past 16 years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fruits to sell. Thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem E. raises at least two lot of pig a season from her home to earn a living. She, 48, is the determined mother who tries to earn money in order to ensure her five children to obtain the highest educations. Her husband’s name is Ngoun Touch, 49 years old taxi driver.
