Additionally, she will be using this loan as capital to buy a cow which allows to her husband uses to pick up carving wood from the forest to sell. Sem E. was not available taking photo so her son appears in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Time Is Money Group

texts.en: Monica is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Monica is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Time is money. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Louer un atelier et acheter d’autres machines à coudre

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai G. was born in the village of Gbonkolenken, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 45 years old. Abudlai’s wives sell food at the market. His first wife has been a business woman for seven years; his other wife has spent three years in the world of business. Abdulai has 13 children between the ages of 3 and 25. All of his children, except the youngest, attend school.

Abdulai is seeking a loan of about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone Leone (SLL). Part of the loan will be invested in his wives’ businesses and part will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To invest in his family's food-selling business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer Q. is a village store owner. She is married to Noel, who cultivates their small farm lot by planting rice and some vegetables. Due to the high cost of commodities, Jennifer wants to acquire more products, but she cannot do so because she lacks business capital. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP. She will use the money to purchase more goods to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her small store and earn a higher income.

Jennifer is 22 years old and resides in a peaceful village in Barangay Baculud Iguig, Cagayan. She has only one child to support. She sacrifices her time to support the needs of her child, especially in providing their family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Wasim

texts.en: Wasim is a 30-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Wasim has been selling and producing aluminum since 2000. Wasim requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase an aluminum machine. This machine will help him cut the aluminum in a better and more precise way. This is the first time that Wasim has requested a loan. Wasim is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the required tools. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase an aluminum machine.

loans.name: Tum-Leh Group

texts.en:
Bigger Boy K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Tum-Leh. He is 52 years old and is married with 16 children aged 10 to 38 years old. Their educational levels range from sixth grade to university. He also cares for 2 siblings. He dropped out of school in ninth grade due to lack of financial support.

Bigger Boy and his family live in the Palala community, a few kilometers from Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. His business is sales of general goods. He buys general goods at wholesale prices and sells them at retail prices to residents of his community. Bigger Boy has been running this business for 10 years, and is hoping to improve the business by establishing a store.

He has been facing difficulties with getting financial support to improve his business. Bigger Boy has a good relationship with his customers and this encourages them to keep patronizing his business.

He needs this loan to purchase more goods for his little shop to improve his business. Bigger Boy dreams of giving his family the best help he can in order to give them a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde D., 58 years old, has a sari-sari store and a farm. She wants to grow the size of her business in order to augment her family's income to support their daily needs. She has two adult children. She has been waiting for an opportunity to increase her capitalization so that she could venture onto other businesses.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will really help in buying additional merchandise for her sari-sari store and farm supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mrs. Nangheng Ann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village-bank loan consists of 11 members who all receive different individual loans. Mrs. NanghE. A. is the village-bank president. She lives in Daeum Pring village in the Kandal province. 

Mrs. NanghE. A. and her husband, Mr. Vean S., are farmers who own a plot of land on which to cultivate rice for their living. They have four children, two of whom are laborers in a garment factory and two of whom are studying at a public school near their home. 

Although this couple tries to work hard in their field, they still do not have enough rice yield to support their family. Thus, Mrs. NanghE. A. decided to apply for a third loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 4 Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is the coordinator of her group, Plan de Lucha (Plan to Fight!), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, where the economy is based primarily around agriculture, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner  and their five children.

Hilaria is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado, or corner store, by purchasing the basics products that her clients expect to find such as rice, beans, cooking oil and powdered milk. She will use the profits to invest in her children's education and continuing to grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more veterinary drugs

loans.name: Las Amigas De Tlane Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA LAS AMIGAS DE TLANE YA QUE SON MUY ALLEGADAS  Y TODAS HAN VIVIDO EN TLALNEPANTLA DESDE QUE NACIERON. LAS INTEGRANTES Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON ELENA E. QUE TIENE UN TAXI, FELIPA C. SE DEDICA A VENDER AGUACATES, DURAZNOS EN LA CD DE MEXICO.  ANABEL  Z., MARIA CONCEPCION R., FELIPA F., ALBERTA A. SE DEDICAN A LA PRODUCCION DEL NOPAL.


LA SRA. ELENA ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO. ESTA CASADA Y TIENE UN NIÑO DE 1 AÑO SE LLAMA DIEGO ALDAIR. ELLA QUIERE INVERTIR MAS EN SU TAXI YA QUE SIEMPRE POR UNA U OTRA COSA  SE DESCONPONE Y ASI PODERLO ARREGLAR  Y QUE YA NO LES FALLE Y ASI PODER TRABAJAR Y SACAR MAS GANANCIAS.


CON ESTE CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR ACEITES, ANTICONGELANTES, LLANTAS, REFACCIONES. LA META QUE ELLA TIENE A FUTURO ES SALIR ADELANTE JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO PARA PODER DARLE A SU HIJO LO QUE NECECITE.
ELENA NOS COMENTA QUE SE SIENTE MUY AGUSTO CON SU GRUPO YA QUE SE CONOCEN DESDE HACE MUCHO TIEMPO Y SE SIENTEN CONTENTAS DE QUE EXISTAN EMPRESAS COMO KIVA Y FUNDACION REALIDAD  PARA AYUDAR A LAS PERSONAS A SACAR SU NEGOCIO ADELANTE.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Amigas de Tlane” (The Friends of Tlane) because they are close-knit and have all lived in Tlanepantla since birth. The members are involved in the following business activities:

• Elena E. has a taxi. • Felipa C. sells avocados and peaches in Mexico City. • Anabel Z., Maria Concepcion R., Felipa F., and Alberta A. prepare “nopales” (the edible leaves of the prickly pear cactus).

Sra. Elena is the group representative. She is married and has a one year old son named Diego Aldair. Elena wants to invest more into her taxi because there is always one thing or another that keeps breaking down. She wants to make repairs so that it keeps operating and she can continue to generate more revenue. With her loan, Elena will buy motor oil, antifreeze, tires, and spare parts. Her goal is to get ahead along with her husband so that they can provide everything that her son needs. She says she feels very at ease with the other members because she has known them for a long time.

Elena is pleased that organizations such as Kiva and Fundación Realidad exist to help people succeed in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motor oil, antifreeze, tires, and spare parts

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. S., age 37, is a modest villager who has been living in Phnom Penh for years. Presently she owns a few rooms that she rents to garment workers for a fee. In addition, her husband works as an internal staff member for an embassy. The family takes care of three children who are attending the public local school. S. wants to buy a small farm but does not have enough money saved. S. decided to ask for a loan, which will enable her to afford to purchase the land. She will rent the new land to farmers for extra profit.

loans.use: To buy a small farm

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 47 years old and lives with his wife and son in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, Javlavtsogzol, is 8 years old and attends a local secondary school.

Byambasuren operates a motorcycle repairing and soldering business in his town. He has been operating his business since 1990, and has steadily expanded it and become a experienced repairer and solderer. With his earnings, he has been paying university tuition fees for his two older children and he was able to purchase a ger for them to live in while away from home. 

Byambasuren has been planning to purchase his own workplace for the repairing center in the future. Byambasuren is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. He says, “I like to say the Mongolian quote: 'Right mind, right action.' In addition, I have a loyal customer base and I always try to communicate effectively with my customers. ”  

Byambasuren is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase more equipment and spare parts for his soldering and motorcycle repairing business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and spare parts

loans.name: José Mercedes

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama José Mercedes C. A. es casado y tiene un hijo el cual esta bajo su cargo, don José es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 6 años desempeñándose en el cargo de recolector en el tren de aseo.
Don José es el tercer crédito que solicita y que se le otorga y esta vez es para compra de un Freezer, ya que su señora quiere vender hielo en su casa de habitación esto con el fin de obtener otros ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Este Sr. Se llama José Mercedes C. A. es casado y tiene un hijo el cual esta bajo su cargo, don José es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 6 años desempeñándose en el cargo de recolector en el tren de aseo. Don José es el tercer crédito que solicita y que se le otorga y esta vez es para compra de un Freezer, ya que su señora quiere vender hielo en su casa de habitación esto con el fin de obtener otros ingresos para el hogar.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra Electrodoméstico ( Freezer)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Rostislav

texts.en:
Rostislav is single. He lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. He runs a small venture selling home appliances in his home town. He has been in this business for 4 years. His little store is popular in Beregovo. People respect Rostislav for the high-quality merchandise he offers. Currently, he has 50,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. His net profit is 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Rostislav is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise. He hopes that additional lending assistance will help him diversify the products he offers for sale in his store. Rostislav is prompt with payments. He has a serious and responsible business approach which has laid a solid foundation for consistent development of his enterprise. We are hoping he will get timely financial support, which is so crucial for him.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Kassipin

texts.fr:
Madame Kassipin Traoré est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Madame Kassipin n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école c’est pour cela qu’elle s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman. Après biens d’années d’apprentissage, elle s’est spécialisée dans la fabrication de savons traditionnels et l’exerce pour elle-même depuis maintenant plus de 20 ans. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, Madame Kassipin n’a pas pris du temps pour faire  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 3 ans.  Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés correctement, elle  est à son troisième  prêt  individuel dont les deux précédents ont été bien remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt servira à acquérir, 5 barriques de déchet d’huile alimentaire pour la fabrication du savon à Koutiala. Elle  effectue sa vente dans les différents quartiers de Koutiala à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kassipin Traoré is 48 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives in a polygamous family in the Hamdallaye district of the Koutiala Prefecture (Sikasso Region). Mrs. Traoré did not have an opportunity to go to school, and this is why she had started learning trade skills from her mother from an early age on. After many years of training, she decided to specialize in the preparation of traditional homemade soaps, which she has been doing on her own for over 20 years now. In order to meet her customers’ expectations as to both quantity and quality, Kassipin lost no time in getting in touch with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she joined 3 years ago. After four solidarity (group) loans, all duly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. The previous individual loans have also been properly repaid. This loan will allow her to purchase in Koutiala five barrels of cooking oil waste needed to make soap. She sells her wares in different quarters of Koutiala to a customer base composed of women and men, for cash and on credit. She hopes to achieve a monthly income of 85,000 West African Francs, which she will use to repay the interest on her loan, contribute to the everyday family expenses and reinvest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food oil waste

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M. is a widow who lives in Gilside, Barangay Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a General Store and Pig fattening. 

Letecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letecia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,300 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 22nd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to buy more inventory for her general store business. This will allow her to continue to save up for their future and for the expansion of their business. Letecia M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Luz León es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe la misma que se caracteriza por sus paisajes, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a la ciudad y también  a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.

La Señora Luz se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha para criar animales como pollo, chanchos, borregos y vacas, sus animales los vende en su propia parroquia, también se dedica a cultivar sus tierras.

Nuestra socia tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y le ayudan en la economía de su hogar, su esposo trabaja en una sastrería y con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Es nuestra socia fundadora hace 13 años y con el nuevo crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de mas cuyes y así crecer en su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es poder recuperar su salud.
texts.en:
Luz León is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) Communal Bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish, which is known for its landscapes. The people devote themselves to farming and livestock. Much of the population has migrated to the city and to various places in the world looking for a better quality of life for their families. Luz devotes herself to the household chores, and she takes advantage of the opportunity to raise animals. She raises animals like chickens, pigs, sheep, and cows. She sells the animals in her own parish. She also cultivates her land. Our member is 59 years old, married, and has two grown children. They work and help with the household finances. Her husband works as a tailor. Thanks to their mutual efforts, they were able to build their own home. Thirteen years ago she was a founding member. She will use the new loan to buy more guinea pigs. This way she will enlarge her business. Her greatest dream is to be able to regain her health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Regina Mardeli

texts.es:
Regina es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos menores de edad en el sector El Sandial, una centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace cuatro años en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en done vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, de este modo garantiza el rapido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que le permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.

Regina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ovejas con las cuales piensa trabajar del mismo modo: engordándolas y vendiéndolas en la misma zona, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a EdpymeAlternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Con el préstamo ella podrá ampliar su negocio y nivel de ventas, asimismo la calidad de vida de su familia mejorará. Regina es una mujer trabajadora y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Regina is a 29-year-old mother that lives along with her husband and two under-age children in the Sandial sector, a rural population center of the district of Pítipo. This is an agricultural district of the province of Ferreñafe, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Regina has been dedicated to breeding smaller animals for four years in her residence. When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors and to the businessmen that always visit the place where she lives. She feeds her animals with concentrated food and fodder, in this way she guarantees the rapid growth of her animals, which permits her to market them in better way and to receive greater profits. Regina desires to expand her business with the purchase of sheep which she plans to work in the same way: fattening and selling them in the same zone;. To achieve her objective she has seen the need for the first time to request a loan of 500 new soles from EdpymeAlternativa. With the loan she will be able to expand her business and her level of sales, and likewise improve the quality of life of her family. Regina is a hard-working woman, well thought of by her neighbors and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: A. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 4 ans et maîtrise le contour de cette activité. elle fait son commerce au marché local d'agoè atsanvé. son stock de marchandises est en baisse. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 4 cartons de mèches amina, des perruques et divers produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. makes money running a shop selling cosmetic products. She has been running this shop for 4 years and has mastered the complicated aspects of the business. She runs her shop at the local market of Agoè Atsanvé. Her stock of goods is low. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 4 boxes of Amina hair extensions, wigs and various other beauty products.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda M., 46, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio M., a mechanic, and is mother to a five young adults, four of whom are already working while the youngest is in college. By the grace of God, Melinda has managed to support all her children’s educational needs. As of the present time, she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her youngest child’s college education.

Melinda operates an auto-repair shop. Her husband is the main mechanic while she handles the finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair, check-ups and beautification of all types of cars, jeepneys and any type of vehicle that is referred to them.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 Philippine pesos loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like wiring, putty paint and others of the like. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings.*  

Melinda dreams to be able to give her child a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy supplies like wiring, putty paint and others of the like

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man living with his parents and 2 siblings. He is from Lebanon.  Despite his young age, he started working as a furniture painter 5 years ago.  In parallel, he is attending university. 

He works hard to manage his time between his business and his education. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his university fees. He is studying tourism and is in his second year of school.

In the future, he is planning to work in a travel agency or in an airline company because he likes to travel a lot.

loans.use: To pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry D. is from the village of Namabbalan West, Tuguegarao City. He is 34 years old. Larry is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Larry owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motorcycle transport in the local community. Larry has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Larry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Larry is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to repair  the vehicle used for business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Larry from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Togoontumur

texts.en:
Togoontumur S. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two adult aged sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son attends university while her youngest and her husband both help out with Togoontumur's business. 

She has operated a dairy product retail business in her town at the local market since 1995. She sells a fermented milk in the summer months, and during the fall and winter months she sells a variety of dairy products. After many years of successful operation, she has not only gained much experience but also a wide range of customers. 

Her earnings have enabled her to pay her sons' tuition fees. Togoontumur is a very open minded and hardworking woman, she says, " I am very glad that my business has helped me to improve greatly our family's standard of living" She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: María Ricardina

texts.es:
María Ricardina es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hija de dos años (junto con ella en la fotografía). Reside en el sector San Pedro Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, por un lado se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ovejas, las cuales engorda y luego ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, los cuales vende a las empresas procesadoras que están instaladas en la zona. Los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer que desea trabajar y salir adelante para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
María Ricardina is a 22 year old mother who lives with her husband and 2 year old daughter (who is with her in the photo above). She lives in the San Pedro Hualtaco neighborhood, in the agricultural District of Tambogrande, which belongs to the Piura Province, and is in a region with the same name. This area is less than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. 

Maria works in agriculture. Firstly, she raises and sells small cattle, like sheep, which she fattens and then sells to merchants who tend to visit the region. Additionally, she has a small plot of farm land where she plants lemons and mangos, which she sells to processing plants that operate in the region. The income she receives from these activities is used to help her husband with the financial support of their household. 

Maria would like to purchase fertilizers to maintain her crop, and because of this she has solicited for the first time a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a woman who wants to work and get ahead in life to improve her family’s quality of life. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to maintain her crop.

loans.name: Xochicalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Xochicalco, se ubica en el estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por el  importante sitio arqueológico Xochicalco, que significa el lugar de la casa de las flores, este lugar fue fundado en los años 650-900. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.La Sra. Mercedes S., es integrante del grupo, se dedica a la venta de comida,  negocio que inicio hace tres años, solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos. Mercedes tiene 30 años, estudio hasta el 6o año de primaria, es casada tiene un total de 3 hijos todos varones de 10,8 y 6 años de edad respectivamente. Su puesto es ambulante, es decir vende la comida fuera de su casa, y en la escuela de la comunidad. Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque es la primera vez que se le otorgará un crédito, quiere este crédito para comprar insumos no perecederos  como aceite y arroz que utiliza para la elaboración de su comida, también espera que con las ganancias pueda comprar una mesita o pintura para la fachada de su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called “Xochicalco” and located in the State of Morelos in Mexico. The community is known for the important archaeological site of Xochicalco, which means “the place of the house of flowers”. This place was founded between the years of 650-900.

This group consists of nine members. Sra. Mercedes S. is a member of the group. She sells food and started her business three years ago. Mercedes is married and has three children, all sons who are 10, 8, and 6 respectively. She sells food from a mobile stand that she parks outside of her house and at the community school. Upon submitting her loan request, Mercedes felt happy because this is the first time she is being given credit. She wants to use this loan to buy nonperishable supplies such as oil and rice for preparing her dishes. In addition, she hopes to use her earnings to buy a small table and paint for the façade of her house.

loans.use: Purchase oil & rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos H. D. V. D. 56 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y un hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. diferentes tipos D.  frutas D. estación, así mismo comercializa miel pura D. abeja. El negocio se encuentra a las afueras D. su hogar, la cual esta ubicada sobre la calle principal D. Ahuachapán por lo que su venta es muy visible para la mayoría D. personas que transitan por la zona. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar fruta por mayor y así mismo para comprar más miel. Ella espera mejorar en gran manera sus ganancias ya que estas son D. mucha importancia para la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
María Santos H. D. V., age 56, resides in the Department of Ahuachapán with her husband and son. She sells different types of seasonal fruits as well as pure honey. Her business is located outsiD. of her home, which is situated along the main street in Ahuachapán and visible by most of the people who pass through the area.

María is requesting a loan in order to buy fruit in bulk and more honey. She hopes to greatly improve her earnings since they are of great importance to her household finances.

loans.use: Purchase fruit & honey to sell

loans.name: Jose Hugo

texts.es:
Jose tiene una camioneta que la utiliza para transporta mercadería y otras actividades de transporte. Viviendo en paraíso de la flor un lugar caracterizado por sus caminos de tierra y lomas ha trabajado durante varios años. 

Con unos ahorros se compro la camioneta y ahora la misma le servir como fuente principal de ingresos para su familia. Con ayuda de su esposa que vende productos y cosméticos ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos que están estudiando en una escuela fiscal. El quiere continuar con su vehiculo por eso quiere el préstamo para hacerle reparaciones y comprar algunos repuestos para el carro. 

En el futuro quiere seguir con un trabajando y tener un buen índice crediticio para continuar con sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
José has a truck which he uses for transporting merchandise and also for other transport activities.  He lives in Paraíso de la Flor, a place which is noted for its dirt roads and hills.  José has been in this business for several years.

José bought his truck with some savings and now it serves as the main source of income for his family.  With the help of his wife, who sells products and cosmetics, José has been able to support his three children who are studying in a public school.  He would like to continue working with his vehicle and would like a loan to do some repair work on it and buy some spare parts.

In the future, he would like to continue working and obtain a good credit rating so that he can continue pursuing his goals and dreams.

loans.use: To buy tools.  To do repair work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Khin's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes 10 members who are located in Chong Kaoh village, Kandal province. The members of this loan selected Mrs. Khin C., 46 years old, as the village bank president. They hope that the loans will increase their income to improve their family living. Mrs. Khin C. and her husband, Mr. Cheng Eang, are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare plot of land that they use to cultivate rice and different vegetables to sell. But they don’t have enough money to grow items on the farm. So, Mrs. Khin C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate rice and vegetables. Aside from farming, they also own a small coffee shop to earn a living. This couple is working hard to support their five children. One of the children is a laborer, one is a coffee shop seller, one is a farmer, one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the youngest one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to cultivate rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Yosein  Sander

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES  UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Yosein Sander; el tiene 18 años de edad, soltero; el socio se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi el trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y tardes, esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento el socio ya que más adelante espera poder estudiar alguna carrera profesional pero por ahora él desea hacer un pequeño capital para más adelante estudiar tranquilo, el socio es una persona muy perseverante y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro y para regularizar algunos documentos que le faltan de su licencia de conducir.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yosein belongs to the Mujeres Unidas ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Yosein Sander is 18 and single. He offers a taxi service, working every day, morning and afternoon. This is the only job that he does at the moment, and in the future he hopes to be able to study for a professional degree. However, at the moment he wants to make some money for the future in order to study without worry. He is a very persevering person with a great desire to succeed.

He is requesting this loan for maintenance for his car and to legalize some documents that he needs for his driver's license.

He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: he is requesting this loan for car maintenance and to legalize some documents that he still needs for his driver's license.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos Antonio trabaja actualmente en su vivienda se dedica a la venta de carne. Vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a su vivienda por el buen servicio la calidad que le brinda además Marcos ha sido un hombre muy emprendedor que disfruta de este medio de vida.  El sale todos los días temprano a ofrecer este producto a cierto clientes también sus hijos le ayudan a realizar ciertas ventas. El solicita este crédito para compra de una gran variedad de carne, el sueño de él es poder terminar la construcción de un local adecuado.
texts.en: Marcos Antonio currently works in his home selling meat. He lives with his wife and his four children. The majority of his customers always come to his home for the good service and the quality that he offers. Besides, Marcos has been a very hard working man that enjoys this way of life. He goes out early every morning to offer his product to certain customers. Also, his children help him with some of his sales. He is asking for this loan to purchase a large variety of meat. His dream is to be able to complete the construction of an adequate store.

loans.use: Money for work

loans.name: Shogado

texts.en: Shogado is married and lives with his wife and five children. He sells men's clothing at the central market. Shogado has been in this business for 14 years. He is young and full of energy to develop this business further, for it is the only income in their family. Shogado would like to borrow $1500 US to increase his clothing assortment. He plans to increase sales during the coming spring season and he needs to get ready for it. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Chaulisma Group

texts.en:
The rural communal bank “Virgen del Carmen” is in its third loan cycle at FINCA Peru. Located in the Ayavi district of Huancavelica Province in Peru, its members work in agriculture, livestock, rabbit-breeding and sales, and food sales.

Bank-member Sonia has a business selling prepared foods. A married mother of five children, aged 7 to 17 and all in school, she has been selling prepared food from her home for five years to truck drivers. Sonia will be using her loan of 600 PEN to purchase food ingredients, plates and other household items. She would like to open an organized and well-staffed restaurant one day with a broad menu. Since being a member of FINCA Peru she has been able to increase the quantity of food she sells and is now able to offer breakfast, lunch and dinner.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, plates and household items
